text: "This joint's still open? Must be a scam. Went there twice. Both times, cramped, rude service, and food poisoning. That's all I gotta say."

"A plague upon this wretched inn, where I didst stay for my birthday in vain. The savings coupons, a paltry sum of eight hundred dollars, were naught but a ruse, save for a single free repast. The accommodations, poor and scant, didst lack a refrigerator and microwave, and the elevators, a veritable nightmare. Moreover, strangers, with nary a care for privacy, didst knock upon my door, seeking drugs, and I didst reply, 'Not in my chamber, good sir, try the rappers next door.' The nearby shops didst charge exorbitant prices for basic necessities, such as five dollars and fifty cents for a two-liter of soda, or fifteen dollars for a half-pint of spirits. Aye, anything affordable lay a mile and a half distant, through foul alleys and catwalks, requiring sturdy walking shoes, not dainty heels, fair ladies. Farewell, this wretched place, and may good fortune guide thee elsewhere."
"Good grub. Ask for Elham, she's a swell server. Skip the rest, it's not worth it. Head to DW Bistro next door instead."
"Sunday closures? Bad move. Religion and commerce don't mix. Keep 'em separate."

"Food so bad it's criminal. Coconut shrimp, rubbery and flavorless. Waitress brings out prime rib, medium rare when we asked for well done. She offers to recook it, what a joke. Don't waste your time or money at this dump."

"Went to the Wells Fargo branch to settle some affairs of my late husband's. Asked for help, but they wouldn't give it. Said it was up to the manager's discretion, whatever that means. Called their customer service, got some runaround about federal regulations. They wouldn't even take checks from a government agency or recognize court documents. What a joke. That place is toxic. Closed my accounts and said goodbye to Wells Fargo for good."

"Bouchon used to be one of my top picks in Vegas. Not anymore. Tonight sealed the deal. Our party of six sent two entrees back - both short ribs, fatty as hell. Replaced 'em with lamb and strip steak. Better, but still subpar for a place with Keller's rep. Other dishes? Meh. Duck, gnocchi, forgettable. Overpriced too. Bouchon needs to step up its game. Won't be going back."

"Bought my grandma a kare kare to-go, but the portion was tiny. Called to complain, and the lady on the phone asked if I was a regular and if I was Filipino. Doesn't matter, I pay the same price, I deserve a decent serving. Never going back."

"Mind playing tricks, wondering if real or fantasy. Bought detailing package for mid-size SUV through Groupon. Impossible to reach them, like grasping at air. Called, texted, but silence echoed back. Set up two appointments, both came and went without a trace. Don't bother, save your time. Hoping Groupon refunds my cash, then I'll DIY."
"Service was shit. Took 'em 25 minutes to bring out salads, over an hour for pizza. Saw tables turn twice 'fore we got our grub."

"Terrible service at 3 PM on a slow day. No one checked on us for 15 minutes, and we stood up front waiting. Once seated, Luke, our server, was great. He made solid drink and taco recommendations. The street corn appetizer was a waste of four bucks. Small, oily, and lacking flavor. I expected more for the price. I had shrimp and Al Pastor tacos with saffron rice and burnt plantains. The tacos were decent, but the plantains were overcooked and stuck together. The saffron rice had hard rice clusters. Disappointing experience overall. Giving the South Park location a try."

"Four years passed before I returned to that accursed restaurant. The Bloody Mary, once a delight, had become a bitter disappointment. It left me heaving at the airport, and the memories still lingered upon my return home. Sigi, our charming server, couldn't salvage the disaster. The food, covered in sterling silver, resembled a failed art project from a preschooler's hand. My chicken noodle soup? Sweet and unappetizing, with undercooked pasta and dirty carrots. Spicy buffalo wings? Dry and flavorless, breaking apart into soft lumps. Even a seasoned inmate would turn up their nose. I suffered for twelve hours afterward, regretting my decision to dine there. Skip America, indeed."

"Techno beat pulsed through my skull like a jackhammer, relentless and unforgiving. No respite, no variation, just the same monotonous rhythm that made me want to pull my hair out. And don't even get me started on the lack of R&B or hip-hop. It was like they were trying to torture me with their narrow-minded playlist. I mean, what kind of establishment doesn't have some sort of diversity in their music selection? It was like they were trying to drive me insane. Needless to say, I didn't stick around too long."
"Burger joint disappoints. Fries, too greasy. No ketchup or mustard. Sun beats down, staff doesn't give a damn. Service, meh. Can't finish burger. Overhyped, overpriced."

"Cici's or Homestyle buffet fan? You'll dig Orleans'. It's a real treat. I ate there gratis and won't be back. Other Vegas buffets, same price, better quality. Don't waste your dough. Most things I tried were near inedible. Bad use of time."

"Lost? Get outta here, pronto! This joint's poison, the grub'll rot yer gut and the hooch'll turn yer brain to mush. They call it a 'holiday menu,' but it's just a buncha hooey at $35 ($45 with taxes and tips). Total rip-off."

"Hundreds of restaurants, seen 'em all. But this one? Worst. Thirty seconds in, felt like they didn't care. Twenty minutes to get acknowledged? Ridiculous. Saw other couples get the same treatment. Walked out, along with two others. Disgrace to hardworking owners who give a damn. Food? Garbage. Meat on the plate? They couldn't even be bothered to use tongs. Cheapskates. Avoid this dump at all costs."

"Aria's buffet? Forget it. Waste of time and money. Water didn't arrive 'til we finished eating. Waitress? Pushy, rude. Only thing she said was 'want wine?' The spread was small, food was bland. By the time we sat down, it was cold. Aria's got money, but their buffet's a failure. Customer service? Non-existent. Don't waste your cash. Wynn's the better choice."

"Terrible customer service at Justice. Couldn't find a thing. Sat on the floor, sorted through shorts, no one helped. Bins cluttered the aisles. Finally, an associate showed up, suggested some items. Too little, too late. Won't be back."

"Came here a few months back. Won't be comin' back, that's for sure. Food and service? Slow, real slow. Nothin' special 'bout the grub either. Small portions, looked like hell. Nachos and beer? Forget about it."

"I got a 'lean machine' from some joint, and man, it was vile. Tasted like they dumped a whole pharmacy into it. Made my hairs stand up and gave me the shakes. I tried mixin' it up, but no dice. It was a waste of cash, had to toss it. Never again, buddy. Don't you dare order that swill."

"Sunday night, 7pm. Place was dead. Took 'em a while to seat us. Tea came slow. Bread too. Waited 35 minutes for basic grub. My wife, she got mad. We bounced. Wanted to pay for the tea on the way out, but that took ages too. Thought with the prices they charge and the emptiness, service'd be decent. Learned why it was empty. Next door to Cheddars, had a real meal."

"Hell's bells, I never thought I'd find myself at a joint that sucked this bad. The security? Total butt-suckers. Rude as hell, unfriendly as a rabid dog. I've been to high-end clubs, dive bars, hired and fired security, but this place takes the cake. They're so rude, it's laughable. Got shoved outta there, hard. Some fat dude pinched my arm and told me I was getting escorted out 'cause I had my boot off and couldn't put it back on ( thanks to the crowd floating in the air). What the actual hell? Been to exclusive clubs in London and NY, this place is worse than a finger up my butt. I'd rather have my butt hair plucked than go back there. It's a damn shame, too. Great setting, awesome dancers, fantastic DJ, nice promoters, bartenders with smiles. But those security jerks? No way, man. Never going back, and neither should you."

"Avoid this airport like the plague. Terminals spread out like a damn army base. People movers? Forget about 'em. Broken more often than not. Bathrooms? Don't even think about it. Hallway barely big enough for one person. You'll be lucky to make it through without a fight. And don't get me started on last-minute gate changes and slow-ass jetways. This place gives me the heebie-jeebies."

"Mia Za's screwed up our order again. Last time, they added nuts to my wife's salad. I told 'em she's allergic. They took it back, picked the nuts off, and brought it back. Not good enough. I told 'em to make a new one. They got snotty with me."

"Took the fam to this joint for Mother's Day, and boy, was it a bust. They were understaffed, overbooked, and the heat was sweltering. Fans were busted, misters weren't working yet. Servers were too busy to even fill our water glasses. And we had to wait 30 minutes for our table, which was just a generic, mass-produced mess. To top it off, the hostess burst into the bathroom, letting out a colorful language when she found both stalls occupied. Problem was, my five-year-old niece was in one of 'em. Staff's behavior? Manic and panicked. Sorry to give 'em a bad review, but they let me down hard."

"Terrible hotel. Worst in Vegas. Locked out twice. Wasted hour. Smelly burrito in fridge. Offered $50 credit. Small rooms. Small casino. Tiny pool. No reason to stay. Never again. Wynn/Encore owns it."

"Walmart's alright late at night. Otherwise, it's a mess. Welfare mothers, screaming kids, complaining about their food stamps. Not worth it. Target's better. Cleaner, less ghetto. Friendly cashiers too."

"Booked our suite five months ago. Show up to check in, they tell us we've been downgraded. What kind of hotel pulls that crap? Never book here, folks. You don't know what you're getting till you're already screwed."
"This dump's the worst. Filthy, dishonest, poorly run. I wouldn't stay here again for all the cash in the world."

"Sakana? Good reviews? Maybe I hit it on an off night. Service was slow, forgetful. Hostess seemed impatient. Food? Underwhelming. Just variations of the California roll. And lots of imitation crab. If you're sushi-starved and don't mind fake crab, give it a shot."

"A Groupon, prithee, didst I purchase, based on Yelp's fair words,
For this salon, with hopes of sweet rebirth.
The stylist, a nervous novice, didst seem,
As if his shears, for the first time, didst gleam.

His hands, they shook, and his pace, it was slow,
As if he never had cut hair, I do know.
And when I asked, what was the cost,
The receptionist, with a smile, didst boast,

'Twas but $35, a paltry sum, indeed,
For a service, worth $70, in their creed.
I saved but $5, a meager amount,
Yet still, my anger, doth now surmount.

For they do reserve, their best stylists,
For those who pay, the full price, they insist.
And thus, dear Folicle, take heed,
Lest thou lose clients, by thy deceit."

"A barber shop most vile and wretched, where haircuts doth take an age. Forty-five minutes, aye, an hour, or more, they doth tarry, as if time itself didst stand still. Methinks these barbers doth not care for gold or riches, else they wouldst hasten their pace. But if thou hast three hours to spare, then mayhap this place shall be thy haven."

"I ain't gonna lie, I regret spendin' my cash at that joint. But I learned my lesson, and I won't be steppin' foot in there again. The grub was subpar (Pinky's up the street serves way better fare), the service was crummy (slow and snotty), and the management? Forget about it. If anyone asks, I'll send 'em to Pinky's and make sure my foodie pals know where to grab a real burger on Montford. Don't waste your dough...\n\nAnd let me tell you, those reviewers who claim they've got great burgers clearly haven't been to Brooks (Charlotte's answer to Price's Chicken Coop) or The Liberty (high-end burgers that'll blow your mind). Zack's, too."
"Tiny portions, high prices. Ordered OJ, got a shot glass. Bill came, OJ cost seven bucks, bagel five. That's a tourist trap."
"Terrible Chinese Chicken Salad. Three scrawny chicken bits. More like a garden mess. Never again."
"Sienna van, worst experience. Warranty through them, they said fix, rental car too. Next day, dishonored word. Back and forth, still broke. Drove a block, worse. Called, no callback."

"Food unfit for an emperor, cook deserves beheading. Buffet in Imperial Palace, long walk from Vegas strip. Waste of time, should've checked Yelp first. Crab claws mediocre, veggies wilted, lobster bisque too salty, prime rib dry. Food sat tepid, not rotated quick enough. Waitstaff ignored me, had to grab own drinks. No stars, wouldn't return."

"I stepped into the salon, already feeling uneasy. Asked for a full set with polish, but the man said no. I was upset, but kept quiet. Earlier that day, I had called to confirm they took Discover. When I went to pay with my debit card, they said they didn't accept it. Unbelievable. I handed over a different card and left a five-dollar tip in cash. My nails looked uneven and not what I wanted. Never going back to that dump. The place was old, dirty, and tacky. Horrible customer service and questionable hygiene. Not worth the cheap price."

"Wanted to like the joint, but it was a disaster from start to finish. Staff didn't know their ass from their elbow. Food took forever and was burnt to a crisp. Not going back. It's a shame, but that's how it goes sometimes."
"Place ain't worth the dough. Been here a few times, grub's never been good, portions small. Skip it, save your cash and taste buds."

"Terrible grub. Cheap, sure, but not worth the savings. Better to pay a bit more for flavor and quality like at Boulder or Fiesta. Cannery Row's offerings? Tasteless, overcooked, and dry. Don't waste your time or money. Use your coupons elsewhere. There's better options for the same price."

"Reserved a table, had other plans. Got there, waited twenty minutes. They said the folks at our table weren't done yet. Like they got just one table. Told 'em we were short on time. They didn't give a damn. Food was good, but that's not the point. Keeping the reservation, that's key."

"Vegas and Summerlin. Not exactly known for authentic Korean cuisine. But still, you'd think they could get the basics right. Like gochujang sauce for bibim bap. A staple, for crying out loud! I asked for it, and the waitress didn't have a clue. Overpriced, watered-down Korean fare. It's like they're trying to fool people into thinking they're getting the real deal. Shameful."

"I called, told the receptionist my situation, and made an appointment. Got there at 1:10 for a 1:20 appointment. They didn't call me back until 2. The PA said they couldn't help me. I reminded her that I had already explained my reason for coming to the receptionist. Her excuse was that the girl I spoke to was new and had been left alone for a week. Unbelievable. Now I have to go elsewhere for the test. Lesson learned: be explicit about your needs and double-check they understand them."

"Everyone raves about this joint, but I just don't see it. I gave it three chances, hoping I was wrong. But no, it's still a disappointment. The ahi poke is way too salty. You can't screw up poke like that and call yourself a Hawaiian restaurant."

"Ramen bowl, inedible broth. Tasted like water and oil. No condiments on the table. Took 15 minutes to flag someone down for soy sauce. Total rip off for $12. Inauthentic and not palatable without loads of condiments. Go to Umami or Ha Long Bay for better, cheaper noodles."
"Ordered takeout, been there before. But this time, terrible. Charged 12 bucks for a medium pizza, was expecting less. Asked for well-done, got too much cheese. Disappointment."

"Alas, the pasta of the day didst lack all flavor,
A sorry sight indeed, devoid of savor.
The pizza of Regina Marg didst fare a bit better,
But still, 'twas not enough to make me linger.

Their concept, I do understand, and their intent,
To serve dishes fresh and with a gentle bent.
But alack, the service, oh so poor,
Didst leave a sour taste, and not a little bore.

I chanced upon a pie place nearby,
And there, my friends, didst find a culinary spree.
So if thou seekest sustenance of the highest order,
Look not to this place, but to the one across the border."

"Thieves and liars, the lot of 'em. ADRE and other small biznesses got complaints piled high against 'em. Can't pay their rent, can't account for deposits, can't even be bothered to answer a phone call. Don't believe me? Check their rep for yourself. Local management knows all about 'em. Surprised if they last till next year."

"Slow service. Meals lacked condiments - ketchup for burgers, steak sauce for T-bones. Food got cold while we waited. Drinks were only refilled once. The food was flavorless, buns were stale, fries overcooked. Won't be back."

"O, woe is me! How impolite these folk do be!
A hundred dollars more, they did demand of me,
To make the scratches disappear, like magic, see?
And leave the car with a shiny, new-like sheen.
But lo, I didst not fall for their deceitful scheme,
For I had heard of their ill repute, it doth seem.
So, with a heavy heart, I didst give them a rating,
A poor one, at that, for their uncivil behavior."
"Awful joint. Name change, same crummy grub. Piles of onions, not much else. Better options abound. Won't be back."

"Place was jammed, five o'clock crowd. Expected a wait, but saw plenty of open tables in the middle. More than enough waiters, too. Counted seven, twenty occupied tables. Don't know any waiter who'd work with just three tables for a decent night's pay. Waited forty-five minutes, finally got sat down. Food took an hour, still didn't get our drinks 'cause the waitress never came back after we ordered. Maybe she was on her period. Food was good, but overpriced for the small portion. Not worth it after two and a half hours."

"Sunday night, my wife and I went for a late dinner. Been here before, food's alright, service was good too. But this time? Terrible. Sat there for 20 minutes, nobody came by. Got up, asked one of the girls at the front for help, she didn't do squat. Finally, a waiter shows up, says hi, and bounces. Busy? They weren't. Not going back, wouldn't recommend it either."

"I've been in this store twice, and both times I've been let down. Last time, they showed me a tiny pink gun, like I'm some kind of joke. This time, I came because their website said they had a full selection of 5.11 gear. But all we found was one polo shirt. And get this - they still had a sign up for a 2-day sale from May, and it's now June. Not a single employee bothered to talk to us. I'll stick to other stores, where they know how to treat customers right."

"Went there last night. First and last time. Husband had chicken marsala. Tough as shoe leather. Son had fettuccine Alfredo. Flavorless. Like plain noodles. Shared a pizza with the other two boys. Greasy. Crust like concrete. Not worth the 65 bucks."
"Terrible service. Reserved for 7:45, pushed to 8:15. Finally sat at 9. Wait staff slow. Out at 11. Never again."

"I wasn't impressed. Wanted to try the ostrich and elk burgers 'cause I'd never had 'em before and didn't know if I could get 'em elsewhere in Vegas. But they were dry, like the cook didn't know what they were doin' or the meat just wasn't good. My buddy said the regular burgers were better than the game meats. Salmon burger was alright too. Not worth it though, 13 bucks for a small ostrich burger that wasn't even good with fries and a drink, almost 20 bucks total. Wouldn't go back."

"By th' Lord above, good sir, avoid this BK,
'Tis filthy, crawling with vagrants, and pests doth infest.
Many a soul hath fallen ill, their meal didst not agree,
If thou dost crave Burger King, seek elsewhere to dine."
"Overrated, huge but bad. Found hair in food, burped all day. $45 plus tip for two adults and kids. Never going back."

"A half dozen of these donuts we didst try,
Greasy and pretentious, they didst lie.
We didst not finish any, I do declare,
For their texture was stale and their taste most queer.
I cannot believe I speak ill of a donut,
But these, my friends, were most unworthy of note.
We hated them, each and every one,
And left them uneaten, for they were undone."

"Wal-Mart Supercenter, 24-hr joint, ain't exactly the Ritz. Pro: decent tire deal. Con: dirty, grumpy staff, always outta basics, self-checkout's a pain, receipt-checkin' like they own the place. Try Marks St. instead, cleaner, better stocked. Winco's for grub."

"Skip the glowing reviews from staff, this joint's no good. Overpriced drinks, screwed up orders, racist bouncers at night. Unbelievable in this day and age. Owners and managers enable discrimination. Give it a few months, it'll be gone. Canteen was better."

"Phoenix restaurants ain't impressed me much. Latest place, service was piss poor. Server's visits were brief, like they had somewhere better to be. We'd ask for stuff, they'd vanish, leaving us hanging. Food arrived, decent. Turkey eggs benedict, potatoes, fresh fruit. But that's where the good ended. No utensils, no condiments, no coffee refills. Place needs a total staff overhaul. Food ain't enough to keep 'em afloat."
"Rating's a negative five stars, selection's crap. Staff's rude, made snide remarks in Chinese. Good thing my wife's Japanese, she caught their bullshit. Reporting 'em to the BBB for being dicks."
"Sushi rolls fell apart, no authentic flavor. Gross, really warm and drowned in creamy sauce. Sloppy display, maybe due to closing time. Smells musty, day-old fish. Won't be back."

"A pox upon this tavern, false and foul,
That claims to be a haven for the bold,
But in truth, 'tis naught but a den of woe,
Where strumpets sip their grog, and rogues do go.

I asked the barkeep, full of hope and cheer,
How fared the Phillies, and couldst thou bring them near?
But she, with scorn and contempt in her eye,
Didst reply, "I don't care," and didst not try.

Thus, I perceived her mind, a tempest-tossed sea,
That cared not for my custom, nor for me;
So, let us leave this place, with haste and speed,
And seek a tavern where our spirits may find ease."

"Woke up to a Yelp message from Samantha A. She said the staff at Caffe Bene might not be fully trained, but her message made me want to puke. Told her she was a retard and hoped she'd never come back. People get worked up over this place? Drinks were half powder, half liquid. Haven't been back since my last visit, but haven't heard anything good. Giving it another one-star review instead of a friend who was disappointed. Don't waste your time here, go to Paradiso a block away."

"Austin, my home, doth hold a special place within my heart,
Where barbecue and Tex-Mex doth reign supreme, a culinary art.
But now, in this new land, I find myself quite lost,
With naught but bland fare to tempt my taste, at any cost.

The atmosphere, I must confess, didst please mine eyes,
And our waitress, with her wit, didst bring some surprise.
But alas, the food, it didst not live up to its billing,
Tasteless and unseasoned, leaving me quite fulfilling.

Chicken fried steak, a dish most dear to mine heart,
Didst fail to impress, a sorry state of affairs, a part.
No seasoning, no flavor, just a bland, dry cube,
Deep-fried and served with naught but a sad, peppery gruel.

Oh, how I yearned for a dash of salt, a sprinkle of pepper,
To bring life to the dish, and make it worth the reckoner.
But alas, it seemed they didst forget, or perhaps didst not know,
That Texans demand more, their taste buds to make glow.

So here's my advice, to all who doth listen,
Add salt and pepper, lest ye wish to be dismissin'.
For flavor, it doth make, and turns a meal into a feast,
And leaves not thy customers in a state of utter disgust and unease."

"Don't waste my time. Rude girl behind counter. No military discount, attitude. Ordered two meals, three tries. Drinks slammed on counter, almost spilled. Asked for drink carrier, none offered. Ketchup request, one packet given, asked for more, walked away, came back with one more packet. Worst lunch."

"Subway's a mess. Dirty tables, filthy john, workers don't swap gloves enough. Food's stale, cookies charred. They won't even bake more when they run out. How do you burn cookies?! Management needs to step in and clean this joint up."
"We had VIP passes, part of our premier package of 'O'. Got to the club around 12:30, and were promptly ignored. This club's got a bad case of'small' man syndrome. Bouncers? Total douche bags."

"Don't eat at McDonald's, kid. Their grub's full of GMOs. Genetically modified organisms, you know? It's like they're trying to poison us. And it's not just them, all the crappy food joints are doing it. They're putting fibers and nanotechnology in our food, tracking devices and mind control shit. Spread the word, boy. We gotta watch what we eat."
"Terrible store. Never any stock. Refuse discounts. Rude staff. Hope they go bust."

The sun beat down on my neck as I stood in the Home Depot parking lot, waiting for someone - anyone - to come and assist me in the electrical department. Thirty minutes passed, and not a single soul had bothered to lift a finger. Finally, a customer service representative sauntered over, a look of indifference plastered across his face.

"I paged the person," he said, as if that were some sort of accomplishment. "What else can I do?"

I glared at him, my anger simmering just below the surface. "You can start by getting me some help," I snapped. "I've been standing here for half an hour, and no one has bothered to even acknowledge me."

The representative shrugged, clearly unbothered by my plight. "Sorry to hear that. Maybe you should try the Val Vista store. They might be able to help you out."

I shook my head, incredulous. "You're telling me to go to another store? After I've already wasted thirty minutes of my time waiting for someone to help me here?"

He nodded, his expression still blank. "Yeah, that's what I'm saying. Sorry."

I sighed, defeated. "Fine. I'll go to the Val Vista store. But this is ridiculous. Absolutely ridiculous."

"Toby Keith should can the cooks and get some fresh blood in the kitchen. Service was good, but the grub? Forget about it. Dry ribs with no flavor and fried shrimp that tasted like a Krispy Kreme donut. Harrah's must give out free meal tickets 'cause nobody'd pay for this swill. Count me out."

"Staff at check-in was top-notch, but the view from outside was just alright. Room had some issues - electrical switches were hanging loose, paint was peeling everywhere, and the shower was a mess. Caulking was coming off, too. Not worth the price, if you ask me. TV was an old flat screen, and only half the channels worked. Breakfast was subpar, and they didn't clean up the tables, so nowhere to sit and eat. Pool area was cordoned off, and the parking lot had big chunks closed off, too. All in all, a bust. Wouldn't recommend it. When I checked out, the girl just said 'you're good to go' and kept eating her breakfast before walking away. Didn't even ask how my stay was."

"Place gone downhill. Stayed here before, great service. Not this time. Checked in for two nights, leaving after midnight first night. Room next door, forty people, drunk, screaming, jumping. Called security, nothing. Spent a lot, never again. Like a cheap Motel 6. Stay away."
"Flavors? Sub-par, all of 'em. East Valley's got nothin' on us. Icy, not smooth or flavorful. My seven-year-old wouldn't even touch hers."

"I decided to give Medshape a shot. Did my research, made an appointment for 9am. Signed in, sat down. Waited. Someone poked their head in, asked if I was there. Yeah, signed in, remember? They said they'd be right back with paperwork. Waited five minutes, then filled out the damn thing in two. Opened the door, waited some more. Had enough, got up to ask what's going on. Nobody around. Walked to the front, still nobody. Left at 10am, never saw anyone. Haven't heard from them since. Guess they don't want my business."

"Avoid this joint. Terrible service. Waitress didn't even say hello. Just grunted at us like we were inconveniencing her. Place was dark as a cave. Made me uneasy. Trash on the floor. Not my cup of tea. Didn't stick around. Won't be back."

"Cars filthy, reeking. One decent customer rep, one terrible. Girl at counter, rude, huffy, eye-rolls, argues. Comical. Dirty cars, very. Expired tag. Secret shopper needed. No one's paying attention."

"Ordered grub over phone at 6:45. They said 45 minutes. An hour passed, still nothing. Called 'em again, they claimed it was en route. Eight o'clock rolled around, still no chow. Called 'em a third time, they offered 50% off. Waited till 8:30, still empty-handed. Told 'em to shove it. Awful. Wouldn't recommend this dump to my worst enemy."

"Twas 12/23/2014, a day most fateful,
When first I penned my review, so eloquent,
Of Phoenix Music Lessons, a place of learning,
Where notes and chords did flow, like a river burning.

Months passed, and nary a word didst come,
From the owner, a man of some repute,
Until today, when forth he didst send,
A message, curious, and full of intent.

He wrote, "I thought thee a good soul,
But felt a dislike, most foul and base,
That energy, it didst trouble me sore,
And made my heart feel heavy as a stone."

His words, they didst conclude with a tale,
Of a doctor, a man of medicine and art,
Who didst perform a surgery, most skilled,
And left his patient whole, and free from hurt.

But lo, the owner, he didst not cease,
To contact me, by email and phone,
With offers of refund, and words of peace,
But I, a steadfast soul, didst none accept,
For my review, it was not made in jest,
But to warn others, and speak the truth,
That this owner, he doth not brook,
Dissenting voices, or opinions uncouth.

So here I stand, a witness true,
To the unprofessional ways,
Of one who doth not know,
The bounds of decency, and proper sway."

"In Vegas for the first time. Expecting rudeness, degeneracy, and booze. Got it all from a customer service attendant. Asked where the restroom was, she pointed and snapped, 'It says "restroom" right there, can't you read?' I apologized, said I was new and didn't know. She could've just told me instead of insulting me. Vegas is designed to distract, and they give you free drinks for gambling. Sorry if I'm enjoying myself. Just wanted some help finding the damn restroom. Norma was her name. Avoid her."

"The wait was needless, ten empty tables and still a line. Service took its sweet time, five minutes too long. Forgettable experience. Food? Overpriced. Manager, hire more servers, ones who know their worth lies in their service. Other BBQ joints, half the price, better service."
"Rented here twice, waited over an hour both times. Life's too short. Avoid."

"Danny's? Been using 'em for years. Even worked for 'em for a bit. But then something happened and I'll never step foot in there again. 

  Listen up, Arizonans. Those guys at First Take In? They're on commission, so they'll promise you the world to get you to sign. Once they've got your cash, you're screwed. Can't trust 'em. I got hit with a $200 fee, and the sales receipt said "all sales are final." What a joke. 

  And let me tell you, the workers in my car even stole all my loose change from the ashtray. Every day, they'd divide up whatever they found as tip money. Ted, the manager, denied it all. Don't waste your time with Danny's. Go somewhere else."
"Wazuzu's cheap imitation. Service? Forget it. Waiter forgot our dim sum. I reminded him, he tells me I'm a liar. Zero concern. Pricey too. Go to Encore for real deal."

"Closed, they said. Temporary, like a wound that won't heal. I checked back, hoping to find her, my favorite waitress, but she was gone. A letter from the city, official and cold, confirmed the worst. Shut down, it said. Damn shame."

"Pizza joints like this one got me shakin' my head. Folks in ritzy neighborhoods'll gobble up anything that's in their neck of the woods. Let's get real, folks. This pizza was a dud, and an overpriced one at that. Crust? Charred and burnt, what's the point? Sauce? Flavorless. Cheese? Cooked to a dry, papery mess. Pepperoni? Thick and dime-sized, not exactly Italian. And don't even get me started on the single, dried-out basil leaf. I could whip up a better pizza with a Pillsbury biscuit, ketchup, and Kraft cheese. And don't even get me started on the lack of ranch dressing. People, this is just another chain restaurant with a gimmick. Don't fall for it. Go get a real pizza, try Montesanos, Villa on Sahara and Valley View, or Metro. The noise level and bright lighting alone should be enough to turn you off. And let's not forget the nightmare of parking."

"Fourteen bucks a head left me feeling let down. Been to Vegas plenty, always wanted to hit the NYNY coaster. Thought it'd be cool, but it wasn't. More like throwing in a finny and riding the kiddie swings at Chuck E. Cheese. Not worth it. Day pass was twenty-five, and if you wanna do it twice, tack on another seven. Rip-off city. Give your cash to the homeless dude on the sky bridge instead."

"Impudent servitor, curt and brusque withal,
Didst attend me, sole patron of the shop,
In indecision, pondering purchase of a potion,
Chose chemicals and goggles, a curious lotion.

My grievance great, the liquid chlorine didst fail,
No impact on the tested levels, naught but wail.
Added another dose, six hours passed, still naught,
A strange occurrence, for my routine, oft-practiced, brought.

I called, the servant, rude, his tone didst bear,
Annoyance, that I dared to trouble him, so fair.
Laziness, a fault, that led me to this place,
Next door, a rival, of my usual space.

A mistake, most grand, I shall not return,
To Leslie's, no, my loyalty, doth burn.
The competitor, my custom, shall regain,
For years, their service, hath brought me gain."

"Sprint's got some serious issues. Coverage is spotty, apps don't work, calls drop like flies. And don't even get me started on the bills and payments. But tonight, I'm beyond livid. My iPhone dies, I charge it for 30 minutes, and still nada. Try two other chargers, zilch. So, I take it to the store, and some dude with blondish hair and black-rimmed glasses saunters up, acting like he's doing me a favor. I explain the problem, and he tells me it's working fine, and I can just buy another charger. Yeah, no thanks. I'd rather not waste my cash. Get home, charge it for an hour, still dead. Sprint needs to step up their game, get some knowledgeable employees, especially when it comes to Apple products. Guess I'll hit up the Apple Store tomorrow. Sprint and their crew? Useless."

"Ross discriminates against customers with mobility issues. No carts allowed outside. Target and Fry's don't have this policy. Same customer base. I went for a good deal on a furniture accessory, but my back issues made it impossible to carry. Told security, he said drive up. Busy area. Told cashier, nice man offered to help. One register closed for hanger stacking. Long wait. Store's dirty, disorganized, missing price tags. Never again."

"Terrible service at this joint last Tuesday night. Waitress, can's remember her name, but her sourpuss face and crummy attitude stick out. She even altered the tip on the bill, tacked on an extra $20. That's illegal, ain't it? Trying to reach the manager, but he's "busy" after my niece waited on hold for 10 minutes. Used to be a regular here, but haven't been back in over a year. Place has gone downhill, that's for sure."

The hotel looked swell from the outside, but things took a turn for the worse once we checked in. The area by the pool reeked, like something had died. Thankfully, the stench didn't reach our room, but the pool was a lost cause. Our digs were decent, but the lamps were busted and the shower curtain rod was broken. It was loud as hell too, like a herd of elephants upstairs. The plumbing was noisy, and the AC unit kept turning on and off all night. We tried room service, but the dirty dishes were still outside our door the next evening. On the bright side, the staff was friendly and helpful with our requests.

"Pizza joint in the plaza. Outside tables, nice when the weather's good. Problem is the service. Walk-up ordering, takes forever to get their attention. Been there a few times, never busy, but still get ignored. Last time, left after waiting too long. Used to be excited about the place, now it's just frustrating. Don't bother, go somewhere else."
"Climbed here four months back. Rented shoes. Got a small blister on my second toe. Still got it. Bring your own shoes. Don't want no funny growth on your toe."

Alas, my dearest friend, I must confess,
This bar didst not impress, despite its prime address.
My love and I didst venture there for lunch,
And found the service to be quite pleasant, perchance.
The waitress, kind and fair, didst recommend a feast,
A fried bologna sandwich, with fries, no less.
But lo, the sandwich, drenched in grease, didst lie,
A grilled delight, yet nigh impossible to consume, I swear.
I ate but three bites, and left the rest,
For fear of suffering from the dire effects.
My love, too, didst order fish and chips,
But alas, they were as greasy as the tips.
We paid a pretty penny, full of woe,
For heartburn's fiery torment, all day long, I do declare.
So, heed my words, good sir, and spare thy purse,
Eat at the deli, in Harrah's, of course!

"Wife and I hit Luke's for dinner, second time around. Service was piss poor, again. First time, it was just mediocre. This time, it killed the whole damn experience. Server came by, took our drink orders, then some other dude brought 'em over. Our girl came back twice, got our apps and dinner orders, then disappeared like a ghost. Didn't see her again 'til I was halfway done with my meal. No water refill, no new glass of wine. Just nothing. Took her ten minutes to process our gift card, and when she finally brought the check, no smile, no thanks. Wife and I felt bad for putting her through such trouble, feeding us and all. Food's good, but we won't be back."

"Hostesses? More like the worst. Try putting a six-year-old in the bar, see how that goes. Surly waiters, inattentive service, and food that doesn't compare to their other joints. Big letdown. Won't be coming back here, and that sucks because I was stoked when Arriba's opened up shop on my side of town. Had the white sands chimi, usually good, but where was the pork? Rice was like yesterday's leftovers, and my little bean burrito fan wouldn't touch the "yucky tortilla and spicy beans". We were done."

"Timeshare scam. BF's on phone, trying to get cash back. They hit him with tour after payment, before booking. Weekend we need is blacked out. Multi-sport tourney, 7,000 athletes. Illegal gimmicks? BF's a Hilton Honors member. Still on phone. Sounds too good, it probably is. Don't fall for it."

"7pm, appointment for a rubdown. Told to show at 6:45, filled out papers, waited in the Relaxation Room. Waited some more. 7:25, lady at the desk says they can't give me the full hour. No kidding. They forgot to sign me in, therapist didn't know I was there. Offered a scrub or aromatherapy for next time. Said they had someone else for 7:30-8:30. Had to leave at 8, so no massage for me. Somewhat sorry, but not coming back."

"Skip this joint. Dirty towels, busted pool, broken stuff in the room. Managers? Grace and Saul? Clueless. No security either. Anyone can stroll in off the street and hit the elevator. Renaissance Hotels are supposed to be better. Not here. Walk a few blocks, find a real hotel."

"Drive-thru hell. Two cars ahead of us got their grub first. We ordered two shakes and a dozen wings. Wings were drowning in sauce. No ranch, though. Finally got our food, and some zoned-out dude claimed to be the manager. Said the workers shoulda told us about the delay. Got our ranch, but no apologies. Never going back. Awful service."
"Food's good, but service should match. Rudeness breeds contempt. How's he still open? Spreadin' the word. Vegas has better options."

"High hopes for a good meal, we did. Went at breakfast time, sat in the bar. Neighbors' dishes looked great, so we ordered. Friend got chicken eggs benedict, I got fried chicken with a biscuit. Not impressed, we weren't. Left and thought, 'Wow, that was bad.' Bill was $48. Had two Bloody Mary's, friend said they were good. I tried one, took me all day to get the taste out of my mouth. Gave it to him, didn't finish it. Maybe give them another try someday, if everything else is closed."
"Not a Fry's Marketplace. No way. Place is a dump. Floors torn up, dirty as hell. Small, cramped. Forget about it."

I went to the website thinking I'd find some decent street wines - Night Train, Thunderbird, MD 20/20, Cisco. But no, they took us on some bullshit tour of vineyards and made us drink wine that cost more than twenty bucks a pop. And we didn't even get to take a nap under no bridge in Phoenix. What a waste of time and money. And I spent more than half my welfare check on it too.

"Flamingo's got its pros and cons. Pros first: location's prime, smack dab in the middle of the strip, close to other hotels for shows and conferences. Margaritaville's a great spot too, with a sweet upper deck view. The garden's a peaceful haven, flamingos and all. Staff's friendly, polite. Now, the cons: this place reeks of smoke, everywhere. I get it, I used to smoke too, but if you ask for a non-smoking room, it shouldn't smell like someone's hiding in there, puffing away. Made for a rough stay, especially with allergies. Shuttle drops you off a block away, you gotta lug your bags to the back entrance. Saw a roach near the ice machine, but that might just be 'cause some joker dumped a salad on the floor and it sat there for two days. Natural selection, right? Guy's just trying to survive. Booked a room with a fridge, got a styrofoam cooler instead. First room had a leak, light fixture in the bathroom was the culprit. They fixed it by putting the room out of order, so we had to move our stuff to another room."

"Terrible joint. Waitress didn't give a damn about our grub or our satisfaction. Overpriced, too. Not worth the pesos. Don't know what fool called it Tex-Mex. Never had the real deal, that's for sure. Skip this dump. Plenty better spots around. They charge for chips? What a joke! Hot sauce, too? Forgot to mention that in my online gripe to Cactus Jack. No response, of course. Hope this dive tanks soon and makes room for a decent eatery."

"Windshield replacement turned sour. Leaky seal ruined electronics. Second attempt, more damage. Local guy promised a fix, never called. Two weeks passed. Avoid these clowns, pay up for quality work."
"Weekends, a mess. Office folk, disorganized. Rent-a-cop, flailing arms, jabbering. Streamline the process, get 'em in and out."

"Service was crap. Took two hours, got a few dishes. Dishes were warm. Asked for check, told 'em it was 'cause of the slow service. She got mad, like it was our fault. Place mats? Printer paper. Napkins? Cheap squares. Don't wanna eat here again. Ever."

"Methinks they should pen a tome,
On how to spoil a soft taco, quite some feat.
I deemed it impossible, a culinary crime,
Yet lo, they managed, with a sorry treat.

The corn tortilla, raw and uncooked,
Tasted of naught but cardboard, alack!
The dish, a frigid mess, did naught arouse,
Save for the rice, a solitary delight.

A maiden fair, at a nearby table, did warn,
Of her own chicken taco, a woeful tale.
Why did we not heed her words of caution?
We thought the chicken, the sole cause of vexation.
But nay, we should have queried further,
And saved ourselves from such gastronomic woe."
"A shitty joint, reekin' of piss. Transients, that's their bread and butter. I spent a hot minute there, that's all I needed to know."
"Hell's gates had an electric fence. Three shocks, man. Eyes burned. Actors? Piss poor. Houses? Thrown together. Save your dough."
"Beer, that's all we had. Not cold enough, neither draft nor bottle. My fault, should've spoken up. Four beers, four times the disappointment."

Alas, my day hath not been filled with joy,
For at MCN, my hair didst not employ,
A fortnight past, a trim didst receive,
And thus, didst hope for similar reprieve.
But lo, the color didst not meet my mind,
For still, the line between roots doth bind,
And furthermore, a fee of twenty-five,
Didst they demand, without my leave to thrive.
Oh, woe is me, for choosing this place,
Wherefore, my locks doth now bear the trace.

"I've been taking my cars to Dr Auto since '01. Dave and Mike ran a tight ship back then - honest, reliable, and fair. Never felt like I was getting ripped off or sold on something I didn't need. Spent over 50 grand there in ten years, always buying my cars at auction or fixing up old ones. The boys at Dr Auto took good care of me, no complaints. But things changed after Mike and Dan left. New manager seems more interested in lining his pockets than providing good service. Had a couple bad experiences with him. Can't say I trust 'em anymore. Don't wanna give 'em my business, and I wouldn't recommend 'em to anyone else. Shop around, ask questions, and make sure you really need the work they're suggesting. Or just avoid 'em altogether."

"Booked a private room at Towne Tavern for my daughter's 21st birthday, 26 guests, since January. Show up, no room. Bachelorette party took our spot. Met the owner, Danny, a week prior, confirmed details. He denied ever meeting me. Family came from three states away. Manager tried to make it right, but we bolted to Beef O'Brady's. Good food, bad service. Won't be back."
"Britney's show was a bust. She looked disinterested, barely moving. Time wasted. Avoid her act, hit up Cabo Wabo instead. People-watching is far more entertaining."

"Terrible spot, grub barely passable. Not worth the trouble findin' it. Looks like a dump, been abandon for thirty years. Thought it was shut down till I saw folk inside. Gave it a shot, real disappointed. Menu's limited, prices too high for the quality. Skip it."

"Been comin' here for years. Used to be good. Not anymore. Had dinner with some pals yesterday. One guy orders fish 'n' chips. What shows up? Batter, no fish. Two of us get Cobb salads. Lettuce is frozen solid. Place needs a total revamp. Only good thing is Mary, our server. She's top-notch. Too many better joints around."

"Delta, listen up. I gotta say, I like your airline. Platinum member here. But let's talk about your gates at PHX. Not great, man. Not great. First off, one tiny-ass restroom for all those people? Come on. Always bumpin' elbows in there. Then there's the food. Wendy's and some sad Cantina? That's it? No bookstore, no soda stop, no coffee shop, no bakery? What's the deal, man? And don't even get me started on the gross carpets. Crowded wait areas with limited seating? Two charging stations per gate? That's it? Delta, you can do better. Update your game at PHX, will ya?"

"Work across from joint. Ordered lunch Greek salad, advertised for $5.90 with free delivery. When delivered, price was $11.80! Salad was $8.49, delivery $2.50. Had to walk across street...really?

Called to question price. She was rude. 

Recommend restaurant to theater patrons. Never again! After reading reviews, not surprised. 

Go to Cityscape. Worth 2-block walk."

"Stayed at Monte Carlo 'cause we had a seminar there. Don't know how it rates as a four-star hotel in Vegas. Check-in line was long, embarrassing. Room looked like it was renovated in the eighties. Air con/fan made noise every two minutes, useless. Blankets were paper thin, caught a cold on the third night. Bathtub was shallow, old, and nasty. Didn't wanna complain, figured they'd just move me to another room with the same crap amenities. Would've stayed at a Comfort Suites instead. Restaurants were decent but nothing special. Definitely won't stay here again. Mandalay's where it's at. Don't know how this place stays in the M Life group. Waiting in line again to check out, over twenty minutes. Avoid this dump!!"

"Terrible customer service. Two issues with their product, latest being a poorly fitting carbon fiber backing with crooked lines. Bright red, stands out like a sore thumb. Shows their lack of quality control. Mom-and-pop operation, seems they don't care. Three sets of instructions, only one correct. Email exchanges, felt like talking to a robot. Want me to pay for return shipping, slow refund or replacement. Classic bad customer service. They just don't give a damn."
"Energy deregulation's on the horizon, competition's coming in 2015. Reach out to me for details, can't wait to make the switch."
"EyeMasters? Been there twice. Ordered contacts, picked 'em up. Both times, waited forever. Understaffed joint. Prices ain't great either. Take your biz elsewhere, friend."
"Sandwiches took 40 damn minutes. Husband's burger? Frozen crap. My chicken ciabatta? Overcooked and dry. Waitress seemed nice, but kitchen's the issue. Total cost? Nearly 50 bucks. Ripoff."

"Bought some stuff at Home Depot. Got a door, window, and some siding. Door and window didn't match, but they said that's what I ordered. Funny, I asked for the lightest glass, not some dark crap. Order was wrong, but they didn't care. Just trying to cover their asses. Contractor got some siding too, but it's crap. Not impressed. Won't be shopping there again."
"Spice Asian Bistro took over the joint. Gotta give 'em a shot, see what they got. Review coming soon."

"Food fest fiasco. Packed lunch, still hungry. Crowds, lines, no eat. Wasted hour to enter, left after one lap. Charged to enter, trucks and booths charging too. Robbery. Used Groupon, six tix for $25. Otherwise, furious. Long lines, yeah, but they should move."
"Place stinks. Been here a few times, always issues. Fries, cold and raw. Blizzards, skimpy on toppings. Dirty as hell. No surprise they got a C rating. Done with this joint."

"Fie upon this wretched place! A plague upon the floor,
Where creepeth crawling things, most foul and loathsome.
My friend and I, in horror, didst watch and wait,
As under our table, a roach didst make its way.

My friend, with grace and poise, didst trap the beast,
And called the waiter, with a gentle voice, to feast
His eyes upon the creature, and to take it away.
But lo, the waiter, with a scowl and sulk, didst say,

"What wouldst thou have me do, fair maiden? I,
A humble servant, cannot stem this tide of woe.
I've ne'er had such a request, and know not how
To rid this place of pests, that threaten to devour."

We offered solutions, wise and true,
But he, with pride and haughtiness, didst refuse them too.
He bade my friend, with haste and speed,
To carry forth the roach, and leave it at the door,
While he, with mocking grace, didst hold it open wide.

Oh, how the service didst falter and fail,
With waiters who didst care not for their duties, nor their tale.
We paid our bill, and swiftly didst depart,
For nevermore shall we set foot within this tainted heart."

"Terrible customer service. Two people working on a Sunday at 12 pm. Twenty of us waiting in line. Manager on duty laughing with an associate while we wait. Finally, they start ringing up customers, but the manager's still chuckling. Unacceptable. Been in retail a long time. Left my basket and $300 worth of goods. Only the security officer was friendly."

"Groupon brought me here. People stood around, doing nothing. Girl took my order, didn't care. Not friendly, neither was anyone else. Chinese Chicken Salad wrap, messed up. $11, eat my sock with honey Dijon mustard instead. Drink, Moonshine with Everclear, tasty. Highlight of my visit. Stomach growling, walk another mile than eat here."

"Brillo Box, I know the place. Good grub, stiff drinks. But tonight, my Turkish buddy, 28, got turned away. The bouncer, a sourpuss, needs a reality check. A Turkish ID, 28, should be enough. Shame on you, Brillo Box. I'm done with your joint. Get a new bouncer, pronto."
"Don't go to Dr. Nauman's if you don't want to feel uneasy. I took my kid late for her shots, and he gave me grief. Never felt right going there. Wish I'd found Dr. Mendoza sooner."

"Animals dying, depressed or rebelling, eating all in sight. Surprised PETA hasn't stormed in, staging a mass protest. Place is grim, animals zoned out, staring blankly. Vegas resident, this joint's a must-see, pure epic fail."

"I wanted to like Jimmy & Joes.  First order, barely any pepperoni.  I figured it was a mistake, so I gave 'em another shot.  Less pepperoni the second time.  Not impressed.  Overpriced and tastes like crap.  Stick with Domino's or Papa John's.  They're better.  If you want real pizza, go to Spinatos or Oreganos."

"Pulled over at this market, lookin' for them U-pick peaches. Store looked a little rough, veggies were gettin' old. Found a couple strawberries, few tomatoes, and headed to the counter. Checked out, lady says three-oh-one. I got cash, didn't see the fee. Lady gives me a hard time, says it already went through. Told her I didn't know, she gives me a lecture, wants to give me my fifty cents back. I get it, business costs money, but this place ain't worth my time no more."
"Check-in dragged on too long. Missed the damn show. It was alright, but not worth more than a ten-spot."

"Bloody Mary, good. Food, not so much. Hubby had mushroom burger, sweet potato fries. Meh. I had tasteless taco salad, processed chicken. Gross. Returned it, tried it with ground beef. Better, but still meh. Server tried, kitchen failed. Not coming back."

"Underwhelming experience. Front desk staff, unhelpful. Like shopping at Target. Called about smelly room, they said they'd bring fans or come back down. Long line. Asked attendant who to talk to, he was rude, said front desk lady didn't exist, told me to wait for manager. Manager didn't comment on disorganization, just gave me my ID back. No apology. New room key card, whole floor smelled like vinegar. Room felt like a Marriott Springfield Suites, but no coffee machine. For a no-smoking, no casino hotel, try the Trump, good view from the north strip."

"Hark! Alack, what woeful fate doth befall
My quest for aid in replacing a pendant fair?
The damsel who didst assist me, by my troth,
Didst seem most vexed to offer scanty truth.
A year hath passed since last I sought their aid,
And hoped, in vain, their customer service had been mended. Alas, 'twas not the case, forsooth."

"I usually order over the phone from this joint. It's either great or terrible - no in between. My gripes with Domino's include getting the wrong grub or frosty service. 

Today, I tried their online thingamajig. It was quick and painless, but I screwed up by giving them the wrong phone number. I called the store and some dude said he'd send my chow with the next driver. I asked him if it'd be cold - he said it'd been sittin' in an insulated bag and would send it right out. Sixty minutes later, I got my cold grub that'd been sittin' around for forty minutes. 

Needless to say, I won't be orderin' from these cats again."

"Sitting on the patio, May 15th, 2010. Two lamps on the brick wall outside, one busted. Three ceiling fans on the patio, none working. Flies swarming, had to sacrifice half a beer to one that drowned. Dirty tables and chairs. Unacceptable, especially compared to last year. Wish I had taken pictures."

"Cute shop, friendly receptionist. Went for a blowout. Hair looked like shit. Flat, bangs in my face, and that goddamn product they used made it impossible to style at home. Had to wash it out and start fresh. Maybe those new grads from beauty school need some more practice. Not going back there again."

"Reservation confirmed, but I botched the date. Thought it was Tuesday, but it was Wednesday. Showed up at six, place was dead. Hostess gave me the hairy eyeball. Said she might not be able to seat us. Screw that. Left and hit up the Herb Box instead."

"Disappointment reigned. Saturday night, we ventured forth. Told two chefs were down. Twenty minutes to navigate the line, thirty-five for grub. Food arrived hot, saving grace. Never again, YCs beckons."
"Tires, four of 'em. BFG's, good brand. Fletcher's, good dealer. Four hundred fifty bucks, out the door. Free oil changes, four of 'em. Can't beat that."

"Went to this joint with my kid. She'd heard their Coconut Shrimp was top-notch. We tried the cheese curds, can't mess those up, right? They were decent. Focaccia was good, too, with some nice flavored butter. But the lobster? Overcooked and tasted like rubber. What a damn shame. And they served it with oil instead of butter. My daughter got the Coconut Shrimp, and it was burnt to a crisp. All we could taste was the burnt breading. Place looked old and smelled funny, too. Never reviewed a place before, but this one was so bad I had to say something. Don't waste your cash."

"A plague upon the tow company, say I!
Their dispatcher, rude beyond all measure, did lie.
Our cab, they pulled up in, as tow truck did steal,
My car, they took, without a moment's deal.
No parking spot, on their lot, did they find,
Yet still, they charged me three hundred, oh so unkind!
A scam, it seems, this towing business be,
Beware, good people, of such trickery!"

"ACK! ACK! ACK! 

Downtown Mesa, AZ. 

Shopping for old junk or worse? This is the spot. 

Smell of body odor, cheap disinfectant, and dirty diapers? You're in luck! 

Rub shoulders with homeless drug addicts? You'll fit right in. 

Quality food and a safe environment? Keep dreaming. 

Customer appreciation: free teeth and deodorant with every $100 purchase! (Just kidding.) 

Nasty, nasty, nasty! 

You were warned. 

I'll catch a cab home if my wife takes me there again."

"Been with Wells Fargo since '88. Lookin' to buy a place, met this Michael Jordan character. Guy's a mortgage consultant, but don't let that fool ya. Service was shit, wouldn't even bother replyin' to my emails or calls. Can't imagine how they treat other customers. His boss, some Linda Baker, wasn't much help either. Closin' all my accounts, stay away from these folks."

"Came for a birthday dinner, left with a sour taste. Waiter was lost, moodier than a rainy day. Separate checks, a hassle. Barely spoke, just snide remarks. Friends fared better at the bar. Drinks took forever, like watching paint dry. Disappointment etched on our faces."

"Kids had a karate tourney at the Riviera, so we stayed there. First thing we see in our room is a used band-aid in the planter. I tell the front desk, they say they'll fix it. Nope. Bathtub don't drain, furniture's all stained from nicotine, and the clincher? We're on a non-smoking floor, but our room reeks like a Willie Nelson concert. My kids now know what pot smells like. Not staying here next year."

"Came here with friends last year. Place was dead, but we were hungry. Friend suggested it, I was hesitant - SoCal boy, used to Boiling Crab's quality seafood. Fries were meh, sauce was weak, lacked flavor and kick. Ordered shrimp, but it wasn't fresh. Shell was tough to crack, service was slow even though the joint was empty. Won't be back."

"Rented a Mustang convertible for a day. 18 minutes before pickup, they called saying they didn't have the car. Thought they'd give me something comparable or better at the same price. They offered a Jeep Wrangler. Not a sports car. Asked for a replacement, they suggested a BMW Z4 for $50 more per day. I disagreed. They couldn't find another suitable car at the same price. Bagged the trip to Hover Dam. Don't use them. They don't value their customers."

"My bad. Shoulda listened to the reviews. Booked an apt for a blowout, mentioned the iffy Yelp reviews, but wanted to give 'em a shot since I live nearby. Hairdresser didn't know what she was doin'. Mess. Kept askin' another girl, who just quit, how to hold the brush, which one to use. Maybe some supervision would help? Didn't leave with wet hair like others, but it wasn't what I paid for. Took her an hour! Owner was there the whole time, but didn't seem to care about client satisfaction. My fault, shoulda trusted my fellow Yelpers. Love seein' new places in Arcadia, but good service is key."
"Terrible, just terrible. Never met such rude medical staff. Won't be going back. Don't know how they got good reviews."
"Summer heat in Tempe, fun and music in the air. Vacation vibes, but we won't be back. Margaritas, too salty. Beer, watery. Food, spicy, drowning out flavors. Reasonable prices, but a waste."

"Easter buffet, a waste. Overpriced, underwhelming. Menu promised much, delivered little. Duck l'orange, nowhere to be found. Lamb, dry. Crab legs, gross. Cheese and salad selection, lacking. Quality not worth the cost. Once, Paris buffet was decent. No longer. Now, same mediocre food at half the price. Disappointment."
"Reserved a room, got an attitude from the girl on the phone. She musta thought I was there to serve her. Hope the stay's better than the bookin'."

"Filthy room. Unmade beds. Food scattered everywhere. Cleaning crew showed up over an hour late. No help from the hotel staff. Customer service? Useless. They offered to move us to a worse room or waive the resort fee. What a joke. Don't waste your time with Luxury Suites International."
"Rude bartender. Wanted to toss my drink in his mug, but family was there. Figured a scathing review would hurt 'em worse. Don't go."

"This joint gets two thumbs down from me. People are alright, but that's where the praise ends. Stayed here 'cause it's close to my house, but that's a mistake. Management's a joke, they don't give a damn if somethin' goes wrong. Slept on a busted mattress and a box spring with wheels screwed into it. Got bitten after two nights, turns out it had bed bugs. Complained to the management and they accused us of bringin' 'em in. Threw the box spring out and bought a new bed. Bought their wifi too, but the signal's crap. Got a refund, but still, what a waste. This place is worse than livin' in the projects. Don't bother, find somewhere else to stay."

"Methought I had an appointment for a flu shot, fair sirs,
At this place, wherefore I didst make great haste.
But lo, upon my arrival, early in the morn,
A maiden didst shrug and say they didst not dispense.

Two hours of work, I didst miss, alack the day!
And thus, my ire doth rise, in dismay.
For ne'er again shall I set foot in this place,
Where chaos reigns, and order doth not hold its sway.

A pox upon this CVS, say I, with vehemence!
For oft hath it been, a woeful experience."
"Balti lamb had chunks of veggies, not bad, but lacked texture. Peas in paneer were shriveled. Meal was bland, chapati was best."
"Terrible joint. Bitter about our visit a fortnight past. Service? Abysmal. Rude, impatient staff. Prices? Odd and additional charges for every damn thing. Avoid it like the plague."

"Vegas, been there plenty. Finally, took the fam. Friendly face at the door, sit wherever. Waited ten, nobody came. Flagged down a server, menu came five minutes later. Never saw her again. Poor service, weak attention to customers. No floor manager, no leader."
"Service dragged, staff untrained. Four managers present, yet none knew their role. Doubtful this joint will last. Sorry, but you lost four regulars that night due to poor hospitality."

"I've been to this joint a few times for pool fixin' gear, but they never seem to have what I need. The stuff they got ain't top-notch either, especially the chemicals. Chlorine, muriatic acid, you name it. And let me tell ya, these kids runnin' the show, they don't know their stuff. It's like they're just wingin' it, hopin' no one notices. But I notice, and I ain't impressed."

"Avoid this joint like the plague. They got too much bad grub, and the service ain't worth a damn. If you ain't got a squalling brat to bring with you, best stay away. The veal parm was a disaster, and they call themselves an Italian place? Forget about it."
"Minimal selection, small seating area. Mostly Felt bikes. For coffee, try a real coffeehouse. For bikes, visit a bike house."

"Worst crowd I've ever encountered. Absolutely terrible in every way. Can't believe people pay for the crap they dish out. My experience at XS? Pure hell. Ruined my birthday, humiliated me, and I think they even charged me for it. Stay far, far away from this joint."

"Polite folks work here, but where's my gear? Dropped off shirts and pants, ready by afternoon, they said. Went back, shirts ready, pants missing. Came back next day, still no pants. They looked, but nada. Uniform pants, company-issued. Now I got nothing to wear. You claim customer satisfaction, fix this. Prices too high, checked elsewhere, half the cost. Coupons make it seem cheap, but it's really more than others charge."

"Place was empty, food was average. Waited 20 minutes for our order. Server disappeared, had to ask for bill at register. Total was $36. Left a $2 tip, waitress chased me down to demand 15% tip. Husband gave in, I didn't. Principle matter. Don't eat here. Mandatory 15% gratuity, whether you like it or not."

"Insurance billing? Office procedures? Zero knowledge, alas! Manager's temperament most foul, argumentative and sour. This place, I would not recommend, nor shall I make another appointment. Seek Lenscrafters, fair citizens, for Tricare/United Healthcare is their forte."

"Cabo Wabo, a place to avoid. One star for location, one for subpar chips and salsa. Server seemed to have Tourette's, or a bad day. Took 10-15 minutes for anyone to acknowledge us, had to get up and ask for water at the bar. Don't waste your time."

"Sat down to order, menu's filthy. Owner watchin' a big ol' TV in the dining room. Place empty, lookin' like they couldn't afford upkeep. Told the missus and kids, 'Let's bounce!' Don't wanna know what the kitchen's like if the dining area's this bad. Guy with the TV needs to disappear. Maybe the grub's good, but I beat it outta there before findin' out."

"Fie upon this wretched feast! 'Tis naught but sorry victuals, ill-prepared and lacking zest. Soup, beef, and all, a sorry sight, with nary a morsel to delight. And where, pray tell, is that most noble dish, sushi? Nowhere to be found, alas! A paltry selection, stale and cold, with naught but flavorless clams and crab to savor. Alas, what woeful fare! Yet, praise be to the waiter, a merry soul, with smile and courtesy to spare."

"Walked into a joint at 1230, dead empty. Stayed that way 'til we left. Thought it'd be hoppin', but it was just the sushi bar next door. Noodles were the ticket. Duck was shredded, not like the pic. Ramen instead of rice noodles, extra buck for that. Soup was rough, couldn't finish it. Chef/server had the balls to ask if we'd had duck noodles before. Like, who doesn't eat that in Hawaii? Don't recommend."

They said they were open till 11, but we got there at 10:14 and the guy at the door tells us they closed early. There were still people inside, but they didn't seem to care. Bad service, real unprofessional. We won't be back.

"Print your flight itinerary, or they won't rent to you, even if you reserved with a debit card. I watched customer after customer go through the line twice, getting their car and then another, not completely messed up. The woman at the desk had no sympathy, been there too long. It took all my patience not to correct her on etiquette and demeanor. When we got our car, the guy who cleaned and received vehicles told us to get a different one, dented and ragtop ripped. His boss chewed him out for telling us we'd probably absorb the cost upon return. This place is crappy and shabby. Pay the extra five bucks and get a car from the guys at the off-site car-mall. Took us twenty minutes to get there. Just pathetic."

"Cravin' KFC, I drove through. Service was slow, sounded like they had a mouthful of marbles. Food was subpar, mashed potatoes drier than the Sahara. Mac 'n cheese, lumpy as a mattress. Coleslaw? Dry as the Gobi. Chicken strips? Forget about it, like tryin' to bite into a 2x4. Went back the next day, manager dude was snotty as hell. Not recommendin' this joint, service and grub both sucked."

"Starving, we opted for the TI Buffet. Twenty-six ninety-five per head. Cheap, but the grub was unfit for consumption. I managed a small salad, pre-plated for my convenience. Freshness wasn't a concern. Four stations, tops. And the turkey? Unidentifiable."

"Carmine's, big group, family style, sounded swell. It wasn't. Overpriced, overcooked pasta, burnt broccoli, too salty. Service was alright, but not worth the bill. Skip it, Vegas has better options."

"Weird experience. Went with pops and hubby, asked for booth. Waitress said sure, let me clean it off. Group of four came in, asked for booth too. She said follow me, what the hell?!? Waited five minutes, watched her clean a table, then sat us at a tiny three top. Looked at her, said 'you seen dad? He's pushing 300.' She didn't get it. Didn't understand why it was a problem to make us wait for a small table. Ended up leaving, annoyed at the land of delicious Mexican restaurants."

"Salesman approached me, clueless. Said I needed a lockring tool, he didn't know what that was. Explained, showed him the one from REI, too big. He said, 'CASSETTE tool...' Went to tool wall, blank stare. I found the tool in one second. Thanked him, he disappeared. Stood by register, unacknowledged, till another salesperson asked what I needed. Just wanted to check out, but guy who helped me originally had to ring up the sale. Planned on asking for advice on bike brake problem, but decided against it. Won't be returning to this store or any other Tempe Bicycle."

"Alas, how the mighty have fallen! A place once great, now doth serve but mediocrity. Slow service, frozen seafood, and false clam chowder doth mar the experience. Alack, how the memories of yore do now but taunt me, for naught but disappointment doth this establishment bring. Overpriced fare and sluggish service doth tarnish the once-great name of this New England haven."

"Tambellini's got nothin' goin' for it 'cept its location near the Benedum. Me and my pals got stuck at a cramped table sandwiched between two others, practically in the kitchen. Couldn't even hear the folks across from me, but the ones at the next table? Loud and clear. Food? A sorry, soggy mess. Woulda made Chef Ramsey puke. Service? Slow, unfriendly, made us feel like we shouldn't be there. Overpriced too. If you're lookin' for somethin' better, check out McDonald's or Subway. They beat Tambellini's hands down."

"In town new, sought great brow wax. Reviews led me to d'Lisa, Scottsdale salon. Friendly, clean, good vibe. Fastest wax ever, under 5 min. Looked fine, left quickly. Home, noticed uneven brows. One off-center, other with hole. Penciling in gap, bummed. Won't return."

"Terrible service. Worst I've ever seen. Set up a 3-bottle deal with Costco for $18 a month. Not a single delivery was correct. Missed every scheduled drop-off, had to make multiple calls to fix it. They charged me for deliveries I didn't ask for, and none of my calls seemed to matter. First month, I called them 15 times. Cancelled after realizing they were incompetent and untrustworthy. They still charged me, so I had to call again to remove my debit card from their system. Told them I didn't trust them to get the billing right. Got a $39 bill in the mail for erroneous deliveries. Every charge was due to their mistakes. The people working there are not only incompetent but also dishonest liars. It's easier and cheaper to buy water at the store than deal with this nonsense."
"Prices mirrors quality and service. Bought wedding gown, bridesmaids', mothers' dresses May 2010. Rude girls, dresses fell apart pre-wedding."

"Walked into Radio Shack, frazzled. Looked like a toy store. No radios in sight. Employee noticed me, reluctantly. Asked for a cable, he didn't even try to help. Told me they didn't have it, attitude like 'don't let the door hit you.' Fled, almost in tears. Glad they didn't get my money."

"Terrible ordeal. No warmth, no humanity. Just poked and prodded like a piece of meat. Not even a drink offered. Wouldn't want one from these folk anyway. Treat people like cattle. Stamp, poke, next."

"Eiffel Tower drink? Cool concept, but let's be real here. It's not exactly practical for us weak-armed folks. Ordered a margarita strawberry daiquiri, didn't exactly knock my socks off. I prefer my drinks strong, but not too strong. You feel me? Don't mind the taste though, it'll get the job done. Just, ya know, maybe grab something else if you don't wanna struggle carrying it around. Word to the wise: skip the Eiffel Tower, go for something easier to handle. Like a guitar or a Fat Tuesday bong-looking drink. Trust me, you won't regret it."
"Didn't go to Kmart. Why bother? Dirty bathroom, already hit up for cash. No customer service. Just a bunch of overworked, annoyed folks who don't want to help. What's the point?"

"Terrible food, overpriced. Ordered buffalo chicken fingers, Greek fries, and three ranch dips. Confirmed price thrice, still got charged more. Fries were soggy, chicken tasted frozen. Cost $20, still hungry 90 minutes later. Don't bother with this place."

"Alas, my dear friend, I must confess,
This show didst leave me in a state of woefulness.
The large infant, with his girth so great,
Didst fail to stir within me any mirth or glee.

The host, with far too much time on his hands,
Didst strive to be humorous, but alas, 'twas not so.
His efforts, desperate and forced, didst fall flat,
Leaving me in a state of utter ennui.

Now, do not think that I am not a fan
Of Cirque du Soleil, for indeed I am.
KA and Zumanity, both shows didst delight,
But Mystere, alas, didst fail to meet my expectations.
'Tis overrated, and I would advise thee,
To skip it, and seek out better entertainment."
"Terrible experience. Awful service and food. Beef enchilada, worst I've had. Not authentic Mexican. Margarita, straight from a can. Waste of cash."
"Walmart, same as all the rest. Employees? Rude, unhelpful. Not worth my time. Drive extra miles for a smile, friendly help."

"Avoid this joint at all costs. Worst club I've stepped foot in. Girls? Hideous, fat. Suzy Q, a dancer, reeks. Left a stench on my shirt that'll make your eyes water. Unfriendly, lazy lot. Great drink specials, but not worth the risk. Wouldn't recommend it to my enemy."
"Terrible massage from my girl. Lasted 90 minutes, but I bolted early. Better off doing it myself. Disappointment reigns."

"Booked this joint on Hotwire for a night. Cost was a third of what it'd be on the strip, and we only needed it for nine hours. Figured, why not? Place needs some work, though. Water dripping from the ceiling in the hall, and they got a garbage can set up to catch it. Still drippin' on folks, though. Room was alright, bed was comfy. Went down to the pool before checkout, and it ain't too crowded, so that was good. Went back to the room for a quick shower before checkout, but found a puddle of black gunk on the floor. Decided against showerin' in it. Told the front desk, and the girl had a bit of an attitude. Said I shoulda called someone to tell 'em first. Explained there wasn't time for that, but she gave me a free upgrade for next time. Don't think I'll be back, though. Can see why they lost their Hilton affiliation."

"Donut shop nearby, I was stoked. But, damn, it was a bust. Menu? What menu? Just some donuts on a counter, no descriptions. Asked the employee, got some attitude. Got four donuts, two for me, two for the wife. Greasy and sticky, that's all I remember. Wife didn't even finish hers, still in the fridge two weeks later. Not going back, period."

"Hark! All comments below do echo mine,
A first-time visit, and a last, I doth decline.
Cold food, tasteless, staff nowhere to be found,
A wait of four or five minutes, and in haste they were bound.

In this busy place, they shall not last long,
While Burger King, a familiar name, doth sing its song.
Freddy's hamburgers, just a quarter mile away,
The one to beat, but no chance, I do say.

Not impressed, I leave with a heavy heart,
A poor experience, a lesson to depart."

"Terrible coffee shop experience. No contest. 

Snobbish, slow service. Overpriced, mediocre coffee. Limited options. That's 21st. 

I've had great coffee worldwide. Intelligentsia in Chicago, where 21st gets their beans, treats customers with respect. Pour-overs and direct trade aren't new. Get over it, 21st. 

Skip the attitude. Go to Espresso a Mano, Cannon Coffee, La Prima, or others for great coffee without the snootiness. I wanted a good cup, not a lecture and a bad one. Total waste."
"San Fran, store next door for brekkie. Uniform shop closed despite signs saying otherwise. Waited 'til 8:15, still no one. Disappointing."

"Liked this joint, till they started with the dress code nonsense. Owner walks by, doesn't say a word. Bartender takes my wristband, pays my cover, no issue. Then some employee gives me grief about my lid. Demands my money back, I peace out. Won't be coming back. Same owner as Images, rethinking my visits there too."
"Buffet sucked. Hometown Buffet better. Rio, Mirage buffets better too. Simplistic, strange design. Shoulda been Roman-esque. Named after Roman god, but food and atmosphere not fit for mortals."

"Tried the place again, still a letdown. Service at the bar dragged, took forever to get our apps. Salads circled the joint twice 'fore the server finally found us. Waiter brought the main courses, then vanished. No check-in on how things tasted. Portions? Puny. Valet service was tops, but that ain't enough. Skip this spot, eat somewhere else with pals."

I walked into the office, confused. Thought it was a free clinic. Still not sure. My appointment was for 1 pm. Didn't get seen until 1:50 pm. If I had been that late, they would've cancelled. Saw Bryan Monson, or so I thought. Maybe it was Silver Surfer or Green Lantern. The whole thing lasted 1 minute 35 seconds. Referred me to Dr. Garcia for surgery. Explained it quick to my daughter. Guess I'm too old to understand. Out like a light. Won't be going back. No thanks for the Botox.

"Terrible Chinese joint. Called in an order, girl on phone couldn't speak English. Kept yelling out my credit card info, including security code. Bad business. Food's no good either. Won't be back. Plenty other decent Chinese places around."

"Hills, run for 'em! Owner's a jerk, doesn't know how to act like one. Place is filthy. Found a black hair in my salad. Owner said it was the wind, then offered a side salad. Refused, asked for a refund. She got mad, but coughed up the dough. Don't care about customers, just the benjamins. Sad."

"Second time in a row they've overbooked. Now I'm waiting for a car. What's the point of reservations when they can't deliver? Supposed to pick up my ride at 11:15, it's 12:30, and they say it'll be ready in 30. Operations manager needs to find a new line of work. This ain't their strong suit."

"December 19th, 2014. Freezer's busted. Puddle of water surrounds it. Need a new one quick. Off to Lowe's we go. Not a fan of the Rock Hill location, so we hit up Fort Mill instead. They say they'll check if they got any in stock. Waiting game begins. Staff in Rock Hill supposed to give us a ring. Fifteen minutes pass. No call. We bail. Head to Rock Hill Lowe's ourselves. Still no word from Fort Mill. Try Sears and Home Depot. Finally find a freezer. But Fort Mill? Radio silence. Slow and rude service. Lesson learned. Stickin' with Sears and Home Depot for appliances from now on."

"Overhyped reviews. Suspect PR firm's doing.
