"Terrible pedicure. Guy who did my nails was decent, patient. Had to pry off old set, fill was fresh. Hurt like hell though, drill slipped and cut me. Nails look good, thin and shaped well. Pedi was a disaster. Scrubbed, cut, filed okay, but massage was non-existent. Barely touched my feet, rubbed shins and knees instead. Squeezed and pinched my toes, slapped bottoms of feet. No idea what she was doing. Sloppy polish job, paint on cuticles uncleaned. Weird, weird, weird. Won't return."

"Slammed by Mill for the ASU game, ended up here. Ordered souvlaki - beef and lamb. Lamb was underseasoned, beef had a better taste but chewy and hard to swallow. Spat out a piece, unfortunately. Didn't feel like I got my money's worth. Veg was bland too. People mostly ordered apps, maybe I missed out. Waitress was great, friendly. Extra star for her. Not sure about coming back with other options around."

"Hark, good sirs, to my tale of woe and spite,
Of Bouchon, a place I once did hold in high delight.
In March, my last venture to that fair city,
Didst leave a comment, but alas, no reply didst come nigh.

Their victuals, verily, be of fine quality,
But prices, dear friends, do border on the ridiculous, ye see.
And thus, my wonder, when upon my bill,
A charge of seven gold coins for house water didst fill.

Tsk, tsk, good sirs, what wickedness doth this portend?
For tap water, by the gods, doth flow from yonder faucet, my friend!
Shame upon thee, Bouchon, for such chicanery,
To fleece thy patrons, and in such a manner, too, doth seem most vile and loathsome, by my troth!

But fear not, for all ended not in despair,
For they didst adjust the sum, and my guests didst stare.
So, heed my words, and take heed of this tale,
Lest thou, too, fall prey to such trickery, and in such a snare, dost fail."
"Oil change took too long. Two hours, watched others get served first. Place was clean, staff was friendly, but management was a mess. Not going back."

"Pomo used to be in Scottsdale, serving top-notch Napoletana pizza in a snooty atmosphere. But the downtown location was different. Modern decor, hipster staff, and a disappointing pie that lacked the flavor and quality of the original. Skip it and head to La Piazza Locale instead."

"Amidst the revelry of friends on a merry night,
We graced this bar with our exuberant presence,
And though our mirth was great, the place itself did lack,
In charm and style, it failed to make a dent.

The bartenders, skilled and attentive as they were,
Could not redeem the tavern from its faux pas,
The chandelier, a gleaming crystal showpiece,
Was offset by the tacky, plastic monstrosity above,
A garish adornment, better suited to a dive,
Than a venue aiming high, as this one seemed to strive.

The atmosphere, alas, was stale and outdated,
Lacking the allure of a true Las Vegas haven,
So, though we laughed and made the most of our night,
I shall not hurry back to this particular sight.
The Cosmo's secret pizza place, a gem unseen,
Shall be my destination, for its delightful sheen."

"MENU CHANGE: Enjoyed the flatbread tapas at happy hour, but last night they replaced it with Matzoh Ball CRACKERS for full price dinner. Not worth it. $10 for crackers and tiny scoops of hummus, bruschetta and tapenade is too much. Friend struggled to eat the flatbread pizza because CRACKERS can't support the weight of toppings and sauce. Server said it was a permanent change. I'll go to one of the other gastro pubs in town or just walk across the street to Firefly for better food. The fresh brewed beer isn't worth it either, too heavy with a syrupy honey taste. Bleh."

"First time at the store, bought a toy chopper for my kid.  Dead battery, had to bring it back.  Manager helped us out, but he was on a call the whole time.  Waited 15, exchange took one.  Poor quality, poor service.  Not a great first impression."

"Owner's a real charmer. Bid they gave my insurance company was the highest, but it was for a full replace job. Didn't need that much work, just some repairs. Insurance company wasn't having it, so they didn't get the gig."

"Flamingo Hotel's got some issues. First, they got this "Go Room" thing. If you don't get it, you're stuck with a dirty, filthy room. Don't matter if you complain, they ain't gonna do nothing about it. We had to move thrice. First time, some other guest was checkin' in while we were still there. Nobody from the hotel gave a damn about our complaint before they stuck another poor soul with the same problem. Carpet's disgusting, it stinks and it's got stains everywhere. You step in the tub after walkin' on that carpet, you'll leave black footprints. No excuse for that kinda filth, and no excuse for ignoring it and shovin' it onto the next guy. Hotel's old and it smells like it too. They're tryin' to fix it up, but they got a long way to go. With all the nice hotels in Vegas, I can't figure out why anyone'd wanna stay here. First and last time for me. Never been treated so poorly. A kennel'd be cleaner. One good thing though, Junius Johnson, Jr. He's a server in the buffet, been there 30 years. Guy's got customer service down pat. He should teach the rest of the staff. My hat's off to him."

"Hark, what news is this? A woeful tale of woe,
A day of sorrow, and naught but grief to show.
The fifth of June, a date most foul and dark,
A day of woe, a night of endless spark.

The crowd, a motley crew of wretches, vile and base,
Did gather 'neath the sun, with naught but ill grace.
No seat, no rest, no respite from the heat,
A small dance floor, and naught but bitter defeat.

Yet, hark, a voice doth cry, a voice of cheer,
A voice of hope, a voice that doth dispel fear.
For though the day be woe, the night shall bring,
A chance to dance, a chance to sing and fling.

So let us not be down, my friends, nor lose,
Our faith in joy, our hope in love's sweet bliss.
For though the day be woe, the night shall bring,
A chance to dance, a chance to sing and fling."

"Chedda, that scoundrel, finally came to town. I tracked him down at Zia Records, eager for a taste of his wares. My husband and I both ordered dirt bags, expecting a cheesy delight. But alas, they were flavorless, lacking the very essence of what makes life worth living. I was crushed, my dreams shattered. The burgers were massive, the buns burnt to a crisp, but the tots were a disaster, tasting like plain mashed potatoes with an odd, unsettling sauce. I wouldn't wish it upon my worst enemy."

"Pulled up to the pump, asked the lady for $120 on pump 2 regular. She said it's ready, and if I needed change or a receipt, to come back inside. Went back outside, filled up the tank, and chatted with the fam. When the pump clicked off at $100.10, went back inside for my change and receipt. Asked the lady about the car wash, she said it'll reopen in a month with new pumps and another gas island. Said thanks and left. This place is improving, might give it two more chances."

"Gordon Ramsay's joint, expectations run high. Seen his shows, the guy's got passion. Forty-five minute wait, Friday night, no big deal. Staff uniforms, ridiculous, ill-fitting, unflattering. Change 'em, for crying out loud. Umbrella girls at motor sports events, more covered up than the poor girls working at BURGR. Burgers took their sweet time, forty-five minutes, just okay. Truffle fries, truffle aioli, tasted like garlic, nothing special. I cook at home, burgers didn't impress. Bill came, $150 for two adults, two kids, burger meal. Won't be back, but Vegas' got plenty of Ramsay's joints. Guy's a hard worker, making the most of it."

"Hark, good sir! Tequila Bar, thy name doth bring
A promise of delight, a place to sing
Of drinks divine and cheap, a haven for
The weary soul, a refuge from life's storm

But lo, my friend, how art thou fooled by fate?
For when I came, with eager feet, to sate
My thirst, I found naught but disappointment great
No fishbowl, oh, cruel fate! But two plastic cups,
Sixteen ounces each, a paltry sum, alack
And worse, no fish within, nor any fun
Just soda, fie upon it, and a sorry sight

Yet still, the nachos, delectable and fine
Did tempt mine eyes, a culinary shrine
But nay, I had but recently dined
So chose the corn, a humble, plain repast
But lo, the waiter, with a wink and smile
Did ask, corn, dost thou desire? Aye, foolish guile
For what arrived, alas, was naught but corn
Boiled, plain, a square of butter, naught else, forlorn
A failure, verily, a sorry, woeful tale
Tequila Bar, thy name doth now connote
A cautionary tale, a warning to all who dare
Beware, good sirs, lest ye be fooled like me, farewell!"

"Four stars for appetizers, calamari and shrimp, both were delectable.  Salad, too, was quite satisfying.  But alas, one star for main courses, both were woeful.  Tilapia, dry as the desert sands, and asparagus, overcooked to a fare-thee-well.  Wife's pasta dish, a disappointment, I do declare.  Kids' meals, just passable, nothing more.  Atmosphere, lacking in charm, with dirty spaces galore.  Waitstaff, inconsistent, ours, a negligent lot.  Next table's waitress, attentive, but ours, MIA, alack.  Bottom line, avoid this place, Concord Mills, seek elsewhere, ere you dine."

"Been here a few times in the past year. Hygienist's always pushing for more work, more cleanings. Got that deep-cleaning crap two months back and my gums are worse off now. Saw the dentist once, she barely looked at me, just told me I needed fillings. Don't think she even cracked a smile. Seen her walk by the front desk, didn't even nod at me. Time to find a new dentist."

"Dos Gringos, trashy vibes abound. Trailer park theme, questionable at best. Two instances: weak drinks, cheap pours, vodka or rum, no difference. Men's room, vomit stench lingers, staff unresponsive. Fun atmosphere, DJ, crowd, dog-friendly. But, puke and poor drinks kill the mood. Tacos, unappealing. Old-fashioned, perhaps. Prudish, maybe. Turned off, definitely."

"Walked in on a lazy Sunday arvo, place was hoppin' with sports fans. Service was alright, not too fussed about makin' small talk. Tips were flowin' like beer at the bloke's tables, oh well. Heard raves 'bout their crispy tacos, but they were just meh. All in all, it was decent, but there's better spots in the hood."

"O, wouldst thou learn of Crazy Mocha's ill fate?
'Tis a coffee shop of woe, a place of dismay.
Thither I went, thrice, by reason of its site,
Adjoining a hall of learning, where I did stay.

The chai, alack, was oversweet and bland,
A concoction of milk and tea, without a hand
Of spices, to give it zest and flavor true.
I could not taste the spices, nay, not a few.

And, lo, the coffee, a beverage most dear,
Was brewed so weak, it did my senses cheer.
I suspect 'twas left to sit, in afternoons heat,
For when I came, 'twas but a bitter treat.
I poured it out, in disgust, ere I had drained
A quarter of the cup, so vile was the taste profained.

The service, middling, neither swift nor kind,
Yet, the wifi, in fairness, was of a mind
To aid my work, and thus, I did impart
Some praise, for that one aspect of their art."

"Subway, once a favorite haunt of mine, has since abandoned my beloved chicken pizziola sandwich. Despite my efforts to revive it, they've chosen to discontinue it altogether. In search of a new go-to, I've found myself met with indifference, save for the occasional nod of approval from those who share my taste for the finer things in life. Alas, Subway's Las Vegas locations seem to cater to their own kin, leaving me to wander the streets in search of a worthy substitute. Bring back the pizziola, I say!"

"Methinks I shall dine here, at a friend's behest,
But mark my words, fair sir, 'tis not the best.
For oft, whene'er I've broke bread here within,
My bowels have rebelled, and lo, the trots did spin.
And, by my honor, the victuals are not worth
The woe they bring, in sooth, they be of little worth.
Bland, o'erpriced, and not fit for a king,
Save that, perchance, some folk do sing its praise,
But nay, my friend, 'tis not a place to seek,
Forsooth, 'tis not a haven for thy taste to seek."

"Hark, what's this? A chilled chicken dish, they say? Nay, 'tis but a grilled chicken salad, gone astray. And lo, the fries, they be but tepid, not hot. Yet still, the service here, it doth please me, for 'tis most friendly, and the menu, too, doth stay abreast of hipster fare, with brioche and pretzel buns, and fresh lemonade, to boot. Aye, verily, a pleasant meal, despite the mix-up, 'twas."
"Fried tofu, pork, peanut butter dumplings, eggplant. Fried foods, dry and tough. Better versions found elsewhere in Montreal. Only try if desperate for Chinese. Slim pickings in this neighbourhood."

"Alack, what woe is this? In Casa Grande, a place of revelry and cheer, doth lie a tavern, once full of life and mirth, now doth resemble a tomb, devoid of joy and vitality. On a Thursday eve, when custom doth dictate a late hour, the patrons few, the waitress doth proclaim, 'Last call, good sirs!' ere the night hath reached its prime. A pox upon the management, whose lack of vision doth stifle the spirit of merriment. The ale, a paltry selection, doth leave much to be desired, save for two tapsters of note, which doth elevate the fare above the common swill. Alas, the clientele, a motley crew, doth not demand a greater variety, and thus, the tavern doth suffer, a shadow of its former self."

"By Jove, fair Monte Carlo, how art thou fallen!
A name once grand, now tarnished, and forlorn.
We sought a room without smoke's pall,
But found ourselves within a chamber foul.
The carpet, cracked, and floor, unclean,
The room, a shambles, and naught but mean.
The hotel, old, and worn with age,
Did little to improve our sour mood.
Indeed, the service, poor, did make us rage.
And so, dear friends, avoid this place,
For Monte Carlo's glory, doth but grace,
The annals of a bygone, forgotten time,
When luxury, and class, did once entwine.
Now, 'tis but a shadow of its former prime,
A pale imitation, of a once-great shrine.
So, heed my words, and seek elsewhere,
For here, doth lie, a bitter, cruel snare."
"Tried out a new groomer in Phoenix. Good reviews, decent prices. Not impressed. Asked for special attention on the dog's tail. Still had mats, face wasn't clean. Won't be back."
"Cold buffet food, can't stand it. Today, everything was cold. Got there too early, maybe. Had to bail, asked for my money back. They gave me a gift card for another time. Nice."

"A cake of peanut butter, hot from the oven, didst sit upon the table, its surface adorned with a layer of jelly, warm and runny. Alas, the cake itself was dry and hard, making it difficult to taste the sweetness of the jelly until one reached the center. And there, within the heart of the cake, lay a pool of warm grape jelly, its flavor not unlike that of any other latte."

"Place was decent, but not this last time. Had the eggs Benedict, didn't like the hollandaise. Sticking with the blueberry pancakes next time. Boyfriend's meal was good, service was too. Got in quick on a busy Memorial Day morning. But we both got sick later, and it was the only meal we had, so I'm gonna be hesitant next time."
"Place is getting wrecked under new ownership. Staff's overworked, service is slow. Food ain't what it used to be. Memories are all that's left."

"Underwhelming experience with too much repetition."

I walked into the joint with high hopes, but they fell short of the hype. LA's got nothing on this place, and I can't imagine how it's considered better. The hot dog casings were hard as rock, and the flavors were lackluster. This spot relies more on its reputation than the quality of its grub.

"Been here twice. First time, great service, mac and cheese, delicious. Today, ridiculous. Called at 5:54, asked about happy hour, yes until 7. Arrived ten minutes later, told no happy hour today. Giving two stars."
"Brunch at its worst. Chain joint in a plaza swarming with families and their noisy broods. Food passable, but not worth the trip."

"This joint didn't impress me much. Not enough options on the menu and my street noodles were just alright. Didn't blow my mind or anything. The only thing worth going back for is the steamed pork buns. That's it. Don't waste your time otherwise."

"Hark! I didst venture to Caramel, forsooth,
Upon the whisperings of its noble worth.
A cozy, wee lounge, neat and plain, it didst seem,
Yet, in sooth, its dimensions didst surprise, in truth.

An Oreo martini, priced at twenty crowns,
Didst tempt my taste, with crumbs of Oreo, profound.
But, alack! The drink, though fair, didst lack,
In worth, the price, which didst my senses shock.

The Bellagio, a place of beauty, doth reign,
Whilst Caramel, a spot, of middling fame.
A wager, of twenty pieces, on the screen,
Didst gain a martini, free, and most serene.

The sports bar, a haven, of cheer and glee,
Didst boast bartenders, of warmth and courtesy."

On a Saturday eve, I came to this place,
Thinking to enjoy, for Kaskade did play.
I bought my tickets online, with haste,
And waited in line, for entry, with waste.

An hour and thirty minutes, did pass,
Before I reached the door, with naught to do.
The club, it was packed, and full of folk,
No tables found, nor space to stroke.

They let more people in, with nowhere to be,
And down a narrow stair, we had to decree.
The dance floor, small, and crowded too,
A shame, for Kaskade, his talent did brew.

"Food's good, but service is shit. Been here twice, both times service was terrible. Last time, food took an hour, and we still gave 'em their damn 18% tip. Manager said he'd give us a hundred bucks for next time, but that never happened. Pros: decent grub. Cons: shitty service, can't keep their word. Not going back."

"I've been to this gym and the one in Phoenix. My friend has a membership, so we've been going together, trying to motivate each other. Sometimes you need that extra push. 

This gym is basic, nothing fancy. It's $10 a month or $20 for all locations, with unlimited guests. 

I'm torn between a 2-star and 3-star rating. I've been a member of 24 Hour for years - nothing fancy, but it has everything I need at a reasonable price. However, my gym has a sauna, basketball court, classes, pool, etc., which Planet doesn't. No sauna! And what's with the loud alarm when someone drops a heavy weight or grunts? Judgment-free gym, but they're judging effort? Doesn't make sense."

"Rude management, waited over an hour for our car, watched others leave left and right. Mentioned it to several people, got lots of excuses, but they lost our car. Would've been satisfied with a drink, spent over $200 on dinner, no apology. Wrote a letter. Waitstaff was friendly, meal was okay, nothing special, Charlotte has better. Relationships matter, they killed mine with this one. Bottom line, food wasn't worth returning for."
"II Vinao, thought it was mismanaged. Turns out, just an off day. Owner reached out, eager to fix issues. Impressive. Will visit again, soon. Five-star potential, no doubt. Keep you posted."

"Lobster Mehhh? More like food court fodder. Setup's lackluster, like a mall's sad corner. Lobster roll combo, fries, drink - not impressed. Not a traditional Maine roll, overwhelmed by vinegar medley. Fries, decent. Lobster mac and cheese, meh. Few chunks on top, not worth the ten bucks. Won't be back."

"Food's alright. Hot dishes ain't warm when they reach the table. Took some good stuff off the menu, that's a shame. Noise is the real issue though. Damn TVs blasting and folks at the bar hollerin'. No peaceful seating. Server said it's like that all the time. Don't go there much, don't wanna take the risk of a game being on."

"I don't get the hype 'bout this place. Folks rave 'bout it, but the grub just ain't that great. Chips 'n' salsa are decent, can't mess that up too much. But my burrito's flavor's lackin', daughter's quesadilla too. 'Hot' salsa tastes like mild, somethin' ain't right. Service is good, bar's got a nice selection, atmosphere's cool. Food? Meh."

"You could easily pass by without notice. Simple tables and booths, open like a deli. Chicken parm sub, per Yelp's advice. A bit dry, but still a decent bite. Not sure I'd get it again. Crinkle-cut fries, nothing special. Good option instead of fast food, but not worth going out of your way."

Alas, poor Elliot & Co., thy name doth bring
A tale of woe and disappointment, I do sing.
A haircut and shave, a package of delight,
Didst thou provide, yet failed to meet the light.

The haircut, verily, didst please mine eyes,
But lo, the shave, a sorry sight didst rise.
A quarter inch of hair, a stubble so coarse,
Didst remain, a testament to thy lack of force.

The towels and oils, a pleasantry, no doubt,
Yet, alack, the shave, a failure, without a rout.
A close shave, a true shave, thou didst not bring,
A simple disposable razor, my dear, didst cling.

In conclusion, fair Elliot & Co., thy name
Doth suffer, for thy shave, a poor game.
Nice people, nice environment, a haircut so fine,
Yet, alas, the shave, a disappointment, a decline.
"Sally's Beauty Supply. Decent selection, but service was lacking. Manager was friendly, but other staff seemed indifferent. A smile and some enthusiasm go a long way."

"Had lunch at this joint with the fam. Sis-in-law's a big fan, always stops by when she's in town. Place isn't big, but the line was out the door. Ordered the mixed plate - beef, chicken, fish. Beef was meh, chicken was good - tender, moist, de-boned thigh. Fish was nothing special. Portion was huge, couldn't finish it. Maybe try the Mami or Udon noodles next time. Hesitantly recommend it. Would eat there again, but wouldn't make a special trip."

"Stayed at the Excalibur in Vegas last time, met some pals there. Place wasn't cool, overpriced too - $160 a night! First room reeked, like someone poured water on the floor and let it mold for weeks. They gave us another room after an hour, but still too pricey. Casino's in a bad spot, far from the strip. Only close spots are New York New York and MGM. Food's no good either. Not happy we stayed there, won't again."

"Fie upon this sorry sight, my friends! Tables and floor, a mess most foul and unkempt. My own self, I didst spill, alack! And lo, the staff didst watch, as I, a poor wretch, didst clean up the mire with nary a helping hand. Aye, and leave behind a sticky residue, that none would wipe away, most direfully."

"Atmosphere was swell. Ordered Chicken Meatloaf, real tasty. Partner had Chicken Royale, flavorless. Side veggies had more zest. Waiter was attentive after grub arrived, but prior, he was MIA. Won't be back."

"Menu looked top-notch, got our hopes up. But what did we get? Frozen hashbrowns, low-grade ingredients. Chicken fried steak tasted like a pig took a smoke break on it. Service was good, but can't say the same for the grub."

"Methinks 'twas partly my fault, good sir,
For not perusing the menu ere I came,
But, by my troth, I was most vexed and vile,
To find such dull fare at this establishment,
Upon a friend's recommendation, I did stake
My hope on tapas, bouillabaisse, and more,
But lo, the menu didst bear naught but tame
Sandwiches, a Cuban and a chicken, alack!
In Vegas, a city that ne'er doth sleep,
I felt ashamed and woeful, my friends to keep
From such a sorry sight, and thus didst creep
Away, with sorrow in mine heart, and deep."

"Bought a house in Mesa, got an evaporative cooler with it. Previous owners said Tempe town lake construction cut into the cooler's usage by three months, thanks to the humidity. And now, the dam's busted, so no lake for us. That's a bummer."

"Methinks 'twas not a place of great renown,
Despite the tales that did abound.
A lengthy wait did deter me not,
For breakfast here I did devout.
The victuals were not without their charm,
But naught did stand out in my arm.
Twas crowded too, I must confess,
And thus, my friends, I do profess,
Gilbert House down the street doth beckon me,
More than this place, where'er it may be."

"Sunday brunch? Average. Nothing special. Selection? Lacking. Basic breakfast grub and flatbread pizzas. Upstream sets the bar high, but this place falls short. Food's not cold, but could be hotter. Beer? Watered down. Like their other drinks, the Bloody Mary's weak too. Atmosphere's cool, packed, but overhyped."

"Golden Nugget, Fremont Street, Downtown Vegas. Place is decent, drinks are good, service top-notch. Food? Meh. Fish and chips drenched in oil, 'tempura' lobster tastes like funnel cake. Better options downtown, cheaper too. Live it up, you're in Vegas, baby!"

"Burgers? No love here. Like 'em, but not lovin' 'em. Food takes ages, medium burger's well done. Sauces are cool, fries too. Better burger at Serendipity, no contest. Overpriced Carl's Jr., Plymouth's pride. Don't bother, frozen turkey patty's the same. Variety of fry flavors and cuts, that's nice."

"A plague upon the menu of Buraka,
For it doth lack in variety and depth.
Though veg options there be, in fairness,
'Tis not enough to make up for the dearth.

No sampler platters for one, alas,
But a two-entree choice, at a higher cost,
And so I chose the misir wot and beans,
Both spicy, or so the menu did boast.

But lo, the spice did not live up,
Nor did the flavors, sad to say.
Injera, usually a delight, did fail,
Leaving me with naught but dismay.

Hot sauce came forth, a saving grace,
But still, I expected more from the place.
Alas, the ambiance and patio dining,
Could not make up for the lack of flavor shining."

"I ain't no Beatles fan, so I wasn't exactly pumped for this show. Our seats were decent, but the venue's huge and the 360-degree stage meant we might miss some action. Cirque tried to make up for it with stuff happening on both sides, but it was just too much for me. The soundtrack was solid, though - classic tunes, you know? The acrobats were alright, but nothing special. My buddy dug it, but I was underwhelmed. So, if you're a Beatles diehard, go for it. If you're a Cirque enthusiast, there are better options."

"Meeting facilities subpar. No experience with guest rooms. Two-day training with too few power outlets. Attendees fought for scarce outlets. First day, foul plumbing issue filled building with sewage stench. Property unable to resolve. Unpleasant."

"Methinks I was dismay'd, forsooth,
By order of kare-kare, I didst choose,
Though meat was tender, veggies didst droop,
In sogginess, they didst lose their charm.

Lechon kawali, a dish of might,
Didst come with gravy, rice in sight,
A pleasant treat, indeed, 'twas so,
And thus, my hopes didst start anew.

Yet, alack, the heat didst bear down,
Upon that day, most sweltering, frown,
The A/C, in vain, didst cease to blow,
A trial, indeed, for those who didst know.

Still, methinks I shall give them another chance,
For though the meal didst not enthrall,
Their efforts, in truth, didst merit praise,
And thus, my heart doth sing their praise."

"Listen up, folks. I gotta tell ya about this so-called 2 Star "award" hotel. First off, the rooms are top-notch, real nice. Great view, too. But that's where the good stuff ends. This shuttle business? Forget about it. It's a joke. You gotta check the schedule before you book, or you'll be waiting around for hours. And don't even get me started on the taxi fare. Forty bucks, no tip. What a ripoff. And don't believe the hype about the "complimentary" stuff. It's all just a bunch of two-for-one deals. Not worth it. The buffet? Forget about it. We stood around for 15 minutes and didn't even move four feet. And the pool? Closed till March. Try getting a drink at the Hostile Grape? Yeah, good luck with that. It's closed three days a week. And shopping? Forget about it. You're stuck out in the middle of nowhere. Next time, I'm sticking with Green Valley Ranch or South Point."
"Good eatery. Cheap. Beer. Nice spot. Shame about the grime. Carne asada tasty. Service adequate. Dirty, though. Kitchen likely worse."

"Hark! In yonder Plaza, there doth lie  
A diner known far and wide,  
Where portions are fit for sumo wrestlers,  
And competitive eaters do delight.  

'Tis called Hash House A Go Go,  
A place where quantity doth reign supreme,  
And quality doth take a back seat,  
In this temple of culinary excess.  

We didst venture forth to try their fare,  
And sampled their Fried Chicken and Waffles rare,  
But alas! The chicken lacked juice and zest,  
And waffles failed to impress,  
For they didst not possess a bacon-like flavor,  
And left us wishing for more savory bits.  

Next, we didst attempt their Fried Chicken Benedict,  
A dish most curious and quite perplexing,  
For 'twas a towering stack of mashed potatoes,  
Beneath a bed of eggs and bacon,  
With spinach, tomato, and mozzarella cheese,  
All jumbled together in chaotic ease.  

But lo! The House Salad didst prove a disappointment,  
A mere medley of bland iceberg lettuce,  
No special touch or flair didst it possess,  
Just a humdrum mix of leaves, alas!  

So if thou art in search of a hearty meal,  
To share with friend or loved one,  
Come to Hash House A Go Go,  
And revel in its diner charm,  
But beware, lest thou be overwhelmed  
By portion sizes great and grand!"

"Terrible crepe experience. Ordered cheese and prosciutto, but it was thick and doughy, not hot enough. Prosciutto was too strong, couldn't cut it with the flimsy fork they gave me. My BF's veggie crepe was also doughy and thick. Coffee was awful. Won't return. Parking is easy and free in the Paris parking structure. Place was busy later on, don't know why. Employees' stereotypical Parisian outfits were amusing."

"A year past, I came to this place with two friends in tow,
And we didst venture to their walk-up counter, lest we wait an hour or so.
We ordered small frozen hot chocolate, and I must confess,
I was not impressed, 'twas naught but a chocolate shake, I do profess.

The second time, I met friends in town, and they didst dine,
Their food didst look most delectable, and portions were fair and fine.

The third time, with my sister and friends, we didst partake,
Of frozen hot chocolate, and white, forsooth, my sister didst make.
Her portion was vast, and rich, and too much, I do declare,
And service was slow, the cashier didst take his time, I do swear.

Perhaps, the hype didst build up, and my expectations were high,
But I shall return, and wait, and dine within, ere long, by and by."

"Never should've messed with the recipes. Been back twice since new management took over. Gotta give 'em one more chance. Place has lost its magic. Service just ain't the same no more. Talked to some workers, they seem like good folks who could do better. Gonna give 'em another shot."
"Peking duck, not bad. Walnut prawns, too sweet, like dessert. Crab, tasted like garlic ash, overcooked. Service, friendly. Shame about the restaurant. Paying the price now."

"A year hath passed since first I did subscribe
To Bountiful Baskets, hoping for a bounty divine.
But now, alas! I must confess, the quality doth wane.
Their fruit, once fresh, now rotteth on the tree, ere it be gathered.
Their veg, once crisp, now limp and wilted, like a lover scorned.
And every week, the same old things they do include,
Apples, romaine, and honeycrisp, all of which I do detest.
For though they be abundant, they be not of the best.
I shall seek out a CSA, where quality doth reign supreme."

"A hour didst pass, ere our victuals did arrive,
In a place with a pleasant view, and atmosphere quite jolly.
But alas, the blueberry muffins, didst disappoint,
Dry and flavorless, they didst not impress.

The biscuits and gravy, were quite satisfactory,
Yet, a bit more meat, wouldst have been welcome, verily.
The Carne asada burrito, didst lack in zest,
And the sandwich, made of French toast, didst prove the best.

Yet, not the most impressive, of culinary delights,
Still, we shall return, to this place, with all its charms,
For despite its flaws, 'twas a pleasant sight,
And who knows? Mayhap next time, the food shall be divine."

This joint wasn't worth a damn. The opener was the only decent thing about it. If he hadn't been there, I might've walked out. Thirty-nine bucks for an hour show? Ridiculous. In New York, it's twenty-five bucks for two and a half hours. The service was terrible too. Couldn't even get a drink. They had a two-drink maximum, but it felt like they were trying to limit us to one drink per visit. Waitress took forever to come back and demanded payment upfront. What a joke. Wednesday night or not, that price tag is too high for such a crappy experience. My advice? Avoid this dump and wait for a weekend if you want some real comedy.

Moe's serves unremarkable grub. It doesn't hold a candle to others in its classQdoba, Chipotle, et al. The victuals were fresh, but lacked pizzazz. Burritos were puny, with scant fillings. My main gripe was the price. No way a burrito of that size, with that meager amount of rice, beans, and meat, should cost north of seven bucks for the regular size. I've had larger, tastier burritos for around five bucks. A small soda for two-fifty? Ridiculous (free refills, though).

You do get chips and salsa with your order. The chips were decent. Salsa, just okay. One strange thing: my wife ordered a Triple Lindy burrito in a bowl. It came in a white box. When you try to toss it, you can't fit the box in the trash can due to its odd design. Brainiac move...

Amusing names for their burritosHomewrecker, Art Vandelay, etc. Good stuff! Moe's won't be near the top of my list for returns. Better options abound. Rating: 2.5.

"Hark! Good sir, how ill doth thy stomach fare? Forsooth, the victuals here be of fine quality, yet alas! The service, by the gods, doth leave much to be desired. 'Tis my third visit, and each time, I swear, 'Tis as if they didst purposefully seek to vex mine anger. Firstly, the wait, aye, 'twas as if the hours didst crawl like snails upon the ground. And when at last the grub didst arrive, lo! They brought me not what I didst ask for, but rather some other dish, which, perchance, didst grace another patron's table. Then, as if 'twere not enough, the server, with a smile most wan, didst proffer me a bowl, which, I swear, didst take an age to come. And when 'twas brought, 'twas as if 'twere fresh from the factory, so chill and cold, it didst make mine teeth to chatter. But wait, there's more! For when I didst request a new dish, they didst charge me still, though 'twas not brought to mine table. Fie upon this place! I pray thee, good sir, avoid it, lest thou wish to suffer similar woe."

"By th' same token, I must confess,
This branch doth leave much to be desired.
The service, poor and almost none,
In an all-you-can-eat, most undesired.
The fish, not fresh, doth leave a bad taste,
And employees, with naught but lazy haste.
If thou art hankerin' for sushi still,
Take a five-minute walk, and there doth fill
Thy belly at Sushi Crescent, I say,
For those proprietors, no problems doth sway."

"Upon the fourth of July, we made haste to arrive ere the appointed hour, eager to partake in the feast. Alas, many others had similar designs, for the waiting list did swell, and tables lay barren. Our patience was tried, for nigh twenty minutes did we bide our time, as the hostess, fair maiden, didst explain the cause of the delay. The computer, a wondrous device, did dictate the order of seating, and those who had reserved their place before us, didst take precedence. At last, we were summoned to our perch, alfresco, numbered one hundred and eight. Alack, the wait didst continue, for water, a paltry ten minutes didst we await, while others, who hadst come after us, didst receive their libations and bread in hasty fashion. My spouse, a man of the sea, didst savor the seafood, but, alas, some clams didst remain unopened, a sign of ill fortune. Pasta, a dish most dear, didst accompany not his meal, a grievous oversight, indeed. My daughter, a tender bud, didst enjoy her pasta, the sauce, a delight, but, lo, the main course, a lemon chicken, didst prove a disappointment, for the fowl didst possess an excess of fat. Bread sticks, a humble request, didst go unheeded, and, furthermore, the vapor from the steamers didst obscure our vision, and my daughter, a delicate flower, didst suffer a thorough drenching."
"Food, barely mediocre. Beer, warm. Greasy, bland fare. Fast food, better. Half the price, too."

"A fortnight past, I did abide,
And, truth be told, my stay was naught but hideous.
A Marriott Rewards member, I,
Didst expect a service most dutiful.
But, alas, 'twas not the case, me friends,
For twice I called room service, and still,
My chamber remained unkempt, a sorry state,
And light switches, too, didst play the fool,
Either all aglow or dark as night's shade.
The elevator, with my key, didst mock,
A jest, indeed, for oft it would not heed.
And when I sought my bill, in vain,
I called, and called, but naught didst gain.
A system broken, and a transfer made,
To leave a message, in a dismal shade.
So, gentle friends, take heed of this,
And choose not this hotel, lest ye wish
To suffer, as did I, in this woeful place,
Where service, seemingly, doth hold no grace."

"The PO's got a sweet setup with an Auto Postal Center. Just walk in, grab some stamps or ship a package, and breeze out. But the package hopper's always full, can't open it. I've rung the bell, banged on the door, tried to tell the counter jockeys, but never get a response. What's the point of makin' it easy to send stuff if we can't actually send it? Frustrating as hell. Answer the damn bell, it's called service.

Another time, Saturday morning, the APC's broken. Everyone's waitin' in line, me included. When it's my turn, I tell the worker the APC's down. She's clueless, says, 'Oh, that's why it's so busy in here.' I'm the first to tell 'em about the tech issue? Unbelievable. I'm tryin' to support the PO, don't wanna lose this service, but come on, give us a little customer service, huh?"

"Hark! I hadst heard tell of Rossario's feast,
A place where Italian cuisine didst reign supreme.
But alas, my friends, I must confess,
My visit there didst leave me in disdain.

I ordered lasagne, a dish most fine,
But what they brought me, oh how vile!
Limp noodles, drenched in sauce, didst cling
To mushrooms, lifeless, void of zest.
Not lasagne, nay, but some foul jest.

My husband, hailing from Italy's shore,
Didst choose the chicken Puttanesca, a dish once more.
Two bites he took, then cast aside,
With sorrow in his eyes, he didst abide.
Even the salad, once a simple delight,
Didst fail to please, a woeful sight.

In conclusion, dear friends, I say,
Rossario's, a place to flee away.
For in their cooking, there doth lie
A bitter taste, that doth not die."

"O, woe is me! This 24 Hour doth bustle with activity,
And yet, the tools of trade do show their wear and tear.
I didst not take a liking to this place, I do confess,
For 'twas not up to par, in my most humble opinion, fair."

"High hopes for this place, thought it'd be like Salt River. Visited last night, didn't quite live up. Prices for swag and snacks, ridiculous. But the real issue, the scoreboard. Sitting lower level, first base side, couldn't read it. Too small, not well lit at night, third taken up by ads, no stats for batters, lineup on left side useless. Parking lot, no signs for exit, entrance blocked. Never seen a park without distance signs. Disappointing."

"Went on the indoor ride, shared a gondola with strangers. They were quiet, not up for fun. Guy had a big wart on his temple, couldn't look away. Gondolier was great though, friendly, chatty, nice voice. Ride itself? Meh. Not worth the cost. Outdoor one's supposed to be better, skip this one."

"Open all night, this joint gets two stars, tops. I only hit it up when the others are closed, but even then, it's a crapshoot. Overpriced and the rent-a-cop'security' guys tail me like a bad habit. Limited pickings too."

"I don't do chain restaurants, let alone chain steakhouses. But there I was, at Outback Steakhouse in Vegas. Business trip, dinner on someone else's tab, limited options south of the strip. Didn't take long to spot an Outback near the Outlet Mall. Haven't been there in six years, and it wasn't as bad as I remembered. Not exactly a glowing review, but my sirloin and salad were decent. Service was too. Fine, not fancy. See you in another six, Outback."
"Food's alright, prices ain't bad. Got a deal from Groupon, so it was a good score. Calamari was good, rest was meh. Place looked nice, good lightin' for a date. Server was top-notch."

"Airport's seen better days. Few healthy grub options, couple oxygen bars gatherin' dust. Bathrooms, not exactly spotless. Some corporate charging stations, but they're usually packed. Folks sittin' on floors, fightin' for a spot. Unless you're headed to or leavin' LV, better places to kill time."

"Food was passable, service was poor. Went for Christmas Eve dinner, reserved at 11pm through OpenTable, but waitstaff claimed they closed at midnight. Rushed our meal, which was a mistake - the staff grew increasingly impatient and rude. Most dishes didn't live up to the hype, according to other Yelp reviews. Maybe it was due to the holiday."
"Terrible joint. Ordered their famous murg tikka, chicken tasted like frozen crap. Paneer makhani? Subpar. Naan was decent, but that's about it. Avoid this dump."

"Two visits, same result: poor service. Bartender Emmanuel, friendly and personable, saved the day. He gave us more attention in eight minutes at the bar than our waiter did in 45 minutes at the table. That's not how you treat customers. You pretend to like your job, even when you don't. Our waiter didn't get that memo. His inattention bordered on neglect. He came by three times, took our orders, and brought the check. Like he wanted us to leave. The busser checked on us more often. Not worth the trip if you're coming from afar. Sit at the bar, avoid the waitstaff."
"Owner swings by, spittin' apologies. Night's a bust. Service drags, pizza's mediocre at best. Noise level's off the charts."

"Respiratory Convention brought me here, needed a place to crash that wasn't gonna eat up my whole day. Got a room, not bad, bed's alright. But man, the smoke's still sneakin' in, even though it's supposed to be a non-smokin' joint. What can you do, it's Vegas, right? And then there's the resort fees, what a joke. Thought I was gettin' a good deal, but nope, they're just pirates at Treasure Island, takin' your loot."

"BBQ joints ain't hard to find in these parts, but Lucille's got somethin' special. Variety, that's what they call it. Can't decide? Just sit tight, eat biscuits 'til someone tells you what to do. Cornbread, tri-tip, it's all good. Prices, yeah, they're steep, but share a meal, save some cash. Don't be hatin', folks, portions are fair. Two stars for Lucille's, good biscuits, cornbread, tri-tip, rest is mediocre. Not bad, but not the best in this BBQ town."

"This joint's got some kitsch charm, sure. Carousel bar, games, circus acts - it's a fun way to kill a day. But let's be real, it's a dump. Dirty, run down, poorly planned. I wouldn't stay here if my life depended on it. Well, maybe then. But seriously, folks, don't be fooled by the cheap rates. There's a reason they're so low. You get what you pay for."

"I've used SRP for thirty years. Good people, always helpful. Zanjeros, too - ready to sort water issues, frequent as a dead animal in a canal. Been a fan, until today. Went to pay my assessment, but...

1. Security guard said I was in the wrong place, no receptionist anymore.
2. Payment center's now a closet with machines.
3. Customer service? A phone on a brown wall. Call for help, it says.

Zanjeros? Computer babysitters for the new Water Master system. Consistent flow? A challenge. Get shorted twenty minutes, move to a new user. Doesn't work. The person in charge should meet users at 2 am when the system shorts them.

Called today, spoke to an old-style SRP person. But this facility? Might as well visit prison. No matter what the brochure says, SRP's just another faceless utility, isolating customers."

"Hark, a craving for BBQ didst beset mine appetite,
And so, I sought out a place to sate my desire.
Aye, $35 worth of victuals didst I order, full of hope,
But alas, most of it didst not meet mine expectations.
The pulled pork, aye, 'twas passable, I do confess,
But the brisket, oh nay, 'twas but a mediocre mess.
The chicken, verily, 'twas but a middling fare,
And the beans, oh woe, they were undercooked, I swear.
Away, I didst throw them, with nary a qualm or care.
The sauces, aye, they were decent, I must allow,
But alack, the rest, oh nay, 'twas but a sorry show.
I didst ask mine father-in-law to make some brisket,
For none couldst I find, who couldst cook it, Southern-style, so neat.
The staff, aye, they were pleasant, full of cheer,
And the place, clean, both within and without, I do declare.
But the portions, alas, they were small, I must confess,
And so, mine appetite, it was not fully blessed."

"Hark, what news is this? A cheesteak, thou say?
In Philly's land, where such delights doth sway,
I chanced upon a place, Pop's, they call,
Whose look, to Pat's, did bear a striking pall.

A steak, with whiz, onions, and peppers, I did choose,
But, alas, the flavor, they did forget, I suppose.
All bland, it was, and not a morsel could I taste,
Betwixt the meat and onions, a difference, there was none to trace.
The bread, too, did disappoint, soft and lacking bite,
No Amoroso, it did not resemble, in the slightest plight.

Yet, the patio, fair and bright, did please mine eyes,
And sweet potato fries, a delightful surprise.
So, though the food may fail, the atmosphere doth make,
A visit, still, to Pop's, for the patio's sake, I would partake."
"First time at Culver's. Nothing special. Like any other burger joint."

I walked into the ship to store department to grab something, but the register was closed. Next to it was layway, and there were five people in line. The gent at the register said the other lane was closed. I told him to call for help, since I wasn't there for layway. Two other ladies in line agreed, saying they were waiting too, since no one would come help him. We were near the employee back entrance, so I told someone to go call someone to help him out. Within two minutes, someone showed up. They were still slow, but not as bad as before. It took almost thirty minutes from the time I arrived to when I finally got my two items. They let me pull around back to pick them up, since they were too big to wheel through the store on a flatbed cart. Not terrible service, but definitely a lack of help for customers.
"Sandwich was a bust. Not impressed. Small meat, slice of cheese, stock dressing. Hype? Don't see it. Gotta try again."

"Lived in the hood, ate here for years. Takeout, dine-in, didn't matter. Been downhill six months now. Refried beans? Canned. Homemade, canned, know the diff. Cheese Crisp, lackin', oily. Shredded beef taco, fatty. Used to be good. Now? Nah. Goin' back to Sylvia's, Macayo's. Better food, not from a can."

"Place was overrated. Service was lackin'. Food was mediocre. Sweet potato tempura and king crab California roll were dry and overpriced. Took 'em 30 minutes to bring the check. Didn't tip. Not impressed."

"Las Vegas, a city of excess, yet we found ourselves yearning for more. My wife and I, sushi lovers, stumbled upon a restaurant that caught our eye. Fresh seafood, an impressive drink menu, but the portions, small. A $72 tab, with a tip, left us both unsatisfied. We hastened to find sustenance before the night's entertainment."
"Sat at the bar, first timer. Two waitresses helped, too much service. Then, no one. Waited 20 minutes, just for the bill. Waved goodbye."

"Disappointing night. Foie gras, not bad. Radicchio, no bueno. Ceviche, small and flavorless. Lobster risotto, decent. Black bass, forgettable. Prime rib eye, misnamed. Left hungry. Went to Smashburger."

"Terrible. Food too salty, staff amateur. Awkward transition from bar to table. Sides arrived late, wrong dishes, drenched in salt. Manager knew it, tried to save face. Don't waste your time past Mastro's."

"Skip this joint. Food's mediocre, service is slow, and don't even get me started on the taste. Chicken soup's too salty, sandwiches are bland, and desserts are nothing special. They're open 24/7, but you're better off finding somewhere else to eat. This place is a sideshow, and not worth your time."

"Hark, what news is this? My moving men did come,
On time, as promised, their duty to perform.
But lo, their speed did leave much to be desired,
Five hours and twenty-five minutes, a duration most dire.
And oh, the cost, how it did mount and swell,
$446 for materials, a sum most unwell.
A warning to all, let this be a lesson,
To beware of movers, with haste and treason.
For though they came on time, their work did lack,
And left me with a bill, most surely to attack."
"Little Darlings: zero booze, full nudity. Off the strip, not worth the trip. Dingy, grimy joint with gals past their prime. Stayed less than an hour, moved on to Cheetah's. Skip it."

"Coffee's top-notch, but the service and WiFi? Not so much.  Entry fee's steep, and the staff's got an attitude problem.  I'm not always dressed for the part, but even when I am, it doesn't seem to make a difference.  WiFi's a joke, patched in from some other company's router.  I'd offer to set up their own connection, but they don't seem interested.  Location's great, product's excellent, but service and WiFi? Subpar."

"I'd heard the grub here was decent, so I gave it a shot. Being a frequent visitor to Italy, I've got high standards for Italian fare, but I'm willing to cut some slack for Italian-American joints.

I went for the lobster bisque, which wasn't half bad. A bit too peppery, though, and there were some questionable bits of dried fish. Then, I ordered what I thought was the crab/shrimp cake appetizer, but they brought me the full meal instead. Didn't realize my mistake until I got the bill. The crab/shrimp cake was alright, but there was way too much filler for my liking. The grilled potatoes and veggies that came with it were cold, too. Overpriced, if you ask me.

Service was painfully slow. Won't be coming back."

"This joint could use a good scrubbin', some folks say it's part of the charm, but I reckon a little soap wouldn't hurt. Drinks are cheap and strong, just how I like 'em. Went here lookin' for some conversation and a good time, but seems like most folks stick to their own cliques. It's a dive, no doubt about it. No music playin' the night I stopped by, so maybe I missed out on some of the fun. Might give it another shot, see if it's worth comin' back for."

"Chinese place, good portions. Open late, nice. Receptionist speaks English, no prejudice. Food? Sub-par. Pot stickers, overcooked, little filling. Lo mien, awkward. Veggies waxy, beef overcooked, underseasoned. Generals chicken, just OK. Poor experience. No leftovers."

"Came here for lunch, started with crab mozzarella and mushroom morel soup. Crab was good, soup was great. Reminded me of Cheesecake Factory's version, but still prefer theirs. Didn't try the beer, but might have a go next time. 

Had the baked seafood combo - clams, mahimahi fillet, scallops, and stuffed shrimp. Shrimp's imitation crab stuffing was nothing special, and the rest lacked seasoning. Clams were alright. 

Dessert was nutter butter ice-cream cake. Good, but nothing too exciting."

I stopped by the joint near my place, again. Three folks and a bartender, lost in his iPad. Service? Forget about it. I threw down forty-five bucks, had to plead for a cold one. I'll pay for the brew, just give me some damn attention. Might give it another shot in a few months, but I ain't holdin' my breath. It's been a year, and it's still dead at 1 am.
"Flavors and toppings? Just alright. Non-fat options? Few and far between. Selection? Meh, same old, same old."
"Never had Del Taco, being from the Midwest. Not missing much. Flavorless fries, unmelted cheese on chicken tacos with too much lettuce. Bag had more taste."

"I read the raves, thought this joint would be top-notch. Let's just say it didn't live up to the hype. First off, it's a smoking establishment, which put a damper on my appetite. Service was sluggish, and the server seemed indifferent. We ordered cheese sticks (nothing special), beer-battered pickles (too greasy, soggy), and a beer-battered BBQ chicken sandwich (the batter was burnt to a crisp, inedible). We tried salvaging the sandwich, but it was a lost cause. The garlic Parmesan fries lacked any discernible garlic flavor. My boyfriend didn't even touch his sandwich. All in all, a disappointment. The beer was decent, though."

"On Sunday morn, we did decide to dine,
At a place that opened early, as was mine.
The line, it was quite short, a handful strong,
Of us, the elder folk, who sang our song.

The spread, it was quite meager, I must say,
For twenty-five pieces of silver, a paltry array.
Hot dishes, mostly breakfast, where was the rest?
A sorry state, indeed, and cause for unrest.

Fresh, everything was, as it should be,
But simplicity, it seemed, was the decree.
A shame, for such a lovely casino, grand,
To offer brunch, so plain, and lacking in demand.

Service, it was good, no qualms, I do confess,
But Wynn, or Bellagio, a better address."

"A gem within the Fox's diadem, fair and bright,
Yet prices high, for victuals but a wight.
A group of friends didst dine therein,
One ordered prime rib, French dip kin.
The server asked if he wouldst desire,
Mushrooms, peppers, or onions to aspire.
He said, "Aye, please," and thus they didst charge,
Two dollars each, six total, a great discharge.
I pray thee, good sir, what sorcery is this?
Ten pounds of onions for two dollars, 'tis a bliss!
I split a chicken club, a cheese plate small,
With iced tea, twenty-four dollars didst enthrall.
The waiter, too, didst play the villain's part,
A dick, thou sayest? Fie upon his art!
Gift cards, perchance, may bring me back again,
But else, I vow, no more shall Fox receive my gain."

"We were stoked to try the new joint near our digs. Trendy and family-friendly, just what we needed. But, man, were we let down. The decor was cool, but the wine was warm and took forever to arrive. The menu had some decent options, but not exactly healthy. We went for the hummus and salads, but they were lackluster. Small portions, stale chips, and not exactly fresh ingredients. We thought maybe we ordered wrong, but come on, a restaurant should stand by their dishes. It was such a bummer that we hit up another spot after. It's a shame, too. First trendy place in the area and it's a dud. Fix it up, and we'll be regulars."

"Alas, the service was slow, and the burger didst come forth upon a sodden bun. I didst request a fresh bun, but alack, 'twas not forthcoming in haste, and thus I didst consume the meat sans bun. Moreover, the establishment was oppressively warm, and all who sat at our table didst perspire profusely. Methinks 'twas not a good eve for them, and I wouldst not return anon."

"We hit this joint pre-flick. Location was key, being next door to the cinema and all. Service was snappy, no complaints there. Watermelon margarita? Hell yeah! Food? Meh. Salad was a bust, dressing was like napalm. They subbed it out with a quesadilla, but it was just okay. Hubs had the rancho burrito, nothing special. Won't be coming back for dinner anytime soon. Wouldn't recommend it."

"7:30 am. Breakfast time. Sausage gravy or turkey sausage? Maybe a ripe banana. Or both. Magdelina ensured a fruitful feast, plenty of Froot Loops and overripe bananas alongside the sausage gravy and turkey sausage. Grabbed a coffee and left, still hungry. Las Vegas has countless hotels. Stay elsewhere."

"Rooms big as a barn. Towels soft as a cloud. Bed comfy as a feather mattress. Three things that make me smile on the road. But what's the deal with this joint? Location's only good for the mall next door, staff don't give a damn 'bout nothing. Lady at the desk was nice, but that's where the friendliness ended. Never got my Hilton perks, got charged for internet I shouldn't have paid for, and housekeeping didn't leave enough towels or refill the water. For over two hundred bucks a night, you'd think they'd show a little more concern."

"Walk in, menu's up. Chicken heaven? Maybe. Flavors, seasonings, choices galore. Not impressed. Ordered wings, strips, fries. Golden crisp, hot. Garlic Parmesan, too salty. Some undercooked. Small joint, took it to go. Mixed reviews, but willing to try again."

"Pewter Rose, Saturday night. Groupon, $25 for $50. Friend and I, pleased with the deal. Atmosphere, pleasant but kitschy. Plastic tablecloths, inappropriate for $20+ plates. Packed house, reservations at 8pm. Waiter, attentive but warned us of a delay. Appetizer, 8:30. Main course, 9:20. Seafood risotto, delicious. Herb-crusted lamb, too salty. Might return for brunch, but not full price for dinner."

"Twas not the first time, nor the last, alas,
That we did dine at such a wretched place.
The service, poor, the waiter, a slacker,
Picked up my salad plate, and with haste,
Didst remove the knife, and left the lettuce there,
A wad of green, most foul and unfare.
The appetizers, oh how they didst fail,
The mushroom caps, didst make mine stomach wail.
The drinks, watered down, most thin and weak,
Didst leave me wishing for a better seek.
The main course, steak, not so bad, I say,
But potatoes, cold, and veggies, oh what a fray!
In this fair town, with eateries galore,
Why choose this dump, I ask thee, evermore?"

"Twenty minutes for a single to-go order? Ridiculous. Thursday night, empty restaurant, still took forever. Food was mediocre, overpriced. Ten bucks for a meal that didn't impress. But hey, they do have smaller portions for lunch, that's something."

"Durant's, I like it. But let's be real, it ain't no great joint. Been there three times, and each time was a disappointment. Service was slow, seafood was overcooked, and the steak was done wrong. Don't get me wrong, it's a good spot to hide from the law, but that's about it."
"The joint wasn't half bad, but there's better grub to be had in the neighborhood, especially if you're lookin' for a place to catch a game. Went once, saw enough, ain't been back since."

"My liege didst ask for recommendation of an interior decorator, to adorn our new office building with finesse. I didst reach out to Yelp's community, and they didst present unto me, Neilsen. I didst send his details to my liege, and she didst express great gratitude, for my swiftness in finding such a skilled artisan. Brownie points, didst I receive! 

Alas, my joy didst turn to woe, for Neilsen's follow-through, was lacking in diligence. He didst ignore my liege's calls, and didst delay his proposal, by two weeks. Moreover, he didst disappear for weeks on end, without informing her of his whereabouts. I couldst continue, but alack, 'tis painful to recall such disappointment. 

Perhaps, there was a misunderstanding, and fairness dictates, I should note, there be many glowing reviews. Yet, I must caution, for my experience didst leave much to be desired. Low marks, I do not give lightly, and 'tis a shame, to have to do so, in this case. 

I urge thee, dear reader, to weigh thy needs, ere recommending Neilsen's services, lest thou suffer a similar fate, as mine."

"Fancy hotels bug me. They skimp on basics like fridges and microwaves, stuff you can get at a Holiday Inn for half the price. And don't even get me started on WiFi fees in 2011. It's robbery.  

These places want you to pay top dollar for a crummy room with nothing nearby. Not even a sidewalk. You gotta walk a half-mile just to find a convenience store.  

The room was alright, but not worth the cash. Three-star hotels are just as good."
"Grill cheese, sad as hell. One slice, not even to the edges. Disappointed, sorry to say. Last time, great. This time, slapped on. Cooks need passion."

"Tacos in the Burgh, they don't cut it. I'm hard on them, but someone's gotta tell it like it is. Tortillas, they're key. They're the first thing your tongue touches, sets the tone for the whole damn thing. Fresh, homemade tortillas, that's what I'm talking about. Not some store-bought crap. That's what Verde's doing wrong. They're too focused on the toppings, not enough on the tortilla. And let me tell you, it shows. You're paying five bucks for a taco that's just not worth it."

"Methought the menu didst please mine eyes,
And in it, saw great potential doth lie.
But alas, fate didst play a cruel part,
For in came a group, most loud and rude,
Whose rowdy ways didst tax the staff's art.
A pass, I shall give, for their plight.

But lo, my burger, of one pound weight,
Didst come forth, with fries, cold as winter's night.
A shame, for they didst taste, in days past,
As if fresh from the oven, hot and bright.

And then, my biscuit, forgotten, alack!
Until I spoke, didst they bring it back.
Dry, it was, and with a heavy heart,
I didst fear, this place, might not be smart.

Alack, I didst want to love this place,
And dreamt of breakfast, ere I didst depart.
But now, I fear, 'tis not in the cards,
For tardy service, doth leave a sour taste."

"O, how the years have brought decline to this place! I chanced to visit once more, on a Monday eve, for Saigon Noodles was shut tight. A humble bowl of soup I sought, and thus did order Tom Yum. A paltry salad came with it, fresh indeed, but dressed in o'er-sweet syrup. My daughter's chicken satay, alack, the peanut sauce barely hinted at nuts, and o'er-sweetened was its taste. My soup, a sour broth, lacked the balance of sweet and sour, yet still I ate. The price, a scant $20, and service, fair and prompt, did ease my woe. In conclusion, if on Mondays thou find thyself on Madison's west side, and soup doth be thy craving, then lower thy standards, friend, and dine herein. Else, seek out Saigon Noodles or, if Thai food be thy heart's desire, journey to Ha Long Bay, on Willie Street, anon."

"This joint's got some serious issues. Water pressure's off the charts, can't even drain fast enough. No way to adjust it either. What's the point of having a fancy hotel when you can't even take a proper shower? And don't get me started on the TV selection. No premium channels, just basic stuff. And the internet? Forget about it. They charge you per minute and the cord's too short to reach the bed. Business center's a joke too, 8 bucks for 15 minutes? Ridiculous. Customer service? Non-existent. Like they don't want you there. Ask a question, they'll ignore you like you're invisible. Only reason I'm giving it two stars instead of one is 'cause the room was clean. That's it."

"I'd run the M&M store on the strip differently. Free samples, life-size huggable M&Ms, demo of M&Ms melting in your mouth, hot folks clad in M&Ms, glam bar with candy-colored cocktails and novelty beer with M&Ms, Cirque du Soleil show with M&M-clad acrobats, high stakes poker with huggable M&M dealers, and strippers. That's how you bring in the crowds. But the current owner doesn't agree. Their version of the store has four floors of M&M merch, a cheesy 3-D movie, a probably cheesy tour, and no free samples. Guess that's more in line with the M&M brand, but I don't get why they're on the strip if they're not gonna bring the excitement."

"Four shrimp, overcooked, upon a po' boy, for twelve silver pieces?!? O, how the shame doth cling to them that serve such fare? Red beans and rice, but average, nothing near the authentic taste. Gumbo? Meh, bland and dull. \n\nYet, I must confess, the service here was fair and bright, but alas, 'twas not enough to make amends for NOLA's lackadaisical approach to Cajun cookery. This establishment wouldst not endure a day within the city of New Orleans."

"Burgers here are good, not great. Better than fast food, but that's not saying much. Compared to other gourmet spots, they fall short. Service was slow, had to wait for a table despite plenty of open seats. Ordered fries, had to ask for them ourselves. Food was decent, nothing special. Had the bacon burger, patty was sirloin and bacon, topped with more bacon, mayo, gouda, and onion strings. It was fine, but not worth repeating."

"Thrice have I graced this establishment with my presence, and, alas, found it wanting in both quality and value. The service, too, leaves much to be desired. Yet, in their defense, they do remain open late, a boon for those in need of a swift repair, as I myself have found on a Sunday eve, prior to an important feast. Thus, while I cannot recommend them wholeheartedly, I shall acknowledge their dedication to serving the populace, even in the wee hours."

"Food had a strange, unappealing flavor, like Italian seasoning. Veggie enchilada was full of zucchini, which I didn't expect. If you like zucchini, get the enchilada and a side of Mexican veggies, but I don't like it. Place was nice, service was friendly, but food wasn't good."

"Popular joint, packed the whole time. Veggie options drew us in. Seitan appetizer, damn good, huge portion too. Rest of the meal, not so much. Service? Kinda wild. Our waiter, nice guy, but barely there. Other staff, hectic, frazzled."

"Went out with the missus to Hash House for a late dinner. Service was alright, hostess was friendly but a bit too chatty. Ordered off the late-night menu, grilled cheese sandwich was decent but had too much tomato and only one big chunk of avocado. Sloppy and hard to eat. Mike, our server, was good though. Took him a while to get my strawberry lemonade margarita, but it was worth it for $8. Overall, a decent dinner, but hoping for better next time."

"Methinks 'twas thus, upon a time, I chanced upon this place,
With mine own kin, in merry Las Vegas' embrace.
A craving struck, for victuals cheap and fine,
And lo, I found the latter, in this humble shrine.

I ordered thus, a half-roasted duck,
Which pleased my taste, though my love did quack,
"Twas small, he said, compared to Cali's finest,
But still, 'twas good, and worth the penny pinched.

A BBQ pork and chicken rice dish too,
Did grace our table, and my heart anew,
For it did taste, just like home's warmth,
Ah, blessed comfort food, that doth disarm.

Veggies, simple, sauted with garlic's might,
And salt, a humble seasoning, yet oh so bright,
Such modest fare, yet satisfying,
Can't go amiss, for any soul's delight.

Alas, the cost, did rise, to fifty or so,
A steep sum, for three meals, I do avow,
Yet cash alone, they did demand,
A curious rule, in this strange land.

Next time, I shall essay, Capital Seafood above,
To see if their fare, doth bring me closer to love."

We hit up the joint again this weekend, grabbing some more of that good white balsamic vinegar. Decided to stick around for lunch too. Kids shared a grilled cheese, wife had the antipasto. She liked it, but it was tiny for twelve bucks and came with three slices of plain bread. I went for the Abrequine, which they called a roast beef panini. But let me tell you, it didn't see any panini press. Small and flavorless. Chips were crispy but oily. Kids loved the gelato, I liked what I tasted. Grabbed a bottle of Mexican lime olive oil, but it was too sweet and fake-tasting. Wife enjoyed the spicy green beans, feta-stuffed olives were alright. Nice little family trip every six months or so, but not a regular spot.

"I stuck around Luxor, so I chowed down at this joint for convenience's sake. Three outta four days, I ate their grub. Sandwiches, soups, and salads were decent, ya know? Cafe food, ain't no big deal. But this one time, the drink server went wild with the water pourin', and my teapot started swishin' 'round like a sonofagun! Damn near spilled boilin' water all over my leg. I was feelin' rough, tired, and hungover, just tryna scarf somethin' down before my flight. Didn't wanna make a fuss, just needed an icepack, pronto. So I asked another waitress, who called the manager, who then called security. Finally, some dude shows up, and I tell him all I need is a bag of ice. Shoulda just handled it myself, told the drink server she filled up the pot too damn high, and gotten the ice from the kitchen myself. Oh well, lesson learned."

"Tried the taco joint three times now. Third time, just to check the taco. Can't review a Mexican spot without trying a taco or burrito, right? Taco was small, no bigger than three, four inches. No crispy shell option. Beef was good, but not worth two bucks. Another time, had the fried fish. Big letdown. Fish was practically stripped bare, fried with lime wedges. Unfilleted, unprepared. Juvenile decor. Sign said they won't report sexual harassment, just grade it. Price was off, food sub-par, service alright."

"Methinks 'tis strange that certain things at yonder school
Must needs be paid for online, and that with haste.
Their website doth demand thy payment, and with speed,
As if they craved thy coin with utmost greed.

Aye, and not only that, but they do charge
A fee of ninety cents, a sum most odd.
For what purpose, pray tell? Doth it not seem
A tax most vile, a burden on thy purse?

If 'twere but a convenience fee, fair enough,
But nay, thou mayst not pay in any other way.
So either send them fifteen shillings, or else
Thou must endure this extortion, day by day."

We swung by this joint in Phoenix after hearing good things. Got there around 8:30 on a Friday night, and there was only one other couple ahead of us, so we were served quick.

Service was decent, but the employee who helped us seemed a bit tired or something. Like they'd been working a long shift or somethin'.

Ice cream wise, my husband went for the TC^2 and salted caramel, while I got the almond buttercrunch and apple cinnamon. Also tried the honey blue cheese and sugar and spice. Didn't get much almond flavor outta the almond buttercrunch, but the other flavors were alright. Texture was a bit icy, not super creamy like I'd hoped.

Pricing was reasonable, but I wouldn't go outta my way for this ice cream. If you're in the area and want some "original" flavors for a decent price, might be worth stoppin' in. But otherwise, there's better ice cream out there. Me and my husband were pretty meh about the whole thing. Spoiled by some great ice cream up in the SF bay area, I reckon.

"Alas, my friends, I must confess,
This place doth lack a certain je ne sais quoi,
A quality that doth make it stand apart,
And thus, I fear, it doth not win my heart.

I do confess, I am a fan of small,
Of those who dare to dream and take the fall,
But here, alas, the hotdogs doth not please,
Nor doth the lemonade, which doth disappoint,
With its watery taste, like tears of woe,
It doth not quench my thirst, nor doth it show
The skill of Sonic, whose hotdogs doth reign,
In flavor, texture, and in every way, supreme.

And so, my friends, I shall not stop,
For here, alas, they doth not serve the top,
But rather, doth present a pale imitation,
Of what a hotdog should be, in all its creation.
And thus, I bid thee, let us move along,
For here, there doth not lie a culinary song."

"Food was good, atmosphere fun. One sip of beer, though, and I tasted iron. Something crunched between my teeth. Glass shards in the brew! Manager didn't believe me. Said the bottle looked fine. I showed him the glass in my hand. He swapped the bottle. That was it."

"Turkey crepe and cookies, good. Service, bad. Decor, obnoxious. Cupcakes, mostly icing. Waitress, forgetful. Appetizer, forgotten. Pasta, cold. Hungry, ate it anyway. Carry-out desserts, stick with those."

"Hate the tint job on my ride. Had my old car tinted, worked like a charm. Kept it cool, you know? But this new one, man...it's like they didn't even bother. Sun beats down, makes the interior feel like an oven. Not worth the cash, that's for damn sure. Don't get it. What's the point of tint if it don't do nothing?"

"Flamingo, a relic of days past, doth stand,
A testament to time, when Vegas was young.
No gaudy pomp, no glitz, doth this hotel boast,
Just simple charm, that doth evoke the past.

A place of legend, where memories doth dwell,
The Flamingo, an icon, that doth tell
A tale of yore, when gambling doth reign,
And entertainment, doth bring joy, without refrain.

But alas, my friend, do not be fooled,
For though it doth seem, a place of old,
The rooms, they doth lack, in modern grace,
And cell phone signal, doth leave much to trace.

Yet still, I say, give Flamingo a chance,
For its location, doth make up for the dance.
Close to other hotels, and the strip so bright,
It doth make walking, a pure delight."

"This hotel's got nothing going for it. Rooms are old and worn out, staff's not much better. They might do their job, but don't count on them going out of their way to help. Place is past its prime, been that way for a good ten years or so. Only stayed here 'cause of some conference. Won't be coming back."

"This joint's been my go-to spot for years, back when I lived here in the early 2000s. But this last visit? Total letdown. 

No Cuban bread on the menu, but the server said they could whip some up. Not the same, though. Different bread, too thick, and not even toasted. 

I went for the bacon and cheese burger, but it was a dud. Didn't even finish it. Fries? Meh."

"Smoothie King, a joint as busted as Jamba Juice. Packed house, too. Staff? Not worth a damn. Place made no sense. Guy at register, clueless. Charged me eighteen bucks for two drinks. Smoothies, decent. But no way I'm coming back."

"Hark! A quest for lunch didst bring me here,
Masaman curry, my heart didst cheer.
But lo! Tomatoes didst make an appearance,
A strange addition, indeed, a curious preference.

I asked for none, a medium spice,
Yet found the dish quite bland, not nice.
Chicken, plenty, but veggies, scarce,
A balance, fair, I didst not find in this place.

The soup, just passable, the spring roll too,
But peanuts, raw, oh what a woe!
I craved the cooked, a proper treat,
But alas, they were not to be beat.

If time dost allow, Chanpen Thai,
A better choice, doth wait thee nigh.
But if thy schedule doth require speed,
Fare here, not bad, service, good indeed."

"Bought the car, no issues. Service department, different story. Forgot to tighten a hose, car died on the freeway. Dangerous situation. No comp for my time, inconvenience, or danger caused. Not even an apology. Don't trust their mechanics."

"Overpriced for a small bowl of mediocre grub. Had the Dan Dan noodles - twelve bucks plus tax and tip. Sauce overpowered the shrimp and noodles, couldn't taste 'em. Better Asian options in the strip, but if you're stuck at the Venetian, this is your best bet for a quick bite."

"Odd brunch, indeed, my meal didst consist. Kugel and strawberries first, a curious mix, yet tasty, I must confess. Matzo soup, a bit lackluster, with canned chicken noodle, akin to Cambell's, surrounding it. Holishkes, bland cabbage rolls, with marinara sauce, chunky and unimpressive. Sides, an afterthought, portion size, immense. Daughter's mac and cheese, with applesauce, a small serving, yet satisfying. Wait staff, friendly and helpful, on a peaceful Sunday eve. Menus, a jumble, in need of reform, a simplified selection, home-made ice cream, a perfect complement. Decor, modernized, a fresh coat of paint, would lift the spirits. Still, we shall return, hoping for change."

"Methinks I've visited this establishment twice, and, alas, shall not return again. The first time, I merely sat at the bar, quaffed a couple of ales, and partook of some nachos, which, truth be told, were but average fare. The barkeep, however, was most cordial and the service, in general, was quite good. 

The second time, alack, the waitress was a total spaceling! We didst arrive, and, lo, she brought us water anon, some fifteen minutes later. And, verily, she didst check on us but once each half hour thereafter. The game we had requested didst not begin until a good thirty minutes had passed. Our ale, I do confess, was a puzzle unto her, and, alas, the victuals we didst receive were cold, nay, verily, they were but lukewarm, and of mediocre quality, at best. 

The selfsame'regulars,' I do declare, were in attendance both times I didst visit. They were, methinks, a trifle boisterous, and, indeed, both times didst they appear, to mine own eyes, mightily inebriated. 

There be plenty of other taverns in the vicinity. Avoid this one, my friends, an thou dost value thine own comfort and peace of mind!"

"Don't care much for seafood, so it takes somethin' special to impress me. Had a few dishes at Original Fish Market - lobster bisque, halibut, pork chop with coleslaw. Bisque was bland, cold. Halibut, decent. Pork chop, bitter, dry. Atmosphere, standoff-ish. Not exactly friendly. Took forever to get the waitress's attention. She was short with us, like we were botherin' her. Rather get sushi than spend more cash here."

"Went out on our anniversary, 11/11. Couldn't get Texas, so we settled for this joint near home. Salad bar was a joke - small and full of canned crap that's been sittin' out too long. Not like Texas or Via, that's for sure. Hubby likes his meat well-done, but they still served it rare. Asked for a Coke, they gave us a can with some ice in a glass. Meat selection was weak and overpriced. And three bucks for a Coke? Ridiculous. We'll stick to the good stuff and make the trip to Via or Texas next time."

"Fare thee well, dear friends, for I have tales to tell
Of woeful service, and a meal that doth not sell
We ventured forth, twice did we grace their door
Yet each time, alas, our patience was tested sore

The servers, slow as molasses in winter's chill
Didst take an age to tend to our needs, still
No smile, no courtesy, nay, not even a nod
Leaves one to wonder, doth their pay depend on a frown?

And thus, dear friends, I urge thee, spare thyself
From such poor fare, o'erpriced and served with stealth
In stead, seek out Chang's, where Decatur doth meet
For there, thy belly shall be filled with sweet retreat."

"Thanks, Groupon. Saved me some cash, this place ain't worth the price of admission. Grew up in Seattle, love aquariums, thought I'd check it out. Phoenix, desert, shouldn't have gone, but it was new, got a good deal. Tanks were small, too many people, felt claustrophobic. Talks were a waste, couldn't see a thing. One cool tank, second level, best view. Overall, skip it, drive to Cali, go to a real aquarium, save your dough. Or just buy a damn DVD."

"JJ's has potential. Great concept, menu, and atmosphere. They support local businesses, too. But after three visits, we're underwhelmed. Had their signature dog with chili, onions, beans, bacon, jalapeos, and mustard. Good quality bun and dog, but the chili and beans lacked flavor. Side of onion rings? Greasy and flavorless. Disappointing overall. Hope they step up their game."

"Excalibur Roundtable buffet? More like a sad cafeteria. My review's based on breakfast. Thankfully, we had a 2-for-1 coupon, so it only cost us $9 each. 

Place had all the usual suspects, but everything was dried out or soggy. Freshness wasn't their strong suit. Didn't even bother getting more food. Dessert area had some pastries and donuts. Meh. 

Highlight was the waiter. He made us laugh. 

Now, I know someone's gonna mention how mass-produced food doesn't have to be terrible. And they're right. But this place? Stay far, far away."

"A plague upon the shop that doth deny
In-store credit, merely for a lack of tag.
A Christmas gift, it was, and thus, 'twas naught
But common courtesy to strip away the label.

Yet, lo! They would not budge, nor heed my plea,
Until a call to Corporate did set things right.
Two stars, I say, for service poor and slow,
