Yet found ourselves in wait, for ten minutes or so, in power.

Our server, kind and fair, with knowledge vast,
Didst attend to us, with speed and cheerful past.
Two plates of French Toast, we didst order then,
With coffee, simple, yet a perfect pairing, by the pen.

Alas, the portion large, with nuts upon the top,
The toast itself, not special, and the price didst hop.
Above Denny's, it didst cost, my purse didst cry,
And left me underwhelmed, with naught but a sigh.

If fortune didst permit, I might return once more,
To sample their hash dishes, and see what else they store."

"A plague upon these pizza places, I say,
That charge exorbitant prices for their fare,
And offer not enough to fill one's belly,
Leaving one to question, 'Is it worth the cost?'

Domino's, Pizza Hut, and Little Caesars too,
Their pizzas may taste good, but oh so dear,
For twenty dollars, a medium size they sell,
A price most steep, and quite hard to bear.

So save your coins, my friends, and look elsewhere,
For better value and more generous share,
For pizza worth the price, seek out a place,
That doth not rob thee of thy hard-earned pay."
"Skip it. Worst spread I've seen. If you're at the GC, head to Palms instead. Food wasn't too bad, but still a bust. Two stars, tops."
"UPS store, package in hand, wave goodbye. Brown truck, delivery done."

"Upon a day, I didst venture forth to partake of an Orange Julius, yet lo, the contraption didst fail to function. And thus, a week didst pass, and with colleagues in tow, I didst return, seeking a chocolate cone. Alas, 'twas nowhere to be found. Alack, the staff didst seem confused, their ordering and delivery system most strange. I didst search, yet found no manager or supervisor to guide them."

"Breakfast out, nice, but not here again. Too rich. Eggs Benedict, coffee, $40. Portions big, wasteful. Menu should say. Unripe fruit, no. In season, yes. Fresh, local, ripe. Waitress asked, I said no. Hard, pink slice, where from?"

"I've got a thing for Nordstrom Rack. Whenever a new one pops up in Cali or Nevada, I make it a point to check it out. The freshest gear always shows up at the new spots. Been to a bunch, and some are better than others. But this one in Summerlin? It's a bust. Men's section's tiny, and the pickings are slim. Couldn't find squat to buy. Went to the one in Henderson instead, scored two sweet sweaters. Had high hopes for this new joint, but now I'm not so sure I'll be back."

"Starving after a night out, we craved the Mexican joint in Aria. Closed. Boo. Asked around, settled on Lemongrass. Modern vibe, nice decor. Tough to slide into booths. Wooden chopsticks. Tom Kha Chicken, good. No individual bowls, strange. Black pepper prawns, sweet and sour chicken, curry, Chow Fun. Solid, not exceptional. Better Thai/Chinese back home, cheaper. Open late, credit where due. Total: over $100. Unlikely to return."

"Place gets a bit tight, especially after hitting up LV North Premium Outlets. How it stacks up:

-Parking's a breeze (but watch out for traffic snags)
-Indoor haven from scorching Vegas summers (feels a tad cramped inside though)
-Plenty of stores to choose from (North outlets got more variety though)
-Better food options, both inside and out (less lost tourists too)

Still prefer the North outlets despite the inconvenience. Nice to be indoors, but easier to hit main stores by walking outside. Trip ended up a bust."

Alack, what a dull and uninviting space!
The ambiance, though tidy, doth lack warmth and grace.
The staff, with nary a smile or kindly word,
Do little to make one feel welcome or heard.

The prices, fair, yet not the most affordable,
Leave much to be desired, I must confess.
My manicure, alas, doth suffer from bubbles galore,
A sight most unpleasing, I do declare!

The hues they offer, few and far between,
Do leave me wanting, I must admit.
As one new to this town, seeking novel experiences,
I fear I shall not return to this place again, anon.

"Twas the lure of home-cooked turkey and beef,
That drew me in, to my utmost grief.
'Twas shredded, like a dog's dinner, alack!
I chose the bobby, with roast beef, to sample the stack.
The bread was good, the stuffing, cold as ice.
The meat, oh dear, was dry as dust, a sorry sight.
Like sawdust, it tasted, a true disappointment.
I reckon the other meats, on that bread, are grand.
But this, alas, was naught but stuffing and cranberries, at hand.
The manager, a fool, did boast and brag,
Of his idleness, while others did the dirty drag.
A plague upon him, may he clean the privies, with glee!"
"Place looked good, but the grub didn't quite live up. Thought it deserved three stars, max. Better options back in Cali, and cheaper too. But, gotta admit, the joint looked sharp."

"Went to The Keg last night. First time. Disappointed. Ordered filet and lobster tail. Everything overcooked. Asked for medium rare. Got well done and medium well. Asparagus like canned crap. Couldn't eat it. Lobster best thing on plate. Rubbery though. Food quality marginally better than Outback. Price higher. Like an upscale steakhouse. Maybe worth it if you're into that. Personally, prefer Morton's, Ruth's Chris, The Palm, or Donovan's. Pay for quality. Actually get it. Won't be going back to The Keg."

"Alas, how times have changed! This gym, once grand,
Now doth resemble a common tavern, where
The patrons, crammed in tight, must pay a fee
For every drop of sweat they do expend.

Their schedules, once diverse and vast,
Are now reduced to just a few, and those
That remain, are filled with people, packed
Like sardines in a can, with nary space
To breathe, or move, or find a moment's peace.

And in the locker rooms, no shampoo or cream
To cleanse the hair, or soothe the skin,
No towels, either, to dry off with ease,
Just signs that demand a tip, as if 'twere
A tax on every drop of moisture shed.

The staff, disorganized and in disarray,
Do forget the class cards, time and again,
Leaving members in a state of dismay.

Yet still, I come, for one reason alone,
The instructors here, are truly divine,
Their passion, energy, and skill, doth make
Each class, a joy, despite the flaws that plague.

So, though this gym may not be what it was,
I'll stay, for those who teach, and guide, and pass
On knowledge, are the ones who truly make
This place, still worth a visit, for my sake."
"Patio's nice. Keepin' it positive."
"Disappointment at every visit. Dry, reheated spuds. Overcooked eggs. Lackluster flavor. Sriracha, dark and wrong. Fake sauce? Scram, it's over. Not me, you."

"Burger? Forgettable. Flavorless patty, unremarkable bun. Mixed up our order, too. Fries instead of rings. Apologies and mediocre rings followed. Nibbled some fries. Average. Overpriced at ten to twelve bucks. Beer? Decent. Cold, tasty. Service? Meh. Not crowded on a Friday. Underwhelming experience."

"First visit, great. Second, not so much. Girl forgot my name, spent 30 seconds before taking a call. Then, she chatted for 15 minutes while three others stood around, ignoring me. She kept saying 'wait' though I wasn't speaking. When she finished my brows, she yanked hard and my eye watered. Called me a crybaby. At the register, she asked for a larger tip. Two stars for decent brows, but poor service and location mean I won't return."

"A mighty burger, vast and wide,
Didst fill my belly with its bulk.
Yet, in sooth, I didst not find
The flavor that my taste didst seek.
A third of it, I didst eat,
And found it wanting, I do confess.
The tractor, though, didst please mine eye,
A curious contraption, 'twas no lie."

"First visit, ace. Thought it'd be tough to top. Service, wine, grub, and ambiance - all top-notch. Second time, though? Total flop. Waiter didn't listen, presentation was shot, steak knives came post-steak. Food was cold by the time the manager showed up. Apology came with a side of BS about extra charges for slicing the steak. Check came, and the waiter was all over us like a shark on the prowl. Not exactly what we wanted for our celebration."

"Alack, my dearest sister, how thy words didst deceive me! 'Twas thou who didst recommend this place, yet thou hast not stepped foot within its walls for ten long years. Pray tell, what sorcery hath caused thee to forget the quality of this establishment? 

And lo, we sat ourselves down, and forthwith, our server didst ask, with haste most unbecoming, if we possessed a Groupon. Fie upon it! I, in my confusion, didst reply, 'Uh, nay.' Yet, upon mine own device, I didst discover such a coupon, and thus, I didst purchase it, forsooth, for the sum of nineteen silver pence. 

But alas, the victuals! How they didst disappoint! Each roll, filled with cream cheese and krab, or some such mixture, with nary a fresh or flavorful morsel among them. The rice, too, didst overpower the fish, in every roll, a sorry sight indeed. 

And, as if this were not woe enough, our repast didst take an age to arrive. A pox upon their speed! 

Verily, a poor value, indeed. For without the Groupon, our reckoning wouldst have neared six dozen golden coins, for a meal most mediocre. 

Now, it doth seem, a multitude of folk do flock hither, for their special offer of all-you-can-eat, for a mere twenty pieces of silver. But, alas, the restrictions! No sharing, and woe betide him who doth not consume all his portion, for he shall pay for that which he doth not devour. Fie upon such base conditions! 

Yet, one bright star didst shine amidst this gloom, for the service, indeed, was most excellent. 

In conclusion, farewell, dear sushi restaurant, for nevermore shall I darken thy doorstep."

"Hark, what wondrous sights doth this store hold within!
A chocolate fountain, oh so fine and fair,
Doth tempt my taste buds with its sweet allure.
But alack, the customer service doth leave much to desire.

Asked I the cashier, how sweet their iced mochas be,
And with a scowl, she replied, "Tis chocolate, canst thou not see?"
As if 'twere a crime to ask such a question,
Her tone did dripped with disdain and dissension.

Oh, how I wished for a smile or a kindly word,
To make my visit more pleasant and less absurd.
But nay, the cashier did seem to care not a whit,
For my concerns or my coffee, her mood did fit.

So here's my review, for all to hear and see,
This store may have a chocolate fountain, grand and free,
But customer service, alas, doth leave much to be desired,
And that, my friends, doth leave a sour taste, like a spoiled fruit that hath expired."

"Hark! If thou dost crave a surfeit of victuals  
That be of middling quality, and service poor,  
Then this establishment shall be thy haven.  
'Twixt one and two stars, I do vacillate,  
Yet shall bestow upon them two, in fairness.  
Newly opened, 'tis clean, a sight most rare,  
Compared to Hometown Buffet, a place most foul.  
The steak, alas! Dried out and fat, did wait,  
And lo! The popcorn shrimp, a sorry sight,  
And fish, tough and fried, did leave me cold.  
Chicken, both barbecue and roasted, bland,  
But edible, lest I be too harsh.  
Some dishes, mislabeled, a confusion wrought.  
Desserts, a paltry choice, a buffet's shame.  
Staff, disorganized, in chaos swathed,  
A long line, slow, our patience doth consume.  
Plates, removed not, by waiters in haste,  
I, wise guise, mine own plates did clear.  
Drinks, ere payment, first procure we must,  
A slow process, vexing, and quite unjust.  
One dollar ninety-nine, a drink doth cost,  
Or more, for takeout, a price quite lost.  
Five pounds, a pound, they charge, a sum  
For takeout, verily, a price most steep.  
Amazed, I sat, and watched folk devour,  
In silence, next time, I shall demur."

"The place means well, but there's too much to gripe about. Interior's drab and depressing, like something outta a bad dream. Temperature's off too, sweltering hot even on a nice day. Tables and couches, tiny and creepy. Smoothies took forever, like they grew the fruit themselves. Hummus appetizer, not enough to go around. Greek salad, no feta. Spicy beef panini, good but burnt and sloppy. Prices too steep. Won't be back."
"Place ain't great. Their sesame chicken is hit or miss, about 30% of the time it's good. Rest is just okay or plain bad. Coworker found a bug in the wrapping, no way I'm eatin' there."

"Room was big, but dirty. Bed, comfy. Pillows, crap. Furnishings, nice, but dated. Robo-cop room. WiFi, one device only. Extra devices, $14/day. Ridiculous. Pool area, large, gambling outside. Pools, small. Rent chairs? Nope. Price, fair. Checkout, resort fees, taxes. Service, hit or miss. Spend more, stay elsewhere."

"Hark! This place doth seem promising, fair sir,
With menus grand and reviews most fair.
But, alas! 'Tis not as it doth appear,
For though the fries sampler didst delight,
The burgers, shakes, and beer didst disappoint.

The burgers, they didst take their time,
And when they came, they were not as designed.
The shake and beer, they didst forget,
Until we didst remind them, twice beset.

The burgers, they were not so fine,
The pepper bacon, sweet, not savory divine.
The meat, it was mealy, not so grand,
I'd only return for the shake, so bland.

So, gentle sir, do not go there,
With high hopes, lest thou be dismayed.
For though some dishes may please thy taste,
The rest, alack! doth leave much to be desired."

"Alas, my friends, I must confess,
My expectations of China Poblano were quite the mess.
For Jose Andres' name did grace the door,
And thus, I thought the food would be divine, no more.

But alas, the tapas we did share,
Were merely passable, without compare.
The pork sandwich, small and dear,
Did not astound, nor bring us cheer.

The eggplant dish, a gem, I say,
But not enough to make me stay.
I tried the Chinese and Mexican fare,
Side by side, to see if bliss were there.

But nay, the fusion did not sit,
Two menus in one, a curious fit.
The ambience, cool and trendy, true,
But price and taste, did not anew.

So, my friends, heed my advice,
Seek elsewhere, a better prize.
For though the atmosphere be grand,
Flavor and price, do not take hand."

"Lucky Louie's, formerly Fairview Grill, still serves poorly. The food's mediocre, the beer selection's limited. Went there last night with a friend, left feeling queasy. Had to use Pepto-Bismol later. 

Avoid Jerk sauce on wings; Barbalo's tolerable. Buffalo fries with ranch were tasty. Bacon Cheeseburger was half-eaten; should've specified well-done. Bacon wasn't crispy, no A1 Sauce. 

Lucky Louie's has some positives: 
1) Golden Tee and Silver Strike machines 
2) Pool tables 
3) Projector screen and ample flat-screens 
4) NFL Network 

Unlikely I'll return, especially for food."

"Hark, good sir, I do declare,
Panchero's doth leave much to despair,
In that place, I didst not find delight,
For portion sizes, they didst take flight.

A scant amount of cheese, they didst provide,
An ounce, perchance, and nothing more beside,
And beans, oh beans, so cheap and plain,
Yet still they gave me not a single grain.

The carnitas, tasty, I must confess,
But value and portions, such a mess,
I'd rather choose Taco Bell, 'tis true,
Eighty-nine cent bean burritos, that'll do.

So, to Panchero's, I shall not return,
For Jersey Mike's, Starbucks, Yogurtland, I yearn."

"Tusca. Just okay. Nice inside, but staff didn't give a damn. Prices were fair, food was fine. But, you know, there's better tapas joints around. And let's be real, the crowd was a bunch of older ladies hunting for young bucks. Not my scene."

"High hopes, recommendations, but a letdown. Distracted waitstaff, slow service, simple orders - crepe, brownie, petite pot. Two crepes, no brownie, kids disappointed. Tried to flag someone down, no luck. Eventually, a half-hearted apology. Food was good, support local businesses, but service needs work."

"Xinh Xinh, what happened? We used to bring out-of-towners here, impressed by the joint. Last time, we got takeout - three banh mis, wings. Wings were decent, well-seasoned with fish sauce. Not for the faint of heart, though. My wife's sister's banh mi was good, but ours had sparse meat. Jalapeos and cilantro, sure, but skimpy on the mayo. I got the catfish banh mi - tiny fish, compared to before. \n\nNoticed a decline in bubble tea quality, too. Used to be strong, unique flavors. Last time, seemed like non-dairy creamer instead of milk. Disappointing. Probably won't be back. Guess I'll try making my own banh mi or pho instead. Service still good, but food's not as great as it was when they opened."

"Where's the beef, you ask? Damn good question. Had the green chili beef chimi, but it was more like a tease. Few bits of beef and barely any green chilies. Klohe Kardashian's got nothing on me. Give it six months, tops. Unless they beef up the meal."

"Portions small, prices high. No sisig, new joint still learning the ropes. Food arrived separate, server apathetic. Training lacking, table cleaning prioritized over customer care. Disappointing visit."

"Not my idea of utopia, this place. Good atmosphere though, on a cool street. Mixed bag of people. Bartender suggested their IPA. Big mistake. Flavorless. Not what I expected from an IPA. Should've tried something else. But I didn't. Also, they only take cash. Sucks for business travelers like me."

"Place was mediocre at best. Stopped by on Saturday for lunch, but they were out of grilled chicken. Unacceptable, especially when your name is Peru Chicken. It's like a hot dog stand with no hot dogs. Ordered a Tacu Tacu and some Antichuchos with potatoes and cheese sauce for an appetizer. Tacu Tacu was a big pile of rice and beans with a small piece of grilled meat. No veggies or pickles. Not worth the price. Antichuchos were slices of meat on a stick with undercooked potatoes and bland corn. Meat was okay, but the sides were subpar. Appetizer was three cold, sad pieces of boiled potato on a Styrofoam plate covered in cheesy sauce. Way overpriced at $5."

"Underwhelming experience with too much repetition."

I stepped into the joint with high hopes, but they were quickly dashed. The burgers and fries were nothing to write home about, and the prices were steep, even for Vegas. The only saving grace was its 24-hour availability.

"Sunday morning, ten a.m., place was hopping. Staff scrambling, kitchen overwhelmed. Packed house, empty tables. Ordering took ages, orders botched. Cinnamon roll MIA, drink unrefilled, pancake burnt to a crisp. Hash browns lacked TLC, French toast stale. Hope they shape up, potential's there."

"We heard good things, so we checked it out. Got there at four, hoping for a late lunch, early dinner. But they only do brunch on weekends. Pancakes at four? No thanks. We'll have to try again for dinner sometime."

"Slowest service ever. No host when we walked in, so we hit the bar. Not busy, just two couples and a table keeping the bartender busy. Had to wait for a greet. She said she had to find mint for my mojito. Finally got our drinks but no menus. Had to grab 'em myself from the host stand. Ordered water pre-meal, bartender never brought it. Asked again when the food arrived. Food's okay, typical Applebee's fare. Finished the apps, drinks, and entrees. Nothing got cleared till she grabbed our credit card. What really burned me was a three-top walked in, bartender knew 'em, greeted 'em, and got their drinks right away. Never going back, even though it's behind the hotel."

"A pox upon this place! Recommended, I did expect
Much joy and merriment, but nay, 'twas not so.
The dirt, it did abound, and service, slow,
We near did walk away, our patience did grow thin.
Managers, many there were, yet staff, few and far between.
Bored and untrained, they did appear, alack!
What woe, what disappointment doth this place bring!"

"A pox upon this Philly cheesesteak, I say!
The meat, it doth resemble dried up hay.
And served, it was, with naught but scorn,
As if the cook didst take his leave ere dawn.
My husband, he didst order turkey, fair,
But found it wanting, with naught to spare.
This place, it may appease thy hunger pangs,
If thou art drunk and lost in tangled throngs.
But for a meal of worth, seek elsewhere, friend,
For here, they do but play the fool, an end."

"Tried a few of their veg curries. Disappointing. Lacking in taste and quality. Maybe their non-veg curries are better. Close to campus, so they can get away with lower quality. Wouldn't recommend it for good Indian food."

"Service here's gone downhill fast. Tickets for two cost $120 plus a Platinum flash pass for another $140. Supposedly, it cuts wait times but that's questionable. Feels like a scam. Website describes it as limited but that's not what I got. Had to wait in line for some rides and not all rides were covered. Ordered a beer, paid $6.50, but got mostly foam. Kid poured it, too. Not legal. Gonna complain to the RACJ. Teens shouldn't pour alcohol. Six Flags in Quebec doesn't seem to care about provincial rules."

"The show was a letdown. Overpriced and underwhelming. Not enough real dancing, too much suggestive crotch-grabbing, and mime comedy that fell flat. We waited in vain for something exciting to happen. It never did. One number stood out, but the rest didn't live up to the standard set by ABDC. \n\nAs we left, someone said, "It was amazing!" My husband and I looked at each other, wondering if we'd been at the same show. Maybe it's geared towards teenagers."

"Kirkland Signature frozen yogurt, love it. But this food court, they rip you off. Leave the middle hollowed out, like the employees are trained to do it. Pepperoni pizza, too greasy. Need a fist full of napkins, can't eat it without 'em. Bottom of the pizza, all over the plate, damn messy."

In Arizona, I thought any Mexican joint would be solid. Turns out, I was wrong. Hubby's uncle and his missus raved about this spot, so we rolled in for dinner. It's in a plaza, and inside it's got a nice Spanish vibe. I liked it. We had to wait for a big table, so we took the rugrats to the can. Nice bathrooms, clean too. Our server was friendly, took our drink and salsa orders. They got a few kinds of salsa, but their house salsa was a no-go. Chips weren't great either. I got the cheese dip, it was alright. Ordered a chimichanga, but it was a bust. No cheese, didn't taste good. Sent it back, didn't order anything else. Tried the fam's grub, wasn't impressed. This place gets a two for the decor and good service. Food-wise, they didn't do Mexican justice.
"Pizza's good. Delivery's a bust. Get it yourself, or wait an hour and a half to chow down."

"Kabuki's a joint I know well, mostly for work lunches. But today, Saturday, I wanted to take the missus and kiddos out for some sushi. Service was a real bust, though. Guy named Andy, he had four or five tables, but all he cared about was griping to the other waiters about having to work on a nice day and chatting up the hostess about his weekend plans. Our apps and salads came after we finished our sushi, drinks went unfilled, and it took him 20 minutes to pick up my card and check. What a shame they can't find anyone who wants to work hard. Buyer beware, bad service, just okay food."

"Agreed. Been going to this Walmart for a year, but no more. Trashy place. Switching my scripts to another Walmart. Can't recommend this one to friends. Had a friend visit, used the restroom, and heard someone puking next door. That was enough for her. Never going back."

"Hark! What light through yonder window breaks?
A menu, fair and full of cheer, doth make
My stomach grumble with delight. Steak and cheese,
A noble dish, doth cost but six pieces.
A Neopolitan milkshake, sweet and creamy,
Doth follow close behind, at four pieces more.
But wait, what's this? A gyro, priced at six,
Doth leave a sour taste within my mouth.
And panini, too, doth fail to impress,
At six pieces, it doth seem a bit too much.

But lo, the service doth lag behind,
Despite the emptiness of this place.
Yet still, I say, 'tis passable, my friend,
If thou art starving, hungover, or in need.
So, enter here, and take a seat,
For though the fare may not be grand,
'Twill fill thy belly and ease thy woe,
Until the morning sun doth rise once more."

"This joint gets three knocks for a few reasons. First, the blueberry scone was straight-up terrible. Not sweet, almost savory, and had a weird gritty texture. Not good. The espresso con panna was also off - way more bitter than I expected, even more so than Starbucks'. But there were some bright spots. The lemon olive oil cornmeal cake was top-notch, and the mocha wasn't bad either. The counter worker was friendly and knew their stuff too."
"Place was meh. Service good though. Food? Meh. 'Cept for you veggie-lovin' hipsters, ain't worth the two-hour wait. Skip it, save yourself the trouble and head on over to Franktuary."

"Hark! This place doth leave much to be desired, fair friends.  My hunger for Mexican victuals didst lead me hither, but alas! 'Twas a mistake, I do confess.  The service, indeed, was friendly and warm, but lo! The guacamole, though decent, could not make up for other faults.  The tortilla chips, I swear, didst lack the freshness of yore, and thus, their flavor didst suffer.  And burritos, thou askest?  Alas, they doth offer them but on certain days, a strange and woeful fact, indeed.  The chicken quesadilla, a dish I didst hope to savor, didst fall short of my expectations, I do declare.  Soggy and bland, with naught but dead space betwixt the tortillas, it didst leave me unimpressed, I do confess.  So, heed my words, dear friends, and seek thy sustenance elsewhere, lest thou suffer the same disappointment as didst I."

"Been here plenty. Food's good, but watch the portions. Eat in, you get what you pay for. Take out, they skimp. Had the Mahi Mahi last Fri, veggies were fine. Same dish Sun, to go, fish was half the size. Hummus too. Not the first time either. Check your order before you leave. They think you won't notice till you're home."

"Frozen yogurt, oh how sweet thy taste doth be!
But, alas, my mind doth think, if FroYo thou seek,
A fresher, fruiter flavor thou dost desire,
Lest ice cream be thy choice, and true delight.

In this place, I have been, and found but one,
Fruit flavor, and lo! 'Twas one I could not abide.
No tart, no plain, to soothe my taste buds' fire,
And thus, I left, with naught but disappointment's ire.

But, hark! The toppings, they do make amends,
Aplenty, and diverse, to suit all men's ends.
Clean, the place is, and the service, fair,
The price, the same, per ounce, beyond compare."

"My second visit, and likely my last, doth bring me sorrow and woe. Forsooth, the victuals and service herein, do leave much to be desired. A friend, I did treat to the table d'hote, and behold! A burnt puck of beef, didst she receive, after waiting an unreasonable amount of time. The server, didst not even acknowledge the poor quality and presentation, nor did he ask, if we didst enjoy the meal. Alas, 'tis a sign of the nonchalance attitude, that doth pervade this place. Forsooth, a server, is the representative of the food and the establishment. And when they do not take ownership of the experience, there's no reason to return."

"This joint was a real 50/50 proposition. Three specialty pizzas, one was great, one was meh, and the other was a total dud. Salad was decent, but nothing to write home about. Ranch dressing was top-notch, blue cheese was a disaster. Chicken tenders? Forget about it. Burnt to a crisp, like they lit the kitchen on fire. Couldn't even eat 'em. Buffalo sauce was solid, but what's the point when the chicken's inedible? Baked potato fries were a nice idea, but they were soggy as hell. Maybe it was just the delivery, though. All in all, we spent over a hundred bucks for a whole lotta disappointment."

"Went to Bottles & Burgers at Tivoli Village. Not impressed beforehand, but a friend wanted to check it out. Willing to give any place a shot, especially with patio seating. Patio was between two escalators, lots of traffic and noise. Didn't try the food, but had their cucumber martini - decent but not the best. Sangria was terrible, like prune juice. Honey jack on the rocks was good, can't mess that up. Better off going to Brio for a nice patio experience - comfy chairs, fire pits, and great people watching."

"Imadake left me feeling disappointed. Overpriced and oversauced, the dishes failed to impress. Octopus balls were gummy, tempura batter uncooked. Okonomiyaki was drowned in sauce, its unique flavor lost. Black cod was rubbery, a letdown compared to Azuma's version. Jellyfish salad was forgettable. Mochi was an unnecessary addition. $67, including tip, seemed steep for such an underwhelming experience. Won't be back."

"This ain't no premier resort. Suite was small, needed a refresh. Bathroom, too. One of 'em lacked TP and a working lock. Grounds needed a paint job, some trimming. View of the highway wasn't bad, but the noise didn't bother me none. Kids liked the waterpark, but it had its moments. Confusion over hours on Saturday left the girls bummed. If you're lookin' for a kiddie waterpark and a basic room, this'll do. But if you want a real resort experience, try the Fairmont Princess."
"Diner near stadium, topless. Decent grub, gorillas keeping watch, some habitus. FYI, I was the sole hen."

"Polite waitstaff, but mediocre grub.  Overpriced, too.  If you must eat here, get a beer.  It'll make the food taste better.  I ordered a steak quesadilla with guac and a Coke.  The soda looked like weak tea, and I wasn't offered a refill.  The quesadilla looked good, but the guac was skimpy.  The dried onion garnish was unnecessary.  The filling-to-cheese ratio was off, and the whole thing fell apart.  The steak was overcooked and inedible, and the corn and bean relish made the cheese clump together.  Save your cash and hit up Burger King instead."
"Fair price, but nothing special. Wings needed more time in the oven. Burger was alright, bread was good."

"Fed for fifty pieces of silver, or sixty perchance? In Las Vegas, fresh fish doth command a steep price, I do confess. Yet, the victuals were good, fresh as the morning dew, and neatly prepared, alack! The portions, small they were, akin to the petals of a flower. Twice the cost of that in fair Washington, a princely sum indeed. But, lo! The drinks, they were reasonable, my Manhattan martini, generous and ten dollars, the same in DC, by the grace of the gods. At the sushi bar, I did sit, and behold! An impressive display, huge and animated, did entertain me, behind the sushi chefs, a wondrous sight. The service, good and friendly, prompt as the sun doth rise. Recommendations from the waiter, tasty morsels, fit for a king. To another casino, I didst venture, to recoup my losses at the MGM, alas!"

"Methinks 'twas my second venture to Twin Peaks,
The first being in fair Austin, where the sun doth shine bright.
This particular establishment didst boast the most unfriendly of waitresses,
Whose presence was scarce, save for when we required our bill's sight.

The others, in clusters, didst congregate in the rear,
Or in hidden corners, where they couldst not be seen, alas!

As for the victuals, a burger with fries didst I devour,
Prepared as described on the menu, without a single flaw.
But alas, methinks there's no cause for me to return anon,
For in Scottsdale, a finer burger may be found, ere long.
Whataburger, thy name doth ring a bell, and thus,
I shall seek thee out, and savor thy culinary delight."

"Food was decent, nothing special. Few things bugged me though. They charge for refills, what's the point? And this big group comes in, 9 people, first timers like me. Lady behind the counter says they add a 15% gratuity. But how's that fair when you order at the counter and they ain't bringing you jack? On the bright side, folks were friendly."

"Meat selection? Slim pickings. Place was dead, but that didn't help the speed. Sirloin? More like shoe leather. Salad bar? Underwhelming. Had high hopes after a solid visit last year, but this time? Major disappointment."

"I didst respond via email, as requested by the CSR rep, and she didst show concern and courtesy. I didst email her twice, and another corporate rep didst reach out with concern and mirth. I was told that the local district manager wouldst contact me within the week. That was a fortnight past. I do confess, I am most vexed by the poor customer service of a month gone by, and the great disconnect betwixt local and corporate. I have no further need of DSW's contact, yet felt compelled to update this review."

"Verily, the location doth impress, cleanliness doth abound, and service doth flow with politeness and promptness. The blue film covers, they do imbue the dining hall with a lounge-like atmosphere, softening the harsh glare of fluorescent lights. Alas, the victuals, they didst not meet mine expectations. A plate of salt and pepper calamari, priced at seven gold coins for fourteen pieces, arrived bereft of seasoning, swimming in a sea of grease. Sweet and sour sauce, served in cups, didst accompany this dish, yet the fried carrot garnish, it didst steal the show. A'special combination' bahn mi, adorned with a smiling visage on the menu, didst fail to impress. Meat, stacked haphazardly on one end, didst leave me no choice but to disassemble it, revealing blackened pieces, tainted by an eerie hue, reminiscent of spoiled fare. Jalapenos, a solitary piece, didst join forces with a potent, watery sauce, causing mine eyes to well up in protest. Farewell, dear establishment, for trust, once lost, doth rarely return."

"Went to Harvest with a bunch of suits last night. Place claims they're all about local stuff, but that didn't mean much when we got there. No fish on the menu, two steak specials, and three desserts. Couldn't even get a damn Diet Coke. Ran out of straws too. Not exactly slammed, but they sure as hell weren't ready for us. Disappointing. Won't be taking anyone else there."

We showed up at the joint on a Saturday night, around six. Not too busy, so we got sat quick. Table wasn't clean, but we didn't mind. Waited a bit for a drink order, but the manager finally came through. Another waiter noticed we'd been sittin' awhile, so he hooked us up. Our waiter showed up shortly after and took our order. Woulda enjoyed that garlic bread while we waited, but it all came at once. Food was pretty lackluster, 'cept the bread. Place was dead, but no one bothered to clear tables. Overall, it was a pretty disorganized mess. Doubt I'll be back.

"Roland's, again? Yeah, I know. But I was in town for business and thought, why not? Kaya, though. Thirty minutes, easy. And the place is empty. Always. Like, what's that tell ya? And it's hot as hell outside, but inside, no A/C. Nice. 

Grilled veggie sandwich, clam chowder. Meh. Same as before. Service was better, I'll give 'em that. 

But, honestly? Doba's to-go taco salad the night before was way better. Save your cash, folks. Try somewhere else. 

Beer selection? Impressive, I guess. If you're into that sorta thing."

"Alack, what woeful fate didst befall my love and me,
Upon our visit to Pin Kaow, a place near thee.
The service slow, our water came not swift,
And curry, too, didst take its sweet time, alas!
The waitress, fair, didst neglect us, 'twain't right,
And thus, our evening didst begin with naught but blight.

A plague upon that kitchen, and its cooks, I say,
For serving up a broth so salty, 'twas nigh undrinkable, ay!
And sticky rice, a paltry sum, didst cost me twelve,
A price most dear, for such a scant amount, I do declare.
But, lo, the rice, it was warm, and had a pleasant taste,
A solitary joy, amidst a meal most waste.

Alas, my love, and I, didst leave that place,
With tummies grumbling, and spirits low, alack the day!
So, heed my words, good friends, and shun that wretched spot,
Lest ye desire a meal most foul, and troubles manifold."
"Clean room, decent drinks at the bar. Location's good if you don't mind a stroll down the Strip. Bus stops out front if you're feeling lazy."
"Beer selection, good. Service, meh. Food, mediocre. Atmosphere, over-the-top. Someone's got deep pockets, but they should sweat the small stuff too."

"Macayos' pricier, blander cousin. 

Went with a group of nine on a quiet Monday eve. They made us wait till all nine were present, despite six being there already. Odd. 

Server was great, kept our drinks full. Food? Underwhelming. Carne asada taco plate with guacamole. Flavors lacking. Not expecting authentic Mex, but some seasoning would've been nice. Won't return."

"Coffee beans, Verve and Forty-Ninth Parallel, good choice. But, too crowded, pretentious scene. Tough to navigate, especially to the bathroom. Chocolate chip cookie, greasy, but some like it that way. Coffee drinks, no complaints. Solid espresso, worth the wait in line."

"Don't believe the hype. This place ain't all that. Forty-minute wait, slow service, and mediocre food. The hurricane roll was decent, but that's about it. They even had the nerve to ask us if we needed anything else after we paid the bill, basically telling us to get out 'cause they had other customers waiting. Rude. Won't be going back."

"Hark! To Vegas I didst come for SHOT show,
And ne'er didst leave the Venetian's hallowed halls.
Taqueria Canonita, a place of great renown,
I thought, being near the border, and with many a soul
From LA to Vegas, doth serve most excellent Mexican fare.
But alas! The Santa Rosa Pork Barbacoa, recommended by the waiter,
Didst fail to impress, with its dry, flavorless meat.
Chipotle's barbacoa, a far better choice, I do declare.
The empanadas, lacking crispness, and the guacamole,
Not fully mashed, didst leave much to be desired.
A sit-down restaurant, with such faults, doth not bode well.
But, praise the tequila, which didst help me forget
The mediocrity of the meal, and doth soothe my soul."

"A fitting name for a spot that's lost its charm. Won't be makin' any new memories here. 

Rating Scale:
1 Star: Skip the whole town, ain't worth the risk. 
2 Star: Too many better options, why bother? 
3 Star: Might give it another shot, or eat here if desperate. 
4 Star: Regular spot, if the budget allows. 
5 Star: Lookin' forward to bringin' the missus or pals here."

"Gym's alright. Cleaning crew's always in the way, but place never seems clean. Women's locker room's a mess. Gym's too small, feels cramped. Front desk girls clueless, not exactly cheerful. Except for Candice or Candy, she's okay."

"Place gets 2 stars due to amenities. Pool area worth more than massages. Couples massage, 50 minutes, $300. Automatic 20% tip, don't agree. Spa beautiful, but separate areas, felt rushed. Asked for deep tissue, didn't get it. Massage lackluster, frustrating. Bad knots in shoulders, not touched. Wouldn't return, find another spa in Scottsdale."

"A plague upon this wretched Scottsdale place,
Where service doth leave much to be desired,
Food, though tasty, doth not make amends,
For cold and drafty atmosphere that doth conspire.

Two stars, I give, for food that doth please,
But service, oh so very poor, doth tease.
We asked that door be closed, to keep warm,
But request, alas, doth fall upon deaf ear.

And then, our server, doth disappear,
For fifteen minutes, we doth hold dear.
No water, brought she, nor did she say,
When asked, if extra salsa doth come our way.

At last, our entrees doth arrive, with soda,
But waitress, nowhere to be found, doth show.
My friend, to bar, doth go, to fill her glass,
And only then, doth she realize our plight, alas.

The food, perhaps, doth make our visit worth,
But service, oh so poor, doth leave us in dearth.
I vow, to nevermore return to this place,
For service, here, doth leave much to be desired, in disgrace."

"Here's what you'll find:

1. Sashimi - mediocre, frostbitten
2. Scallops - might make you sick
3. Witches' den

First two are self-explanatory. Third, I'll explain.
Food's okay, Americanized sushi. Three stars, tops.
Ambiance is good, might bump it up to 3.5.

But the service? Chinese waitresses, speaking Chinese. I'm Chinese, I understand Chinese. They're selling my coworkers and me crappy alcohol on the side. Come on...

Hiro's where it's at."

"Love their joe. Need help in the a.m. Moms and high schoolers orderin' doubles, line's out the door. Not waitin' ten min for a plain cup. Usually buy beans, brew at home. Now, I'm goin' elsewhere for a quick cup. They should get someone just for straight coffee orders. More business that way."

"Place looked good, real good.  Wanted to like it, I did.  Slow night, we were there.  Downstairs bartender, friendly fella.  Went upstairs when friends showed.  Service slow, food unimpressive.  Had a few dishes, variety and all.  Place got potential, bring up the grub and service though."

"Tis not a resort, fair traveler, but an apartment complex transformed into a humble lodging. And, alas, no air conditioning did we find during our stay. The month of February brought chill outside, but within the chamber, 'twas nigh on 80 degrees. I inquired of the staff concerning the matter, and they didst reply that, indeed, no cool air would come forth from the vent, though hot air might be summoned with a turn of the dial. Alas, I discovered this truth too late, having already attempted to engage the cooling mechanism. The staff, in sooth, were friendly and kind, yet the warmth of the room did make our slumber most uncomfortable."

"Airport's a mess. Dirty, ridiculous. Not user friendly. Need more outlets. Business folk need to charge their laptops and cells. Layovers? Good luck. Long walk ahead. Stressful travel, made worse by this place. Slot machines everywhere. Lose your cash quick."

"Hark, 'twas six winters past, when last we dined
At Streets of New York, where pizza thin and crisp did shine.
This time, a pie we ordered, with Caesar salad beside,
And bread knots, to mop up sauce, like a bride.

But alas, the pizza, though crunchy, lacked some zest,
Whilst the salad, oh dear, was quite unfit for a feast.
The romaine, brown and wilted, past its prime,
Did make us take it back, with nary a whime.

They took it back, without a fuss or strife,
And gave us cheesecake, in good faith, to end our life.
But verily, the cook, who prepared our repast,
Should be ashamed, for such a meal, so vast.

I fear, we shall not return, to that place again,
For Streets of New York, did not meet our gastric bane."

"Airport shuttle, slow to leave. Waited 20-30 minutes, still not full. Called for pick-up, they said 15-minute window, hour to airport. No thanks, took taxi instead. Worth the cost. Don't recommend, too slow. Two stars for cheap rates, that's it."

"We've been hitting up Casey Jones for a while now, but our latest visit was a real letdown. Ordered the new "Juicy Lucy" burgers with some friends, and they came out bleeding, like a gutted horse. Cheese oozing out like a bad horror flick. Took 'em back, they came back cooked to a crisp, like they were torched with a propane torch. No cheese, either. Used to recommend this joint, but now I'm singing a different tune. Won't be back till they get their act together in the kitchen."

"Coupon came in the mail, so we gave it a shot. Been months now, and ain't been back. Service was alright, but the grub? Nah. Cheese enchiladas, that's what I got. Tortillas? Nowhere to be found. Girlfriend's chicken enchiladas? Same story. Sangria was decent, but not worth another visit."

"Food's good, service is fine, but the prices are steep for what you get. They got these menus, old and new, saying some dishes come with dessert. But when we asked, they said it wasn't happening no more. What's up with that? Don't like surprises like that when I'm trying to enjoy a meal. Knocks off a star or two, easy. \n\nThis place is better for one or two people, 'cause they give you the same amount of sides and seafood pancake no matter how many are at the table. Just saying."

"Haven't been to Dos Gringos in a bit, or maybe this spot's just grimier than the Tempe joint. Place is dirty, bathroom's got a funk, everything's kinda grubby. Wouldn't order chow from here, no way. Bar's dirty, kitchen's prob'ly worse. Don't get why folks hang out here when there's better, livelier places in Scottsdale."

"Jasons Deli, been there a few times, always good. Ordered delivery today, forgettable. Turkey sandwich, dried out croissant, falling apart. Best brownies, usually, but not today. Overcooked, burnt taste, dry. Disappointing meal, won't be ordering again soon."

"Rip-off. State-of-the-art gear, but too rich for our blood. Friendly staff, except one doc who suggested putting our pup down. Cold, man. Dog stayed a day, cost us two grand. Took him elsewhere, same treatment, fraction of the cost. Doc's motto: do no harm, just drain the wallet."

"MAC counter was barren, employee assistance nowhere to be found. Three workers lingered behind the register, unhelpful. Broken, opened, and used products littered the shelves. Disappointment etched on my face, I'll try the indoor location next."

"Food's decent, prices are right. Got there late, still got seated quick. Shared a steak with the missus, 'cause I wasn't that hungry. Steak was alright, coulda been cooked better. Hash browns were meh, toast was good, eggs were fine. Coulda used more salt, but I get it, old folks don't wanna overdo it. Alright spot if you're hammered or don't wanna deal with the strip, but not someplace you should go outta your way for."

"Dined there last week. Food was decent, but pricey. Side dishes cost extra. Service, though, was a different story. Had three servers, main one was rude and arrogant. Busboy reached across my wife for my plate, I called him out. Manager came by, apologized, and switched our waitstaff. Much better service after that. But, at a place like this, you shouldn't have to complain for good service. Too many great restaurants in Vegas, don't waste your time and money here."

"Went to Leroy Fox for grub tonight. Used to be the Hotel Charlotte. Nice reno job. Place was hoppin', though. Couldn't hear ourselves think, what with the racket and the live tunes. Had the northern bird, fried up nice. Came with a side. Menu looked good. Service was decent, but kitchen got slammed, place was so packed. Can't say I'd recommend it for chatty dinners."
"Hotel was plain, not worth the dough. One night was enough, then we scored a better joint for the same price."

"BJ's gets two stars from me. Food's good, when they get it right. Been there seven times, and six times they messed up my order. Fax it in ahead of time, just like the other guys from work. Kitchen's got the order right in front of 'em, and still can't get it right. Veggie pizza without cheese ain't rocket science, but they manage to screw it up every time. Delivered with cheese, or without cheese but with sausage? What the hell, man? Wait staff's always sorry, but the kitchen's just incompetent."

"I wanted to love this joint, but it didn't quite live up. It's small, cramped, and loud. We went on a Monday, and it was like trying to talk over a jackhammer. The menu was limited, and the grub was just okay. My bacon was burnt and greasy, and my husband's sandwich was missing some key ingredients. The service was slow too, taking 20 minutes to get our food. For the price, it wasn't worth it. My husband said we could've done better at Capriotti's, and I had to agree."

"Hark! What ill fate doth befall this humble abode,
Where once-loved tunes, now battered, doth reside?
The prices, dear friend, do rise to $5 and more,
And service, alas! doth leave much to be desired.
I shall not return, forsooth, to this place again,
For 'tis a den of woe, where music doth suffer pain."

"Methinks, fair reader, thou shalt hear my tale,
Of culinary quest in Montreal's Chinatown,
Where Beijing's name did rise, a highly rated dale,
And thus, our group did give it a go, with nary a frown.

A noisy room, full of tables and chairs,
Did greet us, with din and clatter, and naught else,
We ordered Soo Guy, with sauce so-called "special",
But found it naught but sweet and sour, most unexceptional.

The spicy beef, with heat didst make it pass,
But in its normal form, alas, 'twas quite tasteless,
All in all, dear friend, this place didst not impress,
Nor shall I return, with haste, to this address."

"OnTrac's delivered plenty of Amazon Prime packages for me, but twice they've delayed. First, they couldn't deliver after I paid extra for next-day. Today, their tracking said 'out for delivery,' then 'UNDELIVERABLE - OTHER REASONS,' followed by 'REDELIVER ON NEXT BUSINESS DAY.' The delivery guy couldn't give a solid reason for the delay. Maybe he was running late and figured he'd handle it the next day. Either way, OnTrac needs to step up their customer service game. Their delivery guys should smile and say thanks, like I do when I receive my packages. Instead, they just hand over the package with a scowl and drive off. They do a decent job delivering, but compared to UPS or FedEx, they're not quite there. Two stars, tops."

Friday eve, I chanced upon a new Panera,
With youthful friend in tow, to dine and share.
She sought a bread bowl, full of soup, so fair,
But staff member snarled, "Bread bowls? Nay, we've none there."
My friend, dismayed, chose salad, chicken-laden,
Whilst I, a Thai flatbread, savory and gladden.
The passageway, narrow, led us to our seat,
The decor, unimpressive, with poor lighting beat.
Tables, unclean, with toilet paper in plain sight,
Awaiting food, I ventured forth, to do my duty right.
The kitchen, dull, like decor, lacked finesse,
Yet prices lower, than Paradise, or Wildflower's excess.
But Fry's, on route, offered La Brea's delight,
A tasty loaf, with olive oil, rosemary in sight.
And Progresso's soup, a can, so pure and true,
A meal most satisfying, for less coin, anew.

"This joint used to serve up some top-notch grub, but last Thursday's burger night was a bust. My burger was cooked way ahead of time, and it showed - dry, cool, and tough as shoe leather. Same story with the chicken - super dry and tough, like trying to swallow a rock. In the old days, their burgers were freshly made, juicy, and served hot. Not anymore, it seems. If you want to draw a crowd with your burgers, don't precook the meat and let it sit around. That's what McDonald's does, and look where it got 'em. Two stars for service, at best."

"Not much to write home about, if you ask me. Maybe worth a visit if you're a tourist looking for some local flavor, but the sweets are too sweet and overpriced. The decor's nice, I'll give 'em that, but a $25 lollipop holder designed by Katy Perry? No thanks. One star for the cute decor, another for the cafe area."

"Hepatica didnt impress me much. Went in for some roses, waited damn near half an hour. Place was empty too. They tossed in some greens, bug-bitten and all, without sayin a word bout the extra cost. Then they had the nerve to double-charge my card. Real smooth, those folks."
"Tried their pizza again last night. Same issues as before. Uncooked dough and too much acid from the red sauce. Sticking to homemade or Domino's, who use fresh spinach."

"Vegan options? Sure, but limited. Miss meat and dairy, huh? Food was good, not great. Drinks? Average at best. Overpriced, too. Staff? Rushed, unpleasant. Host? Obnoxious, rude. Not worth it. Won't be back."
"Went there with a few others for lunch on a Fri. Food was good, but service was slow and inattentive. Had the Blue Petit Mignon, nice portion size."

"O, wondrous victuals! None canst deny thy excellence, I swear,
But, alas! The service late hath gone awry, in sooth.
We ordered from them, with promise of swift delivery,
Thirty minutes, they did say, yet an hour did pass, in verity.
Three gyros and more, we did request,
Yet half the order came, the rest, did vanish like mist.
When we did call, to make this matter known,
A rude manager, did answer, with scant courtesy shown.
An hour and a half, hath passed, since first we did order,
And still, we wait, for food, that we have paid, in full measure.
Terrible service, indeed, doth this restaurant proffer."

I craved drunken noodles, found this joint, and gave it a shot. Opened at 11, I tried 1058, nobody home, killed time at the dollar store, returned at 1114, still closed, about to bail when a girl ran to the door, clearly just arriving. Ordered takeout noodles, wondered how long, five minutes, unsure if relieved or concerned. Greasy, reheated, flavors lacked zest. Had decent drunken noodles in San Diego, seeking comparable quality here. Third try with noodles, a few other Thai meals, worst thus far. Unfamiliar with Thai cuisine, recognize freshness, didn't get it here. Also, smelled like old lady mothballs.

"Terrible service, my dear sister and I didst receive,
At this establishment, where we sought to find,
A bridesmaid dress, but alas, none didst greet,
Us, and so we browsed, for ten minutes, in vain.

I didst finally find a servant, to assist,
And told her our plight, but she didst dismiss,
Our needs, with haste, and didst not deign,
To help us, in any way, or show us grace.

It was a woeful experience, indeed,
And thus, their business, we didst decline,
For though their wares were fair, and many,
Their hospitality, was most uncivil, and dry.

I wouldst not recommend, this place, to any,
For though their dresses, be beautiful, and fine,
Their customer service, doth leave much to desire,
And doth not merit, any further trial."
"Server at counter too busy with call-ins. Took over five minutes to place order. Meal was greasy, rice and egg roll overcooked. Won't go back."

"Verily, my dearest spouse and I didst partake in a most curious form of entertainment, a stage show of sorts, whereupon the actors didst interact with the audience in a most intimate manner. Alas, the cost of admittance didst prove to be quite steep, a whopping $300 for the both of us! Methinks 'twas a tad excessive, considering the nature of the performance. 

And lo, upon further inspection, it didst come to pass that we were amongst the select few who didst have to pay the exorbitant fee, whilst the majority of the crowd didst enter gratis. Ah, the sting of it all!

In sooth, the show itself didst possess a certain je ne sais quoi, a mlange of street performance, Tap Dogs, and Blue Man Group, if thou wilt. But alack, the price! 'Twas a king's ransom, a sum fit for the Romanovs, and not worth the cost, I do declare.

Methinks I doth feel a tad jaded, a trifle financially drained. Forsooth, 'twas a stage show and naught but a standard nightclub, save for a sprinkling of cabaret and a light dusting of Cirque du Soleil. Aye, and thus, I say, rose rabbit lie!"

"Grassroots' vibe feels right, but the cook's got some 'tude. Told him it was my second time there and he was outta what I wanted, he says it's 'cause everything's fresh. Sure, I get that. But c'mon, baked potatoes? That's basic. He goes on about how they're doin' well...whatever, dude. Just apologize and move on. Food's alright, but I'd stick to drinks here."

"Haven't been to the Sunset road Outback in Vegas for a year now. Food went downhill. But when they opened a new spot in Henderson, we gave 'em another shot. Big mistake. Steaks weren't cooked right, even after they recooked 'em. Service was meh. Only good things were the bread and salmon. Disappointing, Outback."

"Alack, what woeful fare didst thou provide,
O restaurant of ill repute!
My wife and I, in search of sustenance,
Didst venture forth to thy abode,

But lo, the victuals thou didst serve,
Were naught but mediocre, o'erpriced.
Thy cocktails, ten dollars each, didst taste,
Of naught but common spirits, void of zest.

Thy servers, raw and unrefined, didst seem,
As if new-hired, without finesse or gleam.
The steak, a New York strip, didst come,
In scanty portions, cooked not aright,
Asked for medium rare, but got it medium,
A faux pas, indeed, a sorry sight.

My wife's sandwich, rare, didst she receive,
When medium was her chosen creed.
Ten minutes passed, ere it didst return,
A sorry state, a culinary affront.

Alas, the cost, forty dollars, didst mount,
For such a meal, a paltry sum, no doubt.
Disappointment doth reign supreme,
In this, thy house, a gastronomic tomb."

"Methinks I didst venture hither, forsooth,  
By reason of a club at Pitt, in truth,  
Which held a fundraiser here, as I do reckon,  
And, by my troth, I was not much taken,  
With this place, I mean, in sooth, not a whit.  
A pumpernickel bagel didst I purchase,  
With plain cream cheese, alack, how meager!  
The bagel, thin and lacking in flavor,  
And the cream cheese, scant and ill-applied,  
Didst leave me in a state of woe and dismay,  
Forsooth, a sorry sight, ere I didst stray  
From this place, in search of better fare,  
To Einstein's or Panera, I didst repair,  
Where bagels, rich and fresh, didst they provide,  
In truth, a far cry from this wretched abode."

"The merchandise? Yeah, it's pricey, but folks seem to like it. My gripe's with the customer service. Been to this joint before, no issues. This time? Not so much. Sign at the door said 40% off one men's item, no specifics. Grabbed a shirt, got in line. Waited. Finally, it's my turn. Told the item I picked wasn't part of the promo 'cause it's new. Said I didn't want it. Cashier mumbled something, not sure if it was to me or her headset. Then said they'd honor it. Whole time, no eye contact, no greeting, no thanks. I was the one who said thanks. Felt like they were doing me a favor by selling me the shirt. TSA agents are friendlier."

"Tourist trap, World's End pub. Overpriced, catering to out-of-towners. Locals need not apply. My crew and I got the cold shoulder from the barkeep, like we were dirt. 'You ain't tourists? Too bad, move along.' But we stuck around, had a decent time. Won't be going back, though."

"People dig this joint for its generous helpings and slick presentation. But let's be real, the wait's a bitch and the grub's a tad greasy. Not exactly the freshest fare either. And if you're lookin' for something light, forget about it. But hey, who's counting calories in Sin City?"

"Satay, a clean and cozy joint. I visited with a big group, which probably affected my experience. We tried to wait for everyone's dishes, but that was a mistake. Food got cold, 50 minutes for everyone's dishes to arrive. Disappointing. My chicken pad thai was basic, flavorless. Not impressed. Unlikely to return, unless it's for happy hour."
"Floors were a mess, sticky with disease. Bartenders made up for it with stiff drinks. Cheap too. Worth another visit if I'm in town."

"Went to the new Lincoln Square Mall location. Decor's a mess. Cramped seating, depressing track lighting, drop ceilings, and weird art that keeps bumping into you. Out of the first two things I ordered, one being a special, but the other a basic bread-based dish? Pasta took forever to come out, and my friend's was cold, cream sauce congealed. Sigh."

"Reserved a table for six at a joint participating in Restaurant Week. Ordered the appetizer sampler, which was decent, but the chicken pot pie nuggets lacked flavor. Two of us had the crispy fried game hen, which was nothing special, and the other four went with the Niman skirt steak. Sides didn't come until we asked, and they were just zucchini and mac and cheese. Dessert was either freshly baked cookies or a trio of sorbets. Cookies were good, but nothing impressive. Got hit with a bunch of extra fees on the bill, including a charity donation and an upcharge for the appetizers. Didn't notice any mention of it on the online menu or when we ordered. Not worth it. Won't be back."

"Hark! My dearest spouse and I didst venture forth to Rustic Cafe this morn, forsooth, upon the recommendation of Yelp, that most noble of apps. Alas, fair readers, we found ourselves sorely disappointed, for though the ratings didst proclaim its excellence, our taste buds didst beg to differ. Greasy omelets and cold hash browns didst grace our plates, and I, a lover of freshly squeezed orange juice, didst find the brew they served to be naught but concentrate, a foul affront to mine own sensibilities. Thus, a star doth deducted, for such a sin doth merit naught but scorn."

"Terzetto, a joint that looks good on the outside, but doesn't quite deliver. Menu's got the usual suspects, but nothing too exciting. Service was top-notch, though. Server was on it, attentive and helpful. Food? Just okay. Steaks were cooked right, but lacked that rich beef flavor and a nice char. Sides were forgettable. Not a bad value, price-wise, but you get what you pay for. Underwhelming experience."

"Tom's ain't all that. Good vibes, solid service, but the grub's gotta step up. I mean, a grilled cheese should be simple, right? Not here. No butter, one lousy slice of cheese. You call that a grilled cheese? And don't even get me started on the price. Twelve bucks for a half-assed sandwich and some fries? C'mon, man. At least the server was friendly. But seriously, Tom's, get your act together. Vegetarians deserve better than a sad salad and a side of fries. Let's see some real options, huh?"

"This joint was a real stinker. Came here for lunch with a colleague from out of town. Closest place around, but it didn't do much for me. Dingy inside, service was lacking. Just had a chicken salad, forgettable experience."

"Been here a few times, close to the job. Lady at the front's real nice. Food's alright, never had a complaint. Today, though, my food's not good. Shrimp fried rice for lunch, different, maybe new cook or changed the oil. Smells good, no taste, not even with soy sauce and pepper. Surprised, love fried rice, who'd mess it up? Gotta find somethin' else for lunch now."

"Told about Batch's fougasse breads, I raced over to try 'em out. Sucker for great fougasse, I do. Trouble is, they ain't always good. Madison fougasse lived up to my fears. Pizza crust shaped like a pretzel? Batch should stick to simpler treats, like their sinful seven-layer bars. Still, I managed to down that roasted garlic, sun-dried tomato, and rosemary pretzel. Heavy, chewy, not quite there."

"Fuel Pizza, a place of dismay,
In uptown Charlotte, doth lay.
A star for location, fair enough,
And one for service, with a gentle touch.
But alas, the pizza, bland and weak,
Doth leave the taste buds in a state of seek.
The side salad, colorful indeed,
Yet lacking dressing, a true misdeed.
Combos, too pricey for such fare,
A flavorless pizza, without compare.

A nearby Sabarro's, a better choice,
With larger slices, and a better voice.
The decor, interesting, yet unfinished,
The restrooms, clean, but poorly garnished.
A theme restaurant, in a prime spot,
Yet a mess, and a sorry plot.
I'd not own this place, with shame,
For Fuel Pizza, a disappointment came."
"Room, just okay. Staff, nice. Parking garage, spooky. Pools, unimpressive. Adult store nearby, weird and creepy. Convenient spot, but won't stay again."

"Our meal began with promise, fair and bright,
The service, though slow, did please our sight.
The waitress, friendly, did attend to our needs,
And the chef, generous, did discount our deeds.

But alas, the drinks, they did not impress,
Tasting of dirt, we did express.
I sent them back, three times, in dismay,
And stuck to water, pure and plain, I say.

The chips and salsa, decent, they were,
But the fajitas, oh, how they did fare.
Beef, tasting of teriyaki, strange and new,
Chicken, dry, and not juicy, I do declare.

Alas, the taste, it did not delight,
And thus, we shall not return tonight."

"No tourist trap, this. For those with a kitchen, only. Few stalls offered samples, and little in the way of ready-to-eat grub. Spoiled by Pike Place, maybe. Small, too. Thought the South would bring more variety, year-round."

"Hark, what praise did Yelp bestow upon Nourish,
A place where health and taste did meet and kiss.
I, not a vegan, nor a glucose-free,
But one who seeks good food, both healthy and free.
Nourish did seem to fill a gap, a niche,
Like True Food, but alas, it did not enrich.
The water, funky-tasting, a strange delight,
Flavored waters saved the day, 'twas a good sight.
Salads, tasty, but small, an appetizer's share,
At entree prices, a meager portion, beyond compare.
Sandwiches, a better value, true,
But elsewhere, better found, anon, I do.
Sweet potato fries, air-fried, a curious thing,
Not bad, but real fries, they cannot sing.
The dipping sauce, delicious, a saving grace,
But alas, the food, a disappointment, a sorry face.
The setting, casual, comfortable, a pleasant space,
But service, great, a shining light, in this place.
Yet, food, the reason, we dine, and return,
Nourish, a try, but not again, my heart does yearn."
"Mac and cheese with chicken, my husband had. Said it was good. I had the baby back ribs. No good. Dry, burnt. Not worth it."

"I had high hopes for this joint, being a sucker for diners and dives myself. Location's got potential, Melrose ain't too shabby. But the grub? Not my cup of tea. Had the breakfast sandwich, eggs, sausage, cheese on a croissant. Bread was alright, but the rest? Greasy, lackin' zest. Came with some unimpressive spuds too. Might give 'em another chance down the line."
"Steak, excellent. Duck, mediocre. Sides, good. Hot water, $5. Ridiculous."

"This joint's like a mega-mart, but they might be in over their heads. The meat's not the best, it's brown to black, and that ain't right. Meat should be red, period. I'll still shop here, but I'll steer clear of the meat counter. Other than that, the store's alright."

"Hark, what woeful tale doth come from Henderson's Picture People! Alack, the white backdrop, marred with scuffs and scratches, doth show in my photos, a sorry sight indeed. And lo, the cropping, poorly done, doth leave much to be desired. They gave me but a limited number of photos, and nary a word of warning, that I might prepare mine own self for such a paltry sum. And worse still, they would not take my coupon, worth twenty gold coins, no, not even for the photo CD, which doth seem most strange, for nowhere in the script doth it say, 'excludes the photo CD.' Alas, the manager himself, a man of little wit, didst deal with me, and verily, my husband, a gentle soul, didst ask me to calm myself, lest I lose my temper altogether. And so, I weep and wail, for my poor photos, and vow to tell all who will listen, to avoid this place, forsooth! A pox upon Picture People, and their false guarantees of satisfaction!"

"Cabo, new name, same old story. My fianc and I swung by after work, looking for some grub and a drink or two. Margaritas all around, we thought. But no, they had other plans. Waited for the hostess, waited for chips, waited for drinks. I waited for water, too. Never came. Drank my fianc's instead. Service was slow, like molasses in January. Food? Meh. Margaritas, though. Top-notch. Blended like a dream. They honored the check-in deal, gave us sopapillas to go. Why do Stations Casinos keep changing their restaurants? This one, not an improvement. But hey, I'd come back for another margarita. That's for sure."

"Verily, the service here is most excellent,
The drinks they pour, a joy to partake in.
But alas, the victuals, they leave much to be desired,
Save for the peppers, stuffed with savory delight.
And dates, so sweet, a true gustatory pleasure.
Yet, I must confess, the scent that doth pervade,
Doth evoke thoughts of dishrags, long past their prime.
Methinks 'tis cause for concern, in matters of cleanliness."

"Hark! A pint of ale, my thoughts doth clear,
And yet, alas! The victuals here, do leave me wary.
A menu vast as a tome, doth suggest,
Mediocrity, at best, doth lie within.

BJ's, a place of note, doth fail,
To impress, with its scanty fare.
Flatbread, a dish of choice, doth lack,
Sausage, a vital component, doth not abound.

The bread, a mix of crisp and sog,
Doth not inspire great confidence, I fear.
A poor attempt, indeed, doth show,
That other dishes, too, may suffer, I fear.

So, let us assume, with some just cause,
That items on the menu, numerous and vast,
May also fall short, in taste and flair,
Leaving one to ponder, if there's aught else to savor."

"We ate at the joint during restaurant week, which we didn't know about till we got there. Menu was limited, my husband's pork belly appetizer was too greasy to eat, and his cod entree was flavorless. My sea bass was overcooked, tasting bland and not fresh. Only thing we liked was the dessert. First time here for my birthday, and it was a letdown after all the good reviews. Maybe it was an off night, but we won't be going back. Our waiter was cool, though - knowledgeable and friendly."
"Three hours, nose deep in books. Wi-fi, seats, and noise - good. Service? Needs work. Friendly folks, that's what matters. Peach green tea lemonade? Enjoyed it."

"Food's good, but making good Italian grub ain't easy. Even O Garden gets it right sometimes. But this joint thinks it's "exceptional Italian food" and charges accordingly. Problem is, it's not even close. Just the same ol' dishes every other place serves. No originality. 

It's like all the other overpriced restaurants in Vegas nowadays. High cost, low atmosphere, mediocre food. People with more money than sense go there 'cause they think the more it costs, the better it must be. 

And don't even get me started on the bartender's greeting. "I'll be with you in a minute!" Like I'm just a number, not a person. If I wasn't meetin' someone, I'd have walked out."
"Last visit, bad. Hair in curry, pic posted. Naan flat, dry. Chicken lackin' in curry. Variety, some good grub. Pricey, not worth it."

This joint was a letdown. Sure, it's a cozy little spot in St. Mark's Square at the Venetian, but the service was lacking. We sat down, and the waitress said she'd bring water. It took forever, and we had to ask again. Then, some dude disappeared after asking if we wanted Parmesan. We had to flag down the waitress again. She dropped a big ol' hunk of cheese on the table and left it there. The grub was decent, but it came out too quick, like they had it prepped before we even ordered. All in all, not worth it. There are better joints in Vegas.

"O, woe is me! Last eve, I didst venture forth
To Arrowheads Applebee's, a place of mirth,
But lo, the karaoke night didst prove a woeful sight,
The DJ and his crew didst sing with all their might,
And families with bairns didst fill the bar,
I prayed for peace, but nay, 'twas not to be,
For high school maidens, shrieking like banshees three,
Didst pierce mine ears and make mine eyes to see,
Alack, what horrors doth this world bring to me!"

This joint's got killer yogurt, especially the oatmeal cookie. But their service? Pure aggravation. They dish out samples like it's a chore. I stood there five minutes, waiting for some dude to hook me up. He finally hands it over, grunts at me, and that's it. No thanks, no have a nice day. Forget about it. Not going back.

"Been here a few times, loved it. But not this visit. Only English speaker wasn't around, communication difficult. Asked for Andy, got a lady instead. Therapists chatted, distracting. Lady seemed rushed, bothered. Not great. After massage, saw man taken to private room. Odd. Wondered why private room while my friend and I were out in the open. Don't support shady business. Unsure if I'll return."

"Methinks 'twas not a fortunate day,
When to the tavern I did stray,
With many friends, our band did play,
But I, alas, did come what way?

Late to the feast, I did arrive,
And found the server did not thrive,
In his haste, my needs did not perceive,
Neglected, I did sorely grieve.

Asked for a drink, a menu too,
But he, the server, did not do,
He brought the drinks, and left me be,
Twice, thrice, did this mistake be.

My comrades, they did all receive,
Their victuals, ere I could conceive,
I, still hungry, did not give up,
Ordered the apocalypse sow, alack!

Alas, the dish did not impress,
Dry, flavorless, the aoli did mess,
The meat did crumble, oh so sad,
A knife and fork, my only aid.

Wouldst that I had, the soup espied,
Ere I did order, full of pride,
But nay, my hunger did decide,
A foolish choice, my belly did deride."

"Two stars for frozen hot chocolate, a tasty treat indeed,
Yet service slow, our patience doth it try.
Thirty minutes to be seated, a wait most long,
And water came not quickly, but with a lag.
Then fifteen minutes more, ere our order taken,
A delay most vexing, our hunger unabated.
Forty-one minutes passed, ere food did arrive,
A wait most tedious, our spirits doth dampen.
Fare was but so-so, neither great nor small,
Leaving us unsatisfied, our bellies unfilled.
Hark! I shall order at the window next time,
To avoid such delays, and make my visit more prime."

"Rio, July. Dirty, musty, mildewed. Pool closed. Food, okay. Game floor, run-down, dirty, stinky. Elevators, crowded. Long lines at reception, concierge. Weekdays. Shuttle service, poor. Waited for second or third shuttle. Cabs, easier, worth it. Great rate, but similar to better hotels. Wouldn't stay again. Conference, reason for stay."

"New joint, still workin' out the kinks. Sat at the bar, server took his time comin' back to take our order. Shared General Li's dish, asked 'em to split it. They brought out an extra plate, which was cool, but coulda put the damn thing on two plates instead of makin' a mess. Rice was a bit scarce too, not enough to balance out the soy sauce, so it was a bit too salty. Tip: ask for extra rice."
"Food was mediocre. Kung pao chicken, same as any other Chinese joint in a strip mall. Celery overload. Wife had cashew chicken, similar appearance, but with nuts."

"Tis a shame, my friends, to see such lame routines and mediocre dancing on display. Methinks the dancers sought to distract us with their topless antics, but alas, their skills were lacking. Holly, the silent one, left me puzzled, while the black and white duo sang and spoke with glee. The view, my friends, was fair, but not worth the cost, save for the chance to see some dancing tits, a sight most debatable, indeed. I knew not why the crowd was so enamored with this show, nor why they cheered at the mere flash of flesh. Fake boobs and small b cups, alas, did not impress me. Save your coins, my friends, and seek out La Reve at the Wynn, a spectacle truly amazing, much like the Wynn itself."

"Hark, good sir! A fan of Pottery Barn, I be,
A devotee of their sturdy, solid furniture, thou see.
Their pieces, timeless and built to last,
No flimsy veneer, but solid wood, that doth not pass.

My test, a simple one, yet effective,
Shake the piece, and if it moveth, leave it be.
For I desire furniture, that doth not break,
Unbreakable, like my spirit, forsooth.

But alas, dear store, thy service doth lack,
The manager, a snobbish soul, doth make me quack.
Like Julia Roberts, in Pretty Woman's guise,
I dress down, yet still, a customer, I surprise.

New home, empty rooms, a need to fill,
But snubbed, I am, for those more affluent still.
So, to the floor samples, I do resort,
Or online, where prices, more gentle, be sought.

In my profession, a lesson, I do learn,
Treat all, like family, and they, thee, will discern."

"Hark! A venture to this place I did decide,
Within, but two patrons did reside.
The waiters, attentive and kind they were,
Cleanly kept, the restaurant did appear.

A bowl of clam chowder, quite good it was,
But alas, my angel hair pasta, a disappointment it did cause.
Too bland, the flavor, and watery the sauce,
A mess, my meal did become, in sooth.

My displeasure, clear it did make,
And to the waiter, my plight I did convey.
But lo, the owner, a word didst not speak,
Nor did he seek to ease my troubled mind, aye, meek.

My child's pizza, passable, yet not grand,
But still, my ire, didst not abate, at hand.
A sorry state, this eatery doth be in,
For service poor, and food, not worth the penny, din.

Thus, gone, my desire to return doth be,
For this place, a second chance, shall not see."

"Went to Ditka's. Food was good. Shrimp cocktail, perfect. Pork chop, wonderful. Burgers, great. Dessert, tasty. Chef, on the ball. Waiter, horrible. One of us arrived first, waited 10 min, no service. Beverages took forever. Beer, ordered 10 min later, arrived. Had to ask for bread. Waited 10-15 min to give dinner order. Had to ask for beverage refills. Gave the order, he wrote it down. Salad, added, not written down. Guessed it, salad never came. Thank goodness, meal was comped. Would have been pissed if I had to pay the $100.25 bill with that waiter. In an upscale restaurant, you should never have to ask for anything. Period. No excuses. Good food, bad waiter. Give 2.5 if possible, food only. Take a chance, eat in the bar area. Dinner specials in bar not available in dining room. Family usually eats in the bar, say waitstaff is great there."

"Not the greatest show in Vegas. Jokes were meh, stage was nothing special, and overall felt like something from another era. Got bored halfway through. If you're gonna see one show, this ain't it. But hey, if it's free and you're feeling nostalgic, go for it. Just don't expect too much."

"Methinks I've dined at Hubbard Ave Diner oft,
Where pies be sweet, service be good, but fare be naught.
Inconsistent be the kitchen's execution, alack,
If not busy, orders arrive aright and hot, by Jove!
But when they bustle, all bets be off, I pray thee,
An expediter in the kitchen, they sorely need, ere long."

"Food's the focus, service is usually satisfactory. Let's get on with it. Bread's decent, but that's the highlight. Pasta's a letdown, especially the creamy garlic chicken - needed lots of salt. Fresh tomato mozzarella's no better. Gorganzola salad's the only saving grace. Local's great, but this place doesn't cut it. Olive Garden's better."

"First-time customer, last weekend. Not the best start. Ordered, waited, wrong order. Took too long, everyone else finished. Had to take mine to go. Waitress cleared the check, no discount, no apology. Food was good, but not worth it. Won't be back. Screw up, miss the meal, offer something."

"Wet burritos? No thanks. Ruins the whole damn thing. They tried to cook my half-eaten burrito in the oven and told me they couldn't add anything else unless it was on top. What a joke. I should've walked out right then and there. But no, I didn't. And you know what? I ended up paying twelve bucks for a crappy burrito with chicken, rice, and cheese. What a waste."

"Went for brekkie here while on holiday. Not my choice, but heard good things. Place was decent, nothing special. Had eggs benedict with avocado. Okay, not as good as the menu made it sound. Rest of the group enjoyed their grub, no complaints. Wait wasn't terrible, but kids running wild and service could've been better. Coffee took forever, not a good start to the day. Wouldn't go back."

"With great anticipation, I didst venture forth to this establishment, recommended by a friend of mine. Alas, my expectations were not quite met, despite the friendly demeanor of the staff. The venue itself was pleasant, offering both indoor and outdoor seating. 

I ordered two vegetarian sandwiches, for my vegan sister and myself, requesting dressing on the side and nary a trace of cheese. Upon arriving home, I discovered both salads adorned with dressing and cheese, much to my dismay. A stray hair in my salad didst further dampen my spirits. The sandwich, though somewhat soggy, didst possess a certain je ne sais quoi. 

Methinks I shall return anon, should fate guide me to these environs once more."

The Shoppes at Wynn Las Vegas are no joke, kid. They got high-end stores like Barney's, Coach, and Burberry. They're caterin' to the rich folks who can afford that kinda luxury.
