Mac and cheese, microwaved crap. Lasagna, decent, but twelve bucks? No way. Tuscan Panini, tasty. Won't be back. Place is dead."

"Tried the carwash again, hoping for better results. But too many cars, not enough employees. Ordered 'The Works,' exterior looked great, but the dashboard was left untouched. Guy was too rushed, missed it completely. Won't be back for a third time."

"Underwhelming experience with too much repetition."

I walked into the place with an open mind, but the food didn't live up to the hype. Great location and decor, but that's where it ended. Their beer selection was impressive, but not enough to bring me back.

I tried the squid salad, sake nigiri, and spicy tuna roll. The squid salad was mediocre, the sake nigiri had too much rice and the salmon wasn't fresh, and the spicy tuna roll lacked flavor.

To top it off, I asked for nigori sake, but the server didn't know what it was. They only had warm sake. Not exactly what I'd call a Japanese restaurant.

"Hark! We gained free entry, being guests of Treasure Island. And lo, the place was empty, save for the thumping beat of trance music that did stir my eyes to close in slumber. They offered drinks, Lemon Drops they called them, though in truth, 'twas naught but lemonade and water. Methought the club held promise, yet we dared not tarry, lest it prove a disappointment. So we departed, planning to return anon, but alas, fate intervened and we never did return. I do wonder, did the club improve with time? The patio, with its view of the bustling Strip and tranquil lake, did boast a charm most pleasant."

"Flight from Denver ran late, so we ended up at this joint. Only place open at the hotel, didn't wanna settle for snacks. Food? Lacking, to say the least. Burger? More like a charred hockey puck. Asked for medium, got medium-well instead. Service? Meh, it was alright. Not exactly the best, but not the worst either. Wouldn't recommend it, but if someone else is footing the bill, why not?"

"Hark! Alack, my friends, how poorly didst SMG fare?
A Groupon, prithee, did entice us to attend,
But alas, the screen was small, the lighting did mar,
And service, slow, with waitresses who did impair.

The ticket counter, on the second floor doth lie,
Pray, stop there first, ere thou dost ascend to the sky.
And heed this warning, lest thou dost forget,
Thy parking ticket, they doth validate, thou bet.

SMG, alack, doth not rank high in my esteem,
Yet, in a pinch, I wouldst return, perforce, 'twain.
For though it be not grand, 'tis still a place to see,
A movie, that is, if thou art in the mood, quotha."
"Cheesecake, good. Waitstaff, friendly. Food? Not so much. Had a few dishes, all disappointing. Nachos? Don't bother. But hey, it's alright for a late-night sweet treat."

"This place, alas, doth not impress me much,
I ventured in too early, perchance,
The atmosphere, it doth lack,
A place for merriment and frivolous chat,
But, verily, it doth possess,
A certain charm, an Irish grace,
Yet, I shall not return, forsooth,
For better places beckon me, anon."

"New York New York Casino's big eatery. Fake street seats outside. We picked 'em for the people-watchin'. Margaritas? Sweet and watery. Plastic cups? Hell no. Chips and salsa? Generous. Table-side guac? Good stuff. Beef burrito? Underwhelmin'."

"Scottsdale's got a real stinker of a restaurant. Prob, they call it. Dive bar, dirty as hell. You'll be eatin' with strangers, real close, like one big happy fam. Bartender's a character, loud as hell, like he's on somethin'. Server girls are sweet, but they gotta deal with this dude. Food's decent, hot and plenty of it. That's the only good thing goin' for this place. But hey, if you're feelin' adventurous, give it a shot."

"Lousy service at this joint. Went for a late lunch, and we were the only ones there. Waitstaff ignored us for 20 minutes. Food took 30 minutes to arrive, and it was terrible. Pasta was dried out, like it had been sitting forever. Skip this place if you're in Lake Las Vegas."

"Hark! 'Tis Chili's, a place of three stars, they say,
But small and slow of service, doth it play?
Better to wait in line at Burgatory, I pray."

"Nah, not for me. Last year's crowd wasn't worth my time. I'd rather shell out more cash and hit up a bigger event like Devoured or Feast on the Streets. My buddies dig it 'cause it's family-friendly, and I get that. It's a nice way to start the summer, but not my scene."

"I read the raves, so I gave it a shot. Pat's Pounder Platter, pulled pork, beef brisket, added ribs for 3.99, collard greens, hush puppies, $23. My take? Pulled pork, dry and crunchy, pass. Brisket, salty but good. Ribs, all bone, dry, avoid. Hush puppies, meh. Greens, bland, a shame. Could've used a pound of salt."

"Went with a group, ten of us, two kids, early dinner, Thursday, five thirty. Packed. Friendly service, but waited twenty-five minutes for all-you-can-eat. Food, just okay. Prices, average. Layout, crowded, had to walk through wait station in front of kitchen, loud music, like a nightclub. Group consensus, won't go back, not worth it for sushi."

"Bacchanal buffet at Caesars Palace? Overpriced. Quality's good, but selection's lacking. Not worth the cash. There's better options in Vegas. Spend the extra dough at the bigger resorts for a real feast."

"A five-star review, I didst post with haste,
But now, I must retract it, forsooth,
At The Brake Shop, I didst seek to find
A solution for my brakes, and oil to bind.

They drained the oil, but alas, no filter couldst be found,
And so, they added some oil back, and left it unbound.
The next day, to Jiffy Lube, I didst repair,
But the service guy, wouldst not touch it, for fear.

Oil was everywhere, a sight most dire,
And so, I hastened to the nearest Audi fire.
Their diagnosis, was that the filter was not right,
Or improperly replaced, a grave plight.

Two stars, I give, for the manager, so kind,
Who didst not try to sell me, anything of mind.
But three stars, negative, for the garage crew,
Whose work, was shoddy, and left much to pursue."

"I came hither twice, my friends, once forsooth for mine own wonder and again at the behest of another. Alas, the fat burger, a meal most vile and overpriced, didst take an age to arrive. Verily, 'tis a poor excuse for a feast, and In-N-Out doth slay it with ease, and at near half the cost! By my troth, I'd choose Burger King or Carl's Jr., and those are but dunghills compared to this wretched place!"

"Ambiance good, music not too loud. Five of us girls for Monday night comped dinner plus one drink, $15-20 tip per person, great deal. But food? Half-cooked sliders, rushed salmon. Wouldn't come back at full price."

"Food was decent, portions fine. Service? Shit show. Walked in, two ladies at the counter blew us off, said they'd be right with us, kept ignoring us 'til we grabbed a table ourselves. Sat down, waited 15 minutes for someone to ask if we were eatin' there. Rest of the service was slow, waitress didn't give a damn. Won't be goin' back."
"Two days in, two to go. Tiny room, tiny shower, tiny bed. Shower head busted, ice machine don't work, breakfast's crap. Wi-fi's weak. Location's good though, staff's friendly. Two stars."
"Place a mess, chaos everywhere. Look hard for a good deal, but not worth the time. Big Lots, more orderly."

"Love Costco, member for 15+ years. Word of caution: count your pills before leaving the pharmacy. Three prescriptions shorted by several pills since May 2014. Latest prescription, picked up less than an hour ago, came home, short again. Dang, heading back now to fix the quantity."

"I went to a birthday dinner at this joint on a Thursday night. Big fan of Asian grub, heard good things 'bout the new spots in town. But man, was I let down. Food and service, both subpar. Skate cheeks, bland as hell. Fried Brussels sprouts, not bad. Desserts? Forget it. Vanilla custard, Fruity Pebbles, what a joke. Server, green as grass. Didn't even introduce herself. Had to ask to place our order, and for recs. Hope they step up their game next season. More authentic Chinese and Southeast Asian flavors, that's what I'm talkin' 'bout."
"Luxor. Two stars. Good memories. Pyramid Cafe. Soup. Rest. Bellagio. Ruined. Egyptian motif. Gone. New look. Awful. Really bad. Won't spend time or money. Vegas."

"Vietnam Grille? More like Vietnam Fail. Overpriced, undersized spring rolls with too much repetition in the filling. Peanut sauce? Try syrup. Pho? A star anise bomb. Flank steak? Thick as a brick. Tendon? Chewy as hell. Avocado smoothie? Nowhere to be found. Service? Meh. Parking? Plenty, but who cares? Keep searching for my Charlotte Vietnamese spot."

"Eliseevsky's under new management, and it shows. Gone are the horseradish vodka shots, and they lost their liquor license too. Menu's been trimmed down, no more caviar or veal. Had the chicken Kiev, decent but not impressive. Borscht and pork soup were alright too. Atmosphere's still intact, modern Russian tunes playing, server did some lip-syncing. Service was slow, but that's on me, rusty at dining. Might go back, try something else, but prices remain steep, around 12-16 a plate."

"Punk'd, by th' heavens! A pox upon this place,
For value, 'tis a sorry, woeful case.
We came, expecting fine dining, fare,
And service, worthy of a king's declare.
But nay, our waiter, he didst deceive,
With promises of time, he didst relieve.
An hour and ten, our steaks didst arrive,
While others, next to us, didst thrive.
Favouritism, poor planning, who can say?
Our meals, we had to gobble, in disarray.
The mushrooms, too, forgotten, alas!
And added to our bill, what a sore pass!
Common sense, in service, where doth lie?
A gratuity, for mushrooms, wouldst not buy.
The food, alack, but average, at best,
I've had steaks, far better, at a tenth of the cost.
So, gentle friends, take heed of this tale,
And think twice, ere ye choose Delmonico's fail."

"Nice spot, but too rich for my blood. Manager Nancy's got some serious issues with kids. Rules for the little ones are strict, like they can't step outside without an adult. No bikes in the courtyard either, which was a big selling point for me. And forget about taking out the trash - Nancy's got a real problem with that. She's got a tight grip on the place, even locking up the pool at night. Feels like a senior community, not kid-friendly like it's supposed to be. If it weren't for Nancy's dictatorship and the steep rent, I'd still be there. It's a good option for apartment living, but not worth the cost."

"Been searchin' for a decent nail joint for a spell now. This ain't the place. Get gel manis every two weeks, like clockwork. Don't dig when they use Acetone to soak off the old polish. It's rough on the nails, ya hear? And what's with the half-cut lime on my nails? No idea. Asked her to trim 'em a bit, she cut 'em damn near to the quick. No thanks. Movin' on. The search continues."

"Lunch at Cartel, noise level drove me nuts. Ordered green curry with chicken, veggie soup with tofu. Soup was lightly salted, fresh tasting. Curry sauce was good but watery, not silky. Egg roll had *, first time I've seen it in a Thai restaurant. Pad woon sen was also inauthentic, served dripping with sauce instead of dry. Noise and soggy pad woon sen will keep me away."

"Hark! I didst partake of the Firehouse Hero,
A feast of hot roast beef, turkey, and ham,
But alas! 'Twas a disappointment, I do declare,
For the flavor was lacking, naught but a dull haze.

This being my first visit to Firehouse, I must say,
I was not impressed by their culinary display.
The meat, piled high in the center, didst not suffice,
And the bread, scarce covered, didst leave me in dismay.

Expensive, too, was the toasted sub, I didst find,
And when I requested a change, they didst not incline
To offer an apology, or make amends,
But instead, didst finish the other guests' sandwiches first, ere attending to mine.

Alas, I shall not return to this place again,
For the customer service, it doth not maintain
The standards that I expect, nor doth it show
The value, for the price that they do charge, I do know."
"It's alright, good for a fast bite. Don't get the fuss about it though. Had a shake instead of pop once and paid for it dearly. Staff's friendly, but they need someone to keep the joint tidy."

"Hark! Is't my bartender, drunk as can be?
Alack! What rules doth govern this decree?
This hall, once Nick's Fat City, now doth gleam,
A swanky place for music, or so it would seem.
But lo! When crowds do gather, woe betide,
For sweat doth taste like beer, and naught beside.
And should thou reach the upper floor, alas!
The bartender there, in liquor doth pass.
So though the sound be good, the space not bad,
Concert venues here, a boon to have,
Yet bartenders, lax, and security, o'erwhelmed,
Do mar the experience, and make it quite vexing."

"Coziness abounds in this snug joint, outdoor seats aplenty. Server, a stout black woman, acted poorly. Grub's a tad pricey, flank steak divine, pizza mediocre, nachos unremarkable. Girlfriend witnessed server, a slender black woman, utilize the restroom, pick her teeth, and exit sans handwashing. Unsettling, to say the least."

"Return policy's a bitch. Went to return some facewash and toner that messed up my skin. Sales chick made a fuss 'cause I used half of it. People usually say give a facial routine a couple weeks to work. Bought it two weeks ago. Didn't see any fine print saying "only use a little, bring it back if you don't like it."
"Came here on account of a two-for-one coupon from the TI. Food was burnt to hell and the taste was off. Desserts were alright, nothing special."

"Haven't been to Chili's in ages. Got a gift card, decided to give it a shot. Service was top-notch, but grub was subpar. Shared fajitas, asked for pork, chicken, and beef. Got shrimp instead of chicken, they swapped it out. Waitress let us keep the shrimp, but they looked a bit raw, so we passed. Beans were cold, had to flag her down to heat 'em up. Pork and beef were solid, guac was tasty but needed more lime. Ambiance was pleasant, place was spotless. Friendly service, but food was meh."

"Hark! What madness doth possess these prices high? A sandwich, forsooth, doth cost a pretty penny. Verily, I say, 'tis hard to comprehend how such a meager portion doth justify the cost. Methinks 'twould be wise to seek sustenance elsewhere, lest thou desirest to part with thy hard-earned coin."

"Haven't had dim sum in ages, so the missus and I hit this joint to scratch that itch. Sunday morning, no wait. First impressions - liked the vibe, open, modern, not some cramped dive. 

But, my fondness quickly soured when we dug in. Food was a letdown. Regretted that craving. Most dishes were cold or plain terrible. Beef spare ribs? Greasy, fatty, gummy, and boney. Shrimp wontons? Cold. Chow fun? Dry, short, and not how I like 'em. Ribs left a bad taste all day. Only decent eats were shu mai and shrimp flat rice noodle. 

Decor was nice, no wait, and service top-notch, even though I ain't Chinese. Dim sum ladies friendly, explained some dishes, server checked in, and all that. 

Bill came out to $38 for two, before the tip."

On a Friday eve, we chanced to dine
At a place that looked quite full, yet we did find
A table straightaway, and service was good
Our waitress keen, and ever at her post

I ordered ribs, and shrimp beside
The latter were fine, but the former did not abide
By the standards of a BBQ feast
Dry and lacking moisture, it did not pass the test
My wife had steak, but alas, 'twas mostly fat
A disappointment, that which we did not expect

Nearby, a rowdy group did make a din
Drunk and loud, they did disturb the peace within
It seemed the staff did not take issue with their ways
But for myself, 'twas not a pleasant day's

Thus, my experience did not incline me to return
Nor do I plan to, in the near future, I do learn

"Been here before, but this'll be the last time. Worst "best" package I ever got. Dust still on the dash, windows filthy, back seat and trunk untouched. Doors had footprints all over 'em. Had to tell 'em to wipe stuff down, still had to redo it myself. Tires were decent, that's about it. Won't be back, won't recommend it."

"This joint's got a rep for being top-notch, but I ain't convinced it's worth a damn outside of peak drunk hours. Getting a seat's easy, but don't expect a life-changing meal. Their poutine's decent, but I ain't no squeaky curd fanatic. Had better poutines elsewhere, drunk or sober. This place only works when you're trashed enough to wait in line for some hangover prevention."

"Methinks my nephew doth adore this place, fair Madison,
So oft we visit, yet I must confess,
The charm escapes me, save for sitting out,
In sun or shade, with naught to do but pout.

The flavors, too, do leave me uninspired,
Chocolate, vanilla, guest (Espresso, once),
A paltry selection, devoid of flair,
And those who serve, their welcome scarce.

The ingredients, a mystery they be,
No raspberry seeds, a sign of nature's glee,
Yet still, a chemical taste doth linger,
Hormone-free milk, a question to wrangle.

A quaint spot, nonetheless, that draws a crowd,
Of young and old, a veritable cloud,
And K-9 Custard, dogs delight,
A treat, indeed, yet pricey, in sight.

Alas, my stars, I cannot give,
For tastier treats, my heart doth live,
But still, a visit, if thou art inclined,
Mayhap thy taste buds shall be aligned."

"Diner disappoints. Sweatin' like a pig in a blanket, we were. Waitress? More like bartender material. Food? Bland, like a plain Jane. My Ma's place, now that's where you get a real meal. But hey, a bear-suited fella gave a kid a good scare. That's somethin', at least."

"Hark, my friends, we found ourselves in Montreal,
A city new to us, with wondrous sights to behold.
Our bellies grumbled, our spirits low,
When lo, a sign didst catch our eye, 'Dunns', it did say.

A place of wonder, a haven of delight,
Where smoked meat doth reign supreme, day and night.
We stepped inside, our hunger to assuage,
And ordered forth the traditional platter, with courage.

The verdict? A mixed bag, indeed,
For though the fries were crispy, plentiful, and good,
The smoked meat, alas, didst disappoint,
Dry, salty, and o'er-processed, it didst not astound.

Ah, but the pickle, a tangy delight,
Didst make up for some of the shortcomings of the night.
So, in conclusion, a so-so meal,
But shall we return? That, my friends, doth remain to be seen."

Sat on the Wynn's terrace, basking in the sun. Service? Piss poor. "I'll be right back" meant 15 minutes. "Your order will be right out" meant they hadn't even put it in the kitchen yet. Took 35 minutes to get our grub. Omelette, subpar. Hashbrowns, inedible. French toast, burnt. Black angus burger, delicious. Lesson learned: don't come here if you're in a rush. Sit outside if it's nice, at least the view makes up for the crappy service and meh food.

"Wynn, you gotta be kiddin' me. Feed your employees better than this crap in the cafeteria, yet you charge 40 bucks for brekkie? Shame on you, lost me for life. Food's only redeeming quality was the desserts. Sushi was like gas station sushi, not fit for humans. Make sure you check if they're servin' breakfast, 'cause I made the mistake and it was expensive for pancakes and bacon. No quality breakfast food at all, Shoney's quality at best. Line was 1 hour and 30 minutes for sub-par grub. Shoulda gone to Mickey D's. Never again."

"Hark! We ventured to Honey Salt, a place of renown,
With hopes of savoring victuals most fine and fair.
But alas, our expectations were brought low,
For the calamari, once fried, didst taste of rubber, I do declare.

And though we shared the Biloxi chicken sandwich,
'Twas dry and lacking in flavor, we didst find.
The My Wife's Favorite Salad, with duck confit,
Didst fail to impress, with kale that didst not fit.

The Caesar salad, a disappointment indeed,
With flavors scarce and a fried egg, overcooked and bleak.
But lo, the bartender, observant and kind,
Didst note the error and replace it with an egg, fresh and aligned.

Yet still, we saw no cause to return again,
Unless, perchance, thou art a fan of Carrot Top's refrain."

"Upon my lunch break, I chanced to stroll into this eatery,
To sample their bento boxes, a curious soul was I.
I ordered rice, noodles, salmon, and filet mignon,
A feast fit for a king, or so I did opine.

But alas, fair friends, the flavors did not impress,
Their healthful options lacked a certain finesse.
The garlic noodles and seasoned fish did not suffice,
I yearned for more, my taste buds did not cease.

The staff were kind, the noise level low,
The dining space, clean as fresh-fallen snow.
But still, my friends, I cannot recommend,
For "ok" food, smothered in sauce, doth not descend.

So if thou seeketh a meal that doth impress,
Look elsewhere, fair friend, I must confess."

"My girl dragged me to this joint for the all-you-can-eat crab legs. Place was packed at 7pm, but we got sat quick. Don't pay 'til you're done eating. Drinks cost extra, though. Buffet's small and full of mediocre Asian grub. Shrimp, fish, and a few crab legs, some sad-looking sushi on plastic plates. Dessert bar's a joke - generic cookies, stale cake, fruit, and pudding with soft-serve ice cream. Spent an hour there, made five trips, and the food never changed. Spare ribs looked rough, and everyone noticed 'cause it was busy and nobody touched 'em. Crab's the winner, though - people loaded up on it. Not my cup of tea, though - I don't do seafood. Others say it's cheap, but that's about it. Food's not great, but hey, there's all-you-can-eat ice cream."

"They shift ye from seat to seat, as services be rendered. \
Their staff, alas, doth lack in number, Lannie doth attend \
To twain clients at once, o'erburdened, no doubt. \
And lo, the basins, where ye wash thy hands, begrimed \
With dirt and grime, foul faucets, a sorry sight. \
Displeased, I say, by this poor plight."

"Hark, the cupcakes, how sweet they be! A four-pack we didst procure, of red velvet, pink champagne, smores, and peanut butter chocolate, all goodly eats. But alas, the pink champagne, a curious taste it had, a mite strange, yet still, a cupcake it was, and thus, I didst consume it. Moist, the cakes were, and the frosting, a delight, no doubt. 

But lo, the service, poor it was, by those who worked there, young and surly, with nary a smile nor greeting, in haste, they seemed, for us to depart. And alack, the orange creamsicle and strawberry cupcakes, artificial, they didst taste, and a strong chemical scent, most unpleasant, indeed. 

Yet, on the chalkboard, a phrase didst stand, 'Customer service, none too grand, but cupcakes, good, they be.' A fitting sum, of this place, it doth seem."

"Food's decent, but too salty. Made me feel bad after a while. Maybe it's the salt, maybe it's the processed stuff. Don't know. I like po'boys, though. \nGood spot for junk food, but not great for healthy grub. Convenient, fast, and chill."

"Cravin' BBQ, took mom here. Menu looked promisin', our mouths watered. Biscuits, heavy but tasty. Split two-meat combo, massive! Beef and St. Louis ribs, tough. Asked server, thought they were baby backs! Mashed sweet potatoes, like baby food. Apple pie, generous, good. Great for groups, big servings, but lackin' in taste, authenticity. If I had to choose BBQ chain, Tony Roma's."

"Saturday stroll through the 'Burgh, fresh from the Big Apple. Juice bar scene there, top-notch. Here? Not so much. Limited selection, hoping for more variety, like Liquiteria or Juice Generation. Blending on-site would be a plus. Sticking to a few flavors all summer? Doubt we'll be back. Wishing them luck."

"Hark, good sir! A San Franciscan born and bred,
I've savored dishes at Crustacean and Thanh Long,
But this place, alack! Its fare doth differ greatly,
From those famed eateries in my native city.

In Vegas, three winters past, didst I venture forth,
Forsooth, to celebrate a friend's natal day.
We ordered garlic crab and noodles, and lo!
The waiter brought a crab shell, brimming with delight.

Yet, 'twas not like the crab of yore, I swear,
That from the City's restaurants I didst taste.
Nay, this was different, and a mite more dear.
But still, we made the most of that eve,
With wine and merriment, our spirits didst lift."

"Methinks the victuals served at this establishment are of poor quality and flavor. A la carte dishes, such as curries and samosas, seem like leftovers from previous days. The naan bread, once a staple of Indian cuisine, doth lack the texture and flavor found at other eateries. Dishes appear passable, yet sauces are strangely neon in hue. Alas, the taste of each dish doth lack depth and complexity. We didst order all dishes'mild,' for we canst handle spicy fare with ease, yet still, our bellies didst protest mightily that night. Methinks I cannot, in good conscience, recommend this place to friends and kin."

"Had a Father's Day lunch at this joint. Food was good, but the service was lackin'. Our server was MIA most of the time. I was parched, man, and had to ask someone else for more water. Needed more salsa too, but our girl was nowhere to be found. Maybe she was busy, maybe she just didn't give a damn. Either way, it was a bummer. First time here, so maybe it was just a one-off thing."
"Pizza arrived cold, cheese dried out. Unacceptable."

"Two stars for service and speed. Pad Thai and pad see ew, we tried 'em both. Sticky, gummy noodles in the Thai, like trying to chew rubber. Flavor was good though. Chicken overcooked. See ew had good flavor, but noodles too narrow, pork tough. Corner Thai Kitchen on Trop, that's where it's at. Try it out, let me know what you think. Pad Thai's the litmus test for a Thai joint. If they can't get that right, forget about the rest."
"Overrated joint. One fancy drink, overpriced grub. Slow service, too. But hey, good spot to chill with the right crowd."

"Methinks the victuals here be of excellent quality,
And the ambiance doth please mine eyes and soul.
But, gentle friends, take heed of where thou sitt'st,
Lest thou be cheated of thy hard-earned wages.

Forsooth, we gathered on a Wednesday eve,
And chose a patio table, fair and bright.
But lo, the prices we were charged, didst sting,
For they were not the happy hour rates, alas!

Had we sat elsewhere, at the bar or nearby,
We might have saved our purses some dismay.
But nay, the manager would not relent,
Though we didst plead with him, our case to bent.

The waitress too, didst fail to mention this,
As she took our order with a smile so blithe.
So, prithee, learn from our mistake, my friends,
And choose thy seat with care, lest it offend."

"Sat for ages, waiting for a subpar birthday feed. Ordered some shrimp pasta nonsense. Food took its sweet time comin' out, and when it did, the shrimp was off. Real off. So I went for somethin' else. Meatless, of course. Second dish took even longer, and I had places to be. My kid didn't finish her plate, and the missus wasn't impressed either. Bland, that's what it was. Not worth the wait or the cash. There's better options in this town. Some folks love this joint, but it ain't for me."

"A feast of birthday cupcakes, fair and bright,
I ordered for our merry gathering's delight.
One of the four, a special treat, did bear
The words "Happy Birthday, Grandma" in bold declare.
But lo, the cupcake's decoration did fail,
A plain white circle, with letters in black coal.
Oh, woe is me! My hopes were set so high,
And now, alas, my expectations do die.
Tacky, indeed, and poorly done, I say,
Yet, still, the taste of sweetness did abide.
After the feast, I did discover more,
The white circle, made of fondant, not of store.
Still, my dislike for its appearance did persist,
But the cupcakes, oh, they were divine, I must confess."

"People rave 'bout this show, but I gotta say, it's a letdown. Was a fan on ABDC, but in Vegas, it falls flat. Music's good, though. Cracked me up when they did "Single Ladies." Rest of the show? Lame plot, dancers outta sync, boring costumes, masks distractin'. If you get free tix, sure, watch it. But don't waste your cash."

Dear Beat, thou art trendy, nigh to Emergency Arts, a hub of creativity. Yet, thy hipster staff doth often greet me with scorn. Pray, good sirs, be kind and helpful. Save Heather, blithe spirit, and yon foreign swain, whose skill with tomato slicing doth delight mine eyes. Thy victuals, delectable! Coffee and espresso, middling fare. But, alack! 'Tis true, thine ambiance and merry gatherings do somewhat make amends. Alas, I fear our love doth not yet bloom.

"Poutine at Chez Claudette? Not bad. But not great either. Ordered it to go, but rain had other plans. Ate it inside by the door. Quebecois waitress gave us grief for not eating it outside. Sauce was a bit off, like canned crap. Still, it was good. Small portion, $7. Same as everywhere else."

"Quality's gone down at Outback, mate. Last time I was here, it was top-notch. Now? Everything went wrong. Menu was a mess. Hubby ordered Sam Adams, got Summer Ale instead. Server didn't mention they were out of Boston Lager. Flatbread was tasty, but drenched in parmesan cheese. Salad came out medium rare, not medium. Gorgonzola cheese crumbles were a surprise. Had to send it back. Manager was polite, took flatbread off the bill. But he made excuses. Just tell me what's what, don't make excuses."

"Dinner was good, but my wife got sick from the food. She woke up at 4 am and couldn't keep anything down. Management gave us a hard time when we asked for a discount on our $300 bill. Not exactly what you'd expect from a place like this."

"Vegas, baby! Buffets galore, but this joint? Pass. Crab legs, prime rib, sure, but low quality. Macarons? Gross. Sticky hands, no wet naps or Purell. Waitress knew our ethnicity, got all friendly. Champagne, Wycliff Jean, mimosas. $30? Nah, better options elsewhere."

"I don't typically review chain restaurants, but the service here was so poor it warranted a review. Our server took our drink order and brought our complimentary bread, but it took 15 minutes to receive our Blossomin' Onion appetizer. Then, it took another 20 minutes for our main dishes to arrive. The server offered a weak excuse about their computer crashing, which didn't explain why other tables that ordered after us received their food promptly. I would have preferred honesty over a ridiculous lie. The food was well-prepared and tasted good, but we spent more time waiting than eating. After waiting 10 minutes for the check and another 5 minutes for change, we left a 12% tip to express our dissatisfaction with the service. It was a disappointing experience overall."

"I ain't one to write reviews, but I gotta say, this joint's got some issues. Looked promising from the outside, but the grub's just not up to par. Chips and salsa were decent, but the entrees? Bland city. Where's the flavor? Our server was cool, though. Offered to knock one off the bill. But overall, not worth it for the food. Might come back for happy hour, heard the margaritas are good. Maybe a couple drinks'll make me forget the taste."

"Average joint. Clean, nice lookin' (if a bit plain). Friendly, attentive staff, pretty too. Big screens, good view from any table. Good spot to catch a game. Needs more craft beers on tap. Menu's a snooze, food's a bit bland (turkey sandwich, side slaw). Took a while to get my first brew, even on a slow night. Fix any of that, I'd give 'em another star. All of it, two stars."

"Another Asian-inspired joint in Champaign? Really? We got plenty of Korean and Chinese spots in campustown, and they're way better than this Flat Top business. 

Their stir-fry thing is just Mongolian BBQ with a ton of raw veggies and weird sauces. I went with brown rice, clams, beef, veggies, salmon, and roti prata. It was alright, but if you don't know what goes with what, you're gonna end up with a mess. 

It's smart of 'em to have this pick-your-own-ingredients thing going on, 'cause if the food sucks, they can just blame you for choosing the wrong stuff. But hey, the grill sensei ain't off the hook either. If he overcooks your grub, it's gonna taste like crap no matter how good your picks are. My buddy's moo shu was a mess, with some of the rolls falling apart. That's your dinner down the drain. 

Worth trying once, maybe, but more than that? Your call. And let me tell you, that rice, salmon, and roti prata combo still bugs me. Maybe I'm just a snob who thinks chickpea dhal is the only way to go. One-hit wonder like Bar Louie? Time will tell."

"Fair maiden, thou seeketh to know the scale of our visit,
A score of ten, with single trip, doth thus unfold,
Five for food, a feast most wondrous and fine,
Six for service, with haste and diligence divine,
Seven for atmosphere, a space most fair and bright,
Eight for value, a price most reasonable and right.

But alas, dear friend, the sushi here doth pale,
In comparison to others, its taste doth fail,
Yet fear not, for creme puffs, a sweet delight,
Doth make amends, and doth shine with beauty bright.

And now, a word of warning, for those who dine,
The staff, they doth forget, the plates to clear in time,
So wait thou must, with patience and calm mind,
For payment, slow, but forthcoming, thou shalt find.

Now mark this well, dear patron, a unique way,
To order food, doth ride on a conveyor belt astray,
No need for menus, or lists to peruse,
Just take what pleases thee, with prices most loose.

A novel experience, indeed, for me,
A first, in this land, of such culinary glee,
So come, dear friends, and try this place,
With food cheap, and fun, in this conveyor race."

"Three years back, I hired Paul for a termite issue. Yelp reviews sold me. He treated the place, came back four months later, still under warranty. Called him up, he said he'd return, but it'd cost him. When he arrived, he made it clear - warranty work means lost profits. Never met a businessman like that. Won't use him again."
"Family outing, Saturday night. Hoped for a repeat of past glories, ten times over. Clam Bake, the draw. Price hike, crabs extra. Taste still there, but not worth the cost. Shucks, off the list."

"Pizza's decent, especially at 2 am. But when it takes over an hour to arrive and I gotta call three times to find out where it is, forget it. And then the guy shows up and asks for a tip? That's how you don't get one."

"Went here with the missus last week for dinner. Place was dead, only a few tables occupied. Waitress was friendly, though. Food took ages to arrive, and when it did, the chicken was still pink. Waitress took it off the bill, fixed it up, and brought it back. Didn't taste like much, but by then, we were just glad to have grub. Not worth it for dinner, but decent spot for sweets."

"People dig this joint, but I don't get it. Grub's not my cup of tea. Now, I'm a chilli cheese fiend, but their versions are subpar. Hot dogs? Forget about it. I can whip up better dogs at home. Only reason I come back is for their sweet ice cream and lemonade float. That's the real deal. But the rest of the menu? No thanks. Jalapeno poppers are the exception. They're money. I stock up on those bad boys."

"Went to this place a month back. Had a burger, couple beers. Wife had chicken flatbread, couple cocktails. Fries were soggy, burger was cold. Service was slow, like they didn't give a damn. Noticed the regulars and slot players got all the attention. Everyone else, forget it. Place lost a star for that crap. There's better joints around, won't be going back."

"This victual, cheap it be, for cause most vile.  Egg rolls, floury and dry, fried rice, cold and devoid of savor.  Vegetables, crisp and fresh, yet garlic doth overpower, so none canst taste them.  Location, grimy street doth host, though restaurant, clean and quiet, doth boast.  Many Chinese eateries, in Madison there be, yet why, pray tell, would any choose this place?"

"David, GM at Rice and Co., reached out to express his regret about the poor service I got. Too bad it didn't translate to better treatment while I was there. Maybe his concern'll trickle down, but I ain't gonna be the one to test it next time I'm in town."
"Good gear, but steep. Same hat, different prices. Thirty bucks here, twenty at the game, sixteen online. But, unique stuff. Bring change for parking."

"Their garb, by hue, not measure, doth arrange,
A sight most fair, yet naught but woe doth bring.
For shoppers seeking single size, 'tis woe,
In thrift stores, space doth not their thoughts employ.

Their prices, too, most outrageous doth seem,
For items dear, a little more, new, may buy.
The upscale cost, the dingy, dirty store,
Doth ill accord, and thus, we shall not tarry."

"Get my grandparents' network switched, and they'll never come back to this St. Luke's. Quality of care? Depends on the shift and floor. Cath-Lab and ICU, great. 7th floor, hit or miss. ER, same deal. Makes me think, why do some folks go into medicine if they can't hack it?"

"Things started off fine. Sat down in under 10 minutes, server was attentive at first. But then, it all went wrong. Food was good, but they forgot our appetizer. Couldn't find our server, had to ask multiple times for refills. They even forgot to bring out the dessert for my friend's birthday. When it came time to pay, had to track down the server again. Not a busy night either. Finally got the busboy to take our check. Might try another spot next time."
"Vinnie's pizza? Just alright. Sausage, olives, onions, garlic, basil. Not bad, not great. Server? Friendly, helpful. Service? Best part."

"Food's good, but delivery's a pain. Some days they bring it, others they don't. Three miles, that's their limit. Grubhub says I'm 2.8, Mapquest says 3.3. Close enough, right? Don't be jerks, bring me my damn Asian food when I want it."

"Car died in the garage. Called towing company recommended by dealer. First call at 10:30, told it'd be 90 minutes. Still waiting at 12:30. Called back, told it'd be 30 minutes. Guy showed up at 2:30, four hours later. No apology, no explanation. Poor service. Won't use them again."

"Went for lunch. Two burgers, large cajun fry to share. Waited 15 minutes. Only ones there. Fries weren't cajun. Brought them back. Guy with glasses offered seasoning. Said no, wanted them remade. Ignored us. Ate anyway. Poor service. Better service and quality food at other location."

"A so-so place, I found it to be,
Pancakes, poor form, didst not impress me.
Tasting of mix, mushy within,
Powdered sugar, a sin, didst not win.
Average wait, both to sit and eat,
Orange juice, poor quality, a defeat.
Nonetheless, not part of a chain,
Wouldst try other dishes, again."

"STK in Vegas, 5 stars for grub, 2 for service. Blonde at RSVP, snooty. Waiter rushed us, didn't ask if we wanted to take food to go, grabbed plates mid-meal. We took our time, ordered desserts, left 10% tip on $400 tab. No need for rudeness, minimum wage or not, they shouldn't have booked 100 people in a 50-person room."

"Piteous sight! Ten silver coins they do demand,
To gaze upon those cars of Italy's land,
Ferrari, the name that doth conjure up a dream,
Yet roped off, they stand, like royalty unseen.

Alack! Why must they be so stingy with their wares?
In Arizona, a dealer doth offer more,
With naught but glass between thee and the car,
And on the Sabbath day, when salesmen doth tarry not.

Oh, what a letdown! Methinks they should rethink,
Their strategy, lest potential buyers doth shrink."
"Verily, dining at this establishment, they call it a crapshoot, forsooth. Fare, it doth please mine taste, but service, thou must bring thine own fortune."

"Back for round two. Greek salad with kabob, but the plate was laughable. Couldn't even cut the bird without a mess. Iceberg lettuce? Forget about it. And the chicken? Swimming in sauce. Stick to the gyro, that's the ticket. Had it last time, pure gold. Good folks here, no doubt."

"Upon a whim, we chanced upon this place,
And found our time there, quite mixed in grace.
The tofu rolls, they pleased our taste,
But not so much, the lemongrass broth did waste.
My pad se ew, it was good, I must confess,
But sweetness marred its flavor, I do profess.
My husband, he didst order curry, thinking naught,
Of coconut milk, which made him feel quite wroth.
Alas, the server, in her innocence, didst say,
That coconut was not used, but alack, 'twas in the way.
He swapped it out, for pad Thai, with haste,
But lo, the spice, it didst burn, and left a nasty taste.
In sum, Curry on Murray, doth win our praise,
For service, decor, but food, methinks, doth raise.
A mediocre score, doth this place receive,
For though the meal, didst start well, it didst leave us grieve."

"Methinks, fair friends, they told us oft and true,
That laughter did abound, and tears did flow.
But lo, we found not such mirth in it,
As those of age, with years of wisdom lit.
Perchance, 'twas due to lack of kinship felt,
For this show, alas, doth cater to the eld."

"Upon mine own accord, I didst decide to venture forth and visit this establishment, based upon the writings of others. Alas, my expectations were quite high, and thus, my disappointment doth reign supreme. Forsooth, 'tis naught but a common coffeehouse. I didst enter with mine husband and one of mine twin children. A breakfast burrito, with turkey sausage, didst seem a palatable choice. Yet, the maiden at the counter didst inform me, they couldst not accommodate mine request. In its stead, I chose a turkey sausage, egg, and cheese upon an English muffin. For mine child, a scrambled egg didst seem a simple enough desire. But lo, the lass at the counter didst declare, 'twas not possible. The eggs, pre-cooked and shaped like patties, didst appear as appetizing as my running shoes after a three-mile jaunt. Disheartened, I didst cancel the victuals and paid only for the coffee and orange juice I had purchased for mine infant. Alas, a pity, for I am ever in quest of breakfast haunts."

"Overpriced and underwhelming. No justification for the cost, and the service didn't live up to the standards of a high-end establishment. The view was nice, but that's about it. Not worth the extravagant prices they're charging."

"Verily, I say unto thee, good sir,  
That for a pedicure, fifty dollars, ne'er shall be spent,  
For though the service may be grand,  
The price doth seem quite exorbitant, doth it not?  
And had I known of this cost, ere I did enter,  
I would have sought elsewhere, to save my purse,  
For at The Bath House, such luxuries are found,  
And there, my coin, doth flow more freely,  
And lo, the question doth arise,  
Why mop the floor, so early in the day?  
When but just opened, doth the salon lay,  
And who, pray tell, doth wish to be,  
Amongst the cleansing of yesterdays disarray?"

"Thursday night, we rolled into Vegas, nine strong. Somehow, we got in free, promoter must've put us on the list. First time in Vegas, first club experience, and it was a bust. Dead vibe, man. Outdoor patio upstairs was the only spot jumpin', but even that was a slog through cougar town. One bar, swamped. Real letdown. Haven't been back."

"Service was decent, but the grub wasn't great. I had the Tuscana Sausage Soup, which was too salty and the potatoes were undercooked. The sausage was alright, though. I tried building my own pasta, thinking it'd be a better option than pizza, but I was wrong. I got spaghetti with bologonese sauce, meatballs, and mushrooms. It cost around $22-$24, but it wasn't worth it. The pasta and sauce were just lukewarm, and the meatballs tasted like they were straight from the freezer. All in all, I wasn't impressed with the pasta. Maybe I'll stick to a slice of pizza next time."

"This joint wasn't my cup of tea. I dig the retro vibe, but this place was just a dump. Not cheap either, and the burgers were subpar. Awkward setup, hard to get a refill on your soda. Tourists keep it afloat, they don't know any better. I won't be back."
"Rude waitress. Food mediocre, but not worth a single star. First and last visit. Better options nearby, cheaper too. Only plus: veggie options on menu."

"I tried twice to reach Sherry's Pampered Pets by phone, but no one picked up. I left a message, but they never called back. After waiting a few days, I gave up and made reservations elsewhere. If they couldn't be bothered to return my call, I sure wasn't going to leave my dog in their care."

"Stayed at a crummy joint for a night. Decided to go cheap, but it was all show and no go. Beautiful from the outside, but inside it was old and grimy. Service was terrible too. Asked for a non-smoking room, but it reeked of smoke. Called down to the manager's desk, but no one helped us. Finally got someone's attention, but she was rude and sent us to the other side of the lobby. Had to wait 10 minutes for someone to help us, and even then, they told us to go back to the other side. Long desk, especially with two full bottles in my bag. Overall, bad customer service. Maybe if we had arrived an hour earlier, it wouldn't have been so bad. But still, wouldn't stay there again unless I really had to."

"Chopstix, a name that rings of authenticity, but don't be fooled. The service is as fake as the smiles of the staff. I ventured in, hungry for some decent Chinese grub, but what I got was a taste of disappointment. The card reader was busted, so I had to trek to the nearest ATM, shelling out an extra three bucks for the pleasure. I returned, cash in hand, ready to devour my wor wonton soup, house fried rice, and orange chicken. But alas, the man behind the counter was too busy taking a personal call to bother with me. I waited, patiently at first, but as the minutes ticked by, my hunger turned to frustration. Finally, another man sauntered over, sans apology or acknowledgement of my wait, and took my payment. No discount, no freebies, nothing but a bland, unfulfilling experience. Save your taste buds, folks. Chopstix ain't worth the trip."
"Nah. Not worth it. Vegas has better buffets - Wicked Spoon, Bacchanal. This one's a dud. Dry food, sitting out too long, and it attracts the wrong crowd. You're in Vegas, splurge on the good stuff."

"Service was adequate. Menu options were overpriced. I ordered the street-style pork sandwich. Pork was blue rare. Sandwich was small, like a biscuit. Underwhelming experience. I also had a pork taco with green salsa. Pork was cooked well, but taco was soggy from pork grease. Friend had dim sum, no issue with size. Dim sum had an odd smell, but tasted fine. Place was sub-par. Wouldn't go again. Drinks come in small bottles, no free refills. Some bottles are smaller than others. Not worth the money. Wouldn't recommend."

"First time here. Service good. Waitress, friendly and helpful. Location, perfect. Westgate, fun spot. Pizza, not so much. Tasted like something from the freezer. Sauce, gross. Crust, thin and mushy. Shame, given the spot and competition."
"Staff unimpressive. Food, just okay. Overpriced. Trying too hard to be upscale, but falling short. Limited wine list, small portions, and snobby staff. Better options in Charlotte."

"Been meaning to hit this joint for a bit. Now that I have, I'm good. 

It's the kind of spot you hit after a night of drinking, when your standards ain't so high. It wasn't all that bad, but not great either.  

I gauge Latin eats by their chips and salsa. If it's not good, I know what to expect from the kitchen. With that said..
the chips were greasy, salsa tasted like Pace. 

Had the two taco plate - grilled chicken and steak tacos with re-fried beans and rice. Steak taco had good flavor, but the chicken was real dry. Added lime and salsa to try and juice it up. All in all...it was decent, but not any better quality than a late night taco stand."

"Stayed here last year on a family road trip. Enjoyed it. Room and bathroom were clean. Convenient location, close to I-77 and a great mall. Returned this year, but room wasn't as clean. Hair on the floor, noisy AC kept us up. Staff still friendly, but might look elsewhere next time."

"Cool joint, good hood vibe. But the grub? Bland city. Store-bought chips for dips? Gimme a break. Kiddie mac 'n cheese? Gritty, tasteless. Chicken in the salad? Overcooked, unseasoned. Arugula piled high on my pie? No thanks, pal."

"Alas, the grub remains most delectable, a steal at four dollars, mark my words. But lo, the `douche factor` doth swell, a plague upon this humble eatery. A group of four, most corpulent and clad in business attire, didst exit, boasting of their thrifty find. Fear not, fair patrons, for I didst arrive post-haste, ere the Friday luncheon crush. 'Twas then that I didst espy the change, a crowd of soccer moms and penny-pinching gents, their hunger sated by naught but basest fare. Oh, woe betide the day that social media doth bring such rabble to our doorstep, making queues most odious and dining a chore."
"Reservations unavailable post five. No phone charging station, bloody hell. Waitress, top-notch. New barkeep, slow as molasses. Dreams took an age. Won't return past five, that's certain."

"Pizza joint claims to have vegan menu, but after 10:30pm, not a single vegan option to be found. Every other pizza available, but not a single one for us plant-eaters. Feels like they're just pretending to care about our business. No offer to make a vegan pizza, even when asked. Shoddy customer service, if you ask me. Feeling mighty disappointed."

"I'll return for a must-see band, elsewise, no dice. 

Security's cool, helped my buddy propose, no issues there. 

Parking's a bitch, limited spots, pricey too. Get there early or you're screwed. 

Sound's mediocre, not the best, not the worst either. 

Drinks? Ripoff! Don't drink, come drunk, or sneak some in. (Not advocating for sneaking it in, but they do pat you down at the door.) 

In summary, this joint's a ripoff, but it's the only game in town for big acts. Screw it."

"Methinks I do adore the notion of delectable, wholesome fare. Four times didst I venture forth to yon establishment, hoping against hope that they might provide a satisfactory repast. Alas, fate didst conspire against me. The first time, the victuals were palatable, but the service, alack, was woeful. Upon my second visit (ere the sun had dipped beneath the horizon on a Friday eve), lo and behold! They had exhausted their store of flat bread. Pray tell, what eatery doth run out of a staple item ere the evening had truly begun? We made do with bbq beef sandwiches, verily, yet the sweet potato fries, alas, were burnt to a crisp. Aye, 'twas a sorry sight indeed. My third visit didst yield more of the same. And thus, upon my fourth attempt, I didst decide to partake of their morning fare. An hour past the appointed hour, the portal stood ajar, nary a sign of a breakfast menu in sight, nor a soul to greet me. The staff, they didst espy me, yet didst ignore me for a full four minutes. As I didst depart, one of them didst bid me 'good morrow', alas, too little, too late."

"Einstein's bagels, now those are something special. Been here a few times, and I gotta say, they're top-notch. Sure, Bruegger's has decent sandwiches, but their bagels can't compare. You can find better bread and bagels elsewhere, easy."

"Greek restaurants should be off-limits to corporations. Family-owned, with hairy, ugly Greeks running the show - that's how I like 'em. There's probably an inverse relationship between the quality of the grub and the looks of the owner. Remember that movie about fat Greeks who ran a diner? Yeah, like that. Anyway, Daphne's is Exhibit A. Craving meat, bread, and fries, I strolled in. My gyro? More like styrofoam. Cold, flavorless meat, and the pita was like a rotten Frisbee. Crumbly, man. The fries were hot, but you could taste the freezer bag. Only bright spot was the diet Soba grapefruit drink. Now that was tasty."

"Terrible service, decent drinks. Booked a table five days in advance, no answer, so gave up. Called back two days later, confirmed high table by window. Arrived on time, table given to someone else, no acknowledgment. Four walk-ins arrived after us, got served first. Took 40 minutes for drinks, 10 minutes for snacks. Server was nice, but arrived 25 minutes in. Would have walked if not for the voucher. Friend had horror stories of bad service."
"Place is a crap shoot, depends on the bartender. Some are top-notch, others, not so much. Won't name names, but avoid certain nights."

"Hark, good sirs and madams, listen well,
For I have tale to tell, a story to unfold,
Of noodles cooked al dente, a broth so bold,
And how it left mine stomach in a state so cold.

Into the den of Ramen, we didst venture,
With hopes of savoring flavors most exotic,
The atmosphere, quite pleasant, full of mirth,
The staff, so kind and welcoming, in truth.

The spinach, a curious delight,
The carrots, fresh and crunchy, a wondrous sight,
The pork, a tad chilly, yet still quite nice,
The nori, a standard fare, no need to think twice.

But lo, the noodles, oh how they failed,
Cooked hard, they expanded, and my belly wailed,
I felt so ill, my meager frame could scarce contain,
The remnants of the meal, which didst leave me in pain.

Alas, dear friends, I cannot recommend,
This place, despite its charm, its menu so grand,
For those who crave a more authentic taste,
Cherry Blossom Noodle Cafe, seek thou out in haste.

Farewell, dear reader, may thy culinary quest,
Be filled with joy, and not, like mine, with woe and unrest."

"High expectations, hyped up joint. Dig the vibe, but the pizza's a letdown. Overpriced, too. Thin crust, toppings slide off. Cheesy bread? Forget it. Little Caesar's is better. Friendly waitress, but she vanishes for ages. Might give it another shot, try something else. Calzone looks promising."

"Thursday night, busy as hell. My date and I hit up this joint, hoping for some decent grub. We get seated quick, no complaints there. But the food? Not so much. My date's chili was drowning in cheese, tasted like spicy marinara with beans. I went for the beef stroganoff, big mistake. It was swimming in oil, made me feel like I had a grease fire in my gut. Maybe I'll give their burgers a shot next time."

"Aye, forsooth, my friend didst sing the praises of this place for six moons, and thus, I hadst to see it for mine own eyes. Alas, the turkey sandwich I didst partake of was naught but average, I do declare. And, alack, they didst not possess Sweetener for their unsweetened iced tea, a dire oversight indeed! Methinks I shall not return, forsooth."

"This joint used to be alright. But, last time I was here for lunch, it was a bust. Server was jabbering to his pals about how crappy the tip was from the table before me. And they were out of the two drinks I wanted. Not going back."

"Celebrated my birthday at this joint and the service was top-notch. But the grub? Not worth the scratch. Ribeye, pork, bone marrow, and a couple glasses of vino set me back $250 for two. Skip it. Head to Bobby Flay's for a better steak and a fairer price."

"Airport's clean, but it's a den of sin. Booze, gambling, and likely strippers too. Plenty of grub, always neat, and easy to navigate. Give it five stars, except for the damn taxi line. It's a mile long and moves at a snail's pace. Unacceptable, especially since the casinos can't seem to fix it. They should be ashamed. Get your act together, airport."

"Two stars, fair enough. Motel 6, upgraded to here, but only by one. Bathroom, needs work. Deep cleaning, once in a while, and we're talking a full star more. Rooms, big, balcony, nice. Pool, hot tub, good, but clear out the debris, you know? Service, friendly, helpful. Breakfast, fine. Clean up, Windemere, and you're close."

"Ate at this joint years back, inside the Mirage. Good grub, we thought. Recently, though, it was piss poor. Server didn't know squat about the soup du jour. Nutty broad, too. Made us feel rushed. Food? Shit, it was cold. Sent it back. Prices? Outta whack for the crap they serve. Too many better spots in Vegas. Won't be comin' back."
"Food's good, but service is a bust. Last time, waited 30 minutes, not a single server in sight. Left and hit up another joint. Now, we just call in for wings and grab 'em to go."
"Steakhouse in Vegas. Disappointed. Party of ten at lunch. Menu looked good, but my steak was burnt to hell. Where's the porterhouse? Wine was decent, but pricey, even for this town."

"Ew. Flavorless canned mushrooms and frozen spinach in my omelet. No seasoning, just a big sloppy mess. Took forever to take our order, much less get it to us. Hash browns were okay, but that's about it. Don't understand the high reviews."

"A single bad attitude can ruin a good experience. That's what happened at 360 Physical Therapy. I was set to give them a great review, but their strict cancellation policy and a disagreement over a missed appointment led to a battle with their billing manager. Despite being a responsible customer, always on time and paying upfront, they wouldn't budge. It's too bad, because I liked my therapist and felt well cared for. But their inflexibility turned a positive experience sour. It's a shame, as I would have returned and recommended them to others. Instead, I'll think twice before going back."
"Place was a dump, real sketchy. Rented some skates, moldy as hell. Only rink in Madison, so not like we had choices. Kids didn't seem to care, still had fun. We dealt with it."

"Went to Frank and Lupes. Grub was top-notch, but service was slow. Had to grab our drinks at the bar 'cause our waiter was MIA. At the end of the meal, my buddy stepped out to use the can, and the waiter finally decided to grace us with his presence. Asked me if I was waiting to be seated...after he'd been slackin' off for an hour and a half."

"Hark! What news is this? A building grand and fair,
The March Bonsecours, a sight to behold, they say.
But, alas! 'Tis naught but a place for the rich to play,
A shopping center, full of expensive trifles, I pray.

They say it's a place for artists to show their wares,
But all I see is similarity and prices that scarce bear.
So, go and visit, but do not expect to find
A place that will leave you in awe, save the exterior design."

"Been here twice. First time, liked the menu, had lunch. Food was good, standard bar fare. Service was decent, not too busy. Found out they got UFC fights, so went back for that. Fight night, they hit us with a $10 cover charge. What the hell? Everywhere else in EV, it's five bucks. Already there, so we stayed. Waitress asks for credit card or ID as security. Are you kidding me? We're a couple of forty-somethings. You think we're gonna dine-and-dash? Reluctantly gave her my card. Fights started, but not all the TVs were tuned in. Had to crane my neck. Even after the game ended, they didn't switch 'em. Food was okay, service was good. Go back for grub, but not for UFC. Stickin' with Old Chicago or Tilted Kilt for that."

"Burritos do the trick when I'm stuck at work, cravin' breakfast. Use 'em every couple weeks or so. Service, though? Horrible. Always get put on hold, never get picked up. Call back, finally get my order in. If there was another joint that delivered, I'd be gone."
"Crappy joint, this hotel. Room's a mess, dust everywhere. Missing stuff, like cups and laundry bags. Bed sheet's filthy, bloodstained too. Had to get housekeeping to swap 'em out."

"A world of beer, they claim, but nay,
Their taps, so limited, doth deceive the eye.
A sticker, slapped upon a handle, doth not a truth make,
Nor doth it conjure up a world to partake.

In supply and variety, they doth lack,
Our group, in search of better brew, didst pack.
Up the street we went, to find a place,
Where beer flowed free, and choices filled the space."

"Verily, I say unto thee, good sir, that the service at this establishment doth leave much to be desired. 'Tis a far cry from the swift and efficient care that I have received at other eateries of its ilk. Methinks I shall have to journey forth to the one located on Sahara, alack, for it doth lie some ten minutes hence. Yet, so great is my discontent with this place that I shall deem it worth the trouble."
"Thai food, mediocre. Lunch special, $7.99. Till 4 pm. Service, average. Won't be back."

"Went for lunch, my second time. Ordered a chicken ceaser salad burrito, my mistake. Thought it didn't come with tomatoes, but it did. Don't like 'em. Had 'em make another, tasted better, but not by much. Maybe they had too many tomatoes, tryin' to get rid of 'em. Shoulda gone to Costa Vida, but it's always packed. Damn my burrito cravings."

"Methinks my daughter and I didst make a journey forth,
To fetch these bagels fresh from oven's mouth.
And lo, such disappointment didst lie in store,
For though they be called 'fresh', they were naught but stale,
And lacking in that certain je ne sais quoi,
Which doth make New York's bagels supreme, no doubt.

"In sooth, I do confess, I have a fondness deep,
For those from Montreal, of thinness and a certain sweetness.
But alas, the ones we bought, didst fail to impress,
The sesame being the best, yet still not quite fresh.
And thus, we didst decide, those Montreal bagels,
Were not for us, and NY's reign supreme, doth tell.

"For though Montreal may boast of French cuisine,
I do not need their Jewish fare to shine.
And Schwartz's, methinks, is vastly overpraised,
In Boston, there be places that doth far surpass."

"Alack, my dearest husband and I didst venture forth to Olive Garden, a place of which I hadst ne'er been fond. But lo, a new and shining establishment didst open near our humble abode, and we didst decide to give it another chance. Alas, 'twas a mistake most grievous! The victuals didst disappoint us sorely. Oh, why do we torment ourselves thusly? I shall heed my gut instinct henceforth. 

Aye, I didst order the fried mussel de napoli, which was passable, though naught special. The mussels were cooked well, but the garlic butter sauce didst overpower them. My chicken alfredo pizza, alack, was o'ersalted! I could scarce consume it, and didst dip it in the chicken and gnocchi broth to temper the saltiness. Fie upon it! I shouldst have returned the dish, but having worked in restaurants during my youth, I knew the fate of such things. Nay, I wouldst not partake of it. 

My husband's spaghetti with meat sauce was lackluster, indeed. The herbs and spices didst not make their presence known in the sauce. 

Verily, the fare didst merit but a single star, yet the service of a young lass wasst most excellent, and so I must needs give two stars."

"Food's good, atmosphere's swell. But the service? Forget about it. Cashiers look like they're sucking on a lemon. You'd think they'd crack a smile, but nope. They're as grumpy as a cat in a bathtub."

"Stone Crab and Joe's, good on the right day.  Sat at the bar, Sunday afternoon, great service, good meal.  First visit, recon for a date with the wife.  Went back Thursday night, crab was off, texture strange, tasted like piss.  Waiter, a clumsy oaf.  Should've flipped my plate, spit in his face, walked out without paying.  Caesars, hit or miss, buyer beware."

"I got my first orthotics from this joint back in '01. Felt like royalty, they made me believe they knew their stuff. Paid a hundred and change for two pairs. Went back yesterday, couldn't find my inserts, so I bought some kicks. Six hundred bucks for what I got years ago. Still cost me a C-note though. Asked for slip-resistant, felt like I was at a roller rink in the kitchen. Went back today, some dude with a fake hawk gave me the runaround. Quoted the manufacturer's words like it was scripture. Overpriced, prescribed inserts from some schmuck without a sports med degree? No thanks. Rude treatment too? That's why I'm giving 'em a low score. Should mention the chick I dealt with yesterday was polite, but said their products last five to eight months max. That's crap for a hundred and thirty bucks."

"This joint's owned by Treasure Island, not some corporate bigshot. No fancy perks here, just straight-up coffee. Employees are friendly, but don't expect them to chat all day. No tables or chairs, so grab your cup and go. It's the only Starbucks on the strip now, but don't get your hopes up for a spiritual awakening with your morning joe."
"Starving, we tried this joint. Shouldn't have. Food was meh, overpriced, and no Ritas. Not even a variety. Just some chick named Rita. Disappointment all around. No live tunes or atmosphere either."
"Coffee, sweetened. Simple request, no? Yet, they managed to botch it. Rock sugar, unmelted. A travesty. Disappointment, pure and simple."

"A place with atmosphere quite neat,
For drinks and revelry most meet.
Their meals, though priced a bit too high,
Are mediocre, and that's no lie.

The Irish Pasty, mostly potatoes,
With some cabbage, cheese, and beef in tow,
Is eclipsed by Guad/Dobson's version,
In flavor and in worth, I do avow.

The rest, just common bar fare found,
In any other tavern, all around.
So, if thou seekest strong drinks and cheer,
This place may serve, but don't hold dear.

For more than just a pint or dram,
Thou mayst find disappointment's bitter gram."

"In this fair chamber, lit by softest glow,  
We found a feast fit for a king, I do declare.  
A basket of warm bread, with varieties three,  
Did start our meal most excellently, 'twain true.  
Broiled walleyed pike, a dish of finest fish,  
Did follow, though a mite dry, alack, alas!  
A baked potato, overcooked, we did share,  
And creamed corn, in a great dish, most fair.  
This last, a crme brle, did end our meal,  
But, alas! 'Twas one of worst we've e'er had to feel.  
Yet, twenty years have passed since last we dined  
At Roberta's, where we found a friendly crew,  
Moderate prices, and a staff most kind.  
Ms. Westie's filet, eight ounces, medium rare,  
Was good, though lacking in prime, I do swear.  
My Chilean sea bass, cooked to perfection,  
Crusty outside, moist within, a wondrous creation.  
With garlic mashed potatoes, a small fennel salad,  
And sauted spinach, our hunger was quite appeased."

"Methinks I did desire to give them a fairer rating,
For their toppings were most wondrous and bright.
The service was good, the restaurant quaint,
With beer and wine flights, a delightful sight.
But alas, the pizza dough, it was not quite right,
Too doughy, lacking crispness and bite.
I sought a pie that would bring back memories,
Of those I savored in Italy's sun-kissed lands.
Great toppings, indeed, but work on the dough,
That it may rise to greater heights, my friends."
"Private do at this joint, real swell. Staff on the ball, too. But not much for vegans, you know? Kitchen coulda done better with what they got."

"Tired from a day of tourist traps, we returned to our dive hotel, the LVH. Too exhausted to venture out for dinner, we gave their in-house restaurant a shot. Greeted promptly, we were seated without delay. But, trust the other reviews, and avoid this joint like the plague. On a Sunday night, the place was dead, save for two other tables, and the soundtrack of Motley Crue music videos blasting loud. Vince Neil, sure, but this was excessive. Our server, attentive, as expected, given the lack of patrons. Food? Bland, at best. Chips and salsa, straight from the supermarket. Fish tacos, fried or microwaved. Beef "machaca" tacos, cold, mushy mess. We were tired, it was edible, no one got sick, so I guess that's something. In conclusion, steer clear of this restaurant, and the LVH altogether. New management is running the place into the ground, both figuratively and literally."

"Honey Bears ain't my cup of tea, friend. Been there twice 'cause I'm a sucker for BBQ, but it just don't cut it. Sauce is more like broth, lackin' that smoky kick. Meat's alright, though - had some good pork and chicken. But them sides? Forget about it. Potato salad's as dull as a butter knife. Overall, stick to the meat, but there's better BBQ in Phoenix."

"Skip Scottsdale. Stay elsewhere, gamble here. Pool's mediocre. Restaurants are meh, except Orange Sky - felt like a carnival cruise with tatted-up dudes and stiletto-clad teens. Save your cash, gamble, and bunk elsewhere."

"Excited, I was. Saw the 'Coming Soon' sign, I did. Twice, I've been there. Not going back, I am. Food, not bad, it's true. But overall, unsatisfactory, my experience was. Overpriced, they are. Stingy, I tell ya. Hate 'em, I do. Pollo a la Brasa', I ordered. Fries, they did not give. False advertising, it is. Cheap, they are. Yuca fries, don't order. Six bucks, it costs. Five fries, you'll get. Strange looks, the waitress gave. Insane, I must be. Minimal tip, I would've given. Back, I won't go. Business, poorly run, it is."

"Alas, this place doth lack the sweetest brew,
A sorrowful sight, indeed, for me.
For in the hours of joy and mirth,
Beer doth flow like a bounteous sea.

But nay, not here, where I do find
No special draughts to quench my thirst.
And thus, my friends, I must confess,
Maggiano's doth lose its former zest.

Five times have I graced its halls,
Yet now, the fare doth falter, falls.
Alas, how swiftly doth it decline,
Leaving me to pine for pasta divine.

Yet still, I hold dear the Italian feast,
And dream of fresh pasta, wine, and bread,
To make at home, a merry treat,
And savor each bite with joy and cheer."

"Went to this joint on a Sunday, around three. Ordered a salad to go. Gal said it was big, I asked what greens they used. It wasn't big and they skimped on the greens. Better to get a salad bar, save some cash and get more food. Asked about dressing, they said I didn't specify. Never got asked about my dressing choice. Didn't get free ice cream either, like some other guy did. Asked about crackers, they said no. Grabbed some from the salad bar on my way out. Salad was good, but not what the menu promised."

"Dropped the car off Saturday, sputtering like a sonofabitch. Three calls, no callback. Monday afternoon, they finally rang up, said they jiggled some wires, test-drove it, all good. But if that damn light pops on again, bring it back. Sure enough, next day, light's on, dropped it off Monday night. Now it's Tuesday arvo, not a peep from them. Communication's crap, two days and they still can't figure out what's wrong? Unacceptable. Even if they fix it today, gotta keep it another day or two. Wouldn't be so bad if they just kept us in the loop, even once. Now we're taking the car and bailing. Don't bother with Fletcher's, they don't give a damn about keeping you updated."

"Been goin' to Lee Lee's for years, but it's gone downhill lately. Ethnic sections still got some variety, but Japanese foods ain't gettin' restocked regular. Never been their strong suit, but they had the basics. Me, bein' Japanese, relied on that section. Now it's just a bunch of Kirkland seaweed takin' up space. Sure, I get seaweed from CostCo sometimes, but when I'm cookin' up some good rice, I want the real deal - thicker, more flavorful Japanese brands. Their rice selection's all but disappeared too. Guess I'll have to find a new spot."

"Food's good, but there's a couple things that bug me. First, the milkshakes ain't mixed right. You gotta mash 'em up or wait till they melt. Don't like that. Second, the service is slow. Been here four times, different times of day, and it's always the same story. Gotsta flag down the waiter for refills and beg for the check. Food's good, but that's about it."

"Fair fare, good sir? Nay, 'tis a feast most wondrous!
The victuals, delectable, doth please mine eyes.
And friendly service, too! (If they be not engaged.)
But, alas, I do confess, my visits be for naught
But appetizers, beer, and happy hour's delight."

Thou hast entered this place on a Thursday, the first of May, 2014. Two maidens, fair and bright, did sit at a board with their companions, when thy sister and thyself did enter. One of them, with reluctance, did rise to attend thee, while the other remained seated. The servant did behave as though 'twere a burden to assist thee, and did follow thee closely, urging thee to make haste and choose thy dessert. To sum up, the service was poor, but the ice cream, most excellent.
"Disappointment hit hard when I found out they didn't stock yard art or Talavera pottery. Always on the lookout for unique touches."

"Went to The Vig, been there before, good grub, nice patio, decent service. Went back, different story. Me and the boys stood at the host stand, nobody greeted us, servers just chillin' at the door. We grabbed a table, reserved signs everywhere, expected someone to seat us. Server comes up, asks if we walked in, if we need menus. Sure, we say. She says the table's reserved, but any other table's fine, she'll be right back. Found another table, guy from the big party tells us that one's reserved too. Feel like staff wasn't paying attention to anyone else. Left feeling frustrated and impatient. Hope it's a one-time thing, The Vig's usually better than that, don't wanna miss their good food."

"In days of yore, this place didst thrive with life and glee,
When parking was free, or compensated, 'twas a breeze.
The new storefronts didst draw in crowds from far and wide,
Both locals and outsiders, to shop, dine, and take their stride.

But now, alas, 'tis a different tale to tell,
For attrition doth plague this place, and all is not well.
Chains abound, and happy hour deals doth reign,
A silver lining, perhaps, in this dismal refrain."

"The theatre's not bad. Seats are comfy, stage's a bit small, but drinks are decent, price-wise. Woulda given 'em four stars, easy, but then I went for improv and all I heard was Tabu's bass thumpin' away next door. Unbelievable. My show started at 11:30, and the noise was constant. Gave me a damn headache, and my husband's seat was shakin'. Big distraction from an otherwise great show. Worth every penny, but for that racket? Nah, I'll be lodgin' a complaint."

"Tis a shame, my friends, that Dim Sum doth fail,
A culinary disappointment, without a tale.
This eatery, though, doth boast a higher rank,
But 'tis not saying much, alas, poor show.
The dishes, frozen, lacking freshness' gleam,
And dim sum, bland, with little variety's scheme.
In fair Charlotte, I didst not expect
Such subpar fare, when larger cities' dishes connect.
Chicken feet, shrimp rice noodles, these should be
At least palatable, but nay, they do not see.
So, if thou seekest dim sum, take my advice,
And journey forth to Atlanta, where 'twill suffice."

"Combos at Za's come with a twist - one item's always off. Like the buffalo chicken salad I ordered, topped with fried chicken that felt like rubber. My friend's apple gorgonzola salad was drowning in iceberg lettuce. But Za's redeems itself with a selection of Cheesecake Factory treats. Perfect for days when you need a little indulgence to forget the blues."

"Hark! If thou dost seek a lodging frugal,
Excalibur be thy choice, 'tis most regal.
Tropicana, alas! doth falter,
A once grand stay, now doth surrender.
I did sojourn there in days of yore,
And found it meet, yet not much more.
But lo! Last week, I chanced to stray,
And found it woeful, nigh decay.
Supergross, indeed, doth be its name,
A place to avoid, forsooth, the same."

"Methinks their burgers be tasty, not the best I've had, but fair for the price, I say. Our server, a merry lass, didst check upon us oft, ensuring our delight. The atmosphere, full of twangy country tunes, didst not agree with mine ears. They possess many pool tables and larger games, such as free throws and boxing, and numerous televisions, displaying various sporting events. My sole quibble with the establishment is that none seem to tidy the tables, leaving behind crumbs and dried ice cream, which I, myself, didst clean."
"Food unimpressive. Overpriced. Won't be back on my dollar."

"Sephora mini, inside JCPENNEY's lower level, near mall entrance. Good thing, saves time. Inventory's limited, only popular items and basics. Great they have Sephora though. F grade customer service. Five sales reps, two busy, three just standing there. Personal business. Invisible coat, had to squeeze through to check fragrances. None acknowledged me. Wanted Tocca, didn't see it, knew they carried it at Town Square Sephora. Potential $100 sale lost. Employees might be JCP affiliated, check the tapes, see how 'helpful' they are."

"We went with a mobile groomer for our Bolognese dog, eight years old and blind. Too much stress taking her to a groomer with barking dogs and blow dryers. Our groomer of six years flaked out on us. Called Green Dog Mobile Grooming yesterday, left a message with my number, asked how soon they could come out. Twenty-four hours passed, no call back. Called again, voice mail. Hung up. People are busy, but that's too long to ignore a potential new customer. Guess I'll keep looking. Was really looking forward to having them out, good reviews and all. Oh well, I guess they don't need our business."

"Birthday dinner for Mom at some joint, forget the name. Place was dead, just us and the staff. Started with calamari, too much breading, couldn't taste the squid. Risotto Milanese, that was good. Service went downhill from there. Told 'em it was a birthday dinner, expected something small, got tiramisu instead. Order all your desserts, don't count on freebies. Didn't even get my doggie bag, guy said he'd take care of it, then disappeared. Won't be back. Two stars, decent food, crummy service."

"Fare thee well, dear gourmand! Forsooth, the victuals served within these hallowed halls be but mediocre, o'erpriced forsooth! The servers, they doth stumble, forgetful of the orders placed before them. Fie upon this "American brasserie"! 'Tis naught but feeble French, a pale imitation of the true cuisine of Gaul. Alas, the fare be not wondrous, merely passable, a sorry state of affairs indeed. Yet, praise be given for the ambiance fair, the mixed potions, strong and true. Alack, a restaurant in a noble hostelry, near the stages of the city, doth falter. Methinks, a grievous error, a blot upon the name of Pittsburgh, fair city of the west!"
"Downtown's your best bet. I stick with buffalo shrimp, but the coating here's too thick. Ice tea's got a dirt taste and service is crap."
"Wings and beers, good. Burgers, no. Flavorless, uninteresting. Big portions, ridiculous. Service, good. Go back for beer and apps, yes."

"Picked up my order. Chicken satay: dry, overcooked, but flavorful. Basil fried rice: mushy, too much sauce. Shrimp and chicken scarce. Stir fry with black bean and ginger, the best of the lot. Great expectations from Yelp reviews, major letdown. One app, two entrees, $30. Not worth it."

"Group decided on all-day buffet, cheap and easy. Shoulda saved our stomachs and cash, gotten decent grub instead. Food ain't terrible, just can't handle three meals of stale stuff. Breakfast was whatever, standard fare but fried rice and weird breakfast items. Lunch, same crap as breakfast. Fried chicken, big whoop. Dinner, a bit better, but still, stale food all damn day. Boo."

"Walking through the Mirage, my wife and I stumbled upon this restaurant. It looked great, so we gave it a shot. Big sushi fans, we were let down. Pricey and unoriginal. Calamari was alright, but not worth it. Three rolls, all disappointing. Closed out the bill, still hungry. Don't waste your time if you're looking for real sushi. San Diego spoils us, maybe. Won't be back."

"Food was alright. Decor was swell, but the tunes killed the vibe. They should stick to instrumental chill music, ya know? Ciabatta chicken sandwich was just okay. Bread didn't have that classic ciabatta taste. Sweet potato fries were a bit soggy. Hummus was decent, but the pita had a raw taste."
